loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.en:
Doña Maria lives with her 18-year-old daughter in her own home in the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. She has run a very well-stocked dry goods store for the past 10 years. Her mother and daughter help her run it.

There is a decent level of competition in the area, but Doña Maria's store is one of the most well-stocked, and her prices are very low compared to other stores in her neighborhood. She buys her goods in bulk in Camiri and Villamontes in order to offer such a wide variety of goods at such low prices.

With this loan, Doña Maria will buy merchandise to stock her store such as pasta, flour, sugar, rice, and canned goods (sardines, tuna, meats). This is her fifth loan with AgroCapital: she has been a client since November 11, 2003. She has been an excellent client and rarely if ever makes late payments.

loans.use: Buy dry goods (flour, pasta, sugar, rice, canned goods)

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou S. est divorcée et est agée de quarante ans.Elle fait du petit commerce de tissus qu'aprovisionne soit à Dakar soit au pres des grossistes du marché central de thies pour ensuite les revendre dans son quartier sise à Cité Lamy et depuis cinq ans
texts.en:
Fatou S. is divorced and is 40 years old. She runs a small business selling fabrics that she acquires from either Dakar or from the wholesalers of the central market of Thies. She later resales them from her home in the city of Lamy. She has been running this business for 5 years.

Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric sales

loans.name: Adalid

texts.en:
Don Adalid is 63 years old and lives with his wife in the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. The couple lives alone, since all of their children are now adults and no longer live at home. Don Adalid raises and sells pigs, and his wife works in a small hospital. The couple also generates income from ownership of a motorcycle taxi, which they rent out to the driver.

Don Adalid has more than 25 years of experience raising pigs. He will use this credit of 7,090 bolivianos (about US $1,010) to buy more piglets to raise and sell. He has always been an excellent client of AgroCapital.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina runs a small business, selling clothing items in Melitopol's busy central market. She is a widow with a son who is still in college. Marina has been self-employed in clothing sales for 13 years and is the sole breadwinner for her family.

Marina is a very determined woman, and she is serious about her business. These characteristics have helped her promptly repay all her loans from Nadiya Ukraine during her four years of partnership with our organization. Maintaining a reasonable pricing policy and client-friendly service have always been priorities in Marina's work and have ensured the success of her business. Presently, she has about $1,000 of working capital and a monthly net profit of $600. Marina is asking for a loan of 3000 Grivnas ($625 USD) to increase her assortment of clothing products. She is hoping to use the extra financial support to stock up on more merchandise. The loan will not only be beneficial for Marina's business, but it will also help her meet her household expenses and to set aside some savings for future needs.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en:
Fidel is 34 years old and lives with his wife and three children, who are 7, 4, and 1, in the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. Fidel has a salaried position at the Warnes poultry farm, where he works in the incubation plant. The loan is for Fidel's wife, who sells videos and CDs in the central market of Warnes. There is a fair amount of competition, since there are a number of similar businesses in the area. Fidel's wife will use this loan to stock her store with more merchandise. 

The couple has a good credit history; they have paid off all of their previous loans as scheduled.

loans.use: Buy CDs and videos

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is a small entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. She sells women's clothing in the local market called "Krytyi" (Covered Market). Nadezhda had many challenges in the past when she had to move her business frequently from one marketplace to another. She managed to overcome all difficulties and keep her business stable despite all this. Nadezhda has been in the trade for 10 years. Currently, she has about $3000 in inventory. Her gross income is about $1600 a month.

Nadezhda is a wonderful wife and the mother of two children. She handles all household chores and keeps up with her intense business pace incredibly well. The secret of her success is her natural liveliness and willingness to be a hands-on manager of her enterprise. She is a service-driven individual and she always brings a high level of accountability and professional service to every customer. Nadezha is requesting a 6000 Grivna ($1200 USD) loan to re-stock her inventory. She is hoping to repay the loan in six months.

loans.use: To re-stock her inventory

loans.name: Mbogga Fapp Group

texts.fr: Le groupement Mbogga Fapp de l'écovillage de Mbam (http://www.sem-fund.org/mbamfr.php) désirerait disposer d'un prêt de kiva pour renforcer la demande en produits halieutiques transformés (huitres, crevettes, langoustes, crabes, poissons séchés) des groupements existant sur le marché pour lutter contre le problème d'écoulement de fournisseurs de la zone. Ceci pour lutter contre l'oisiveté et permettre de créer des emplois aux femmes et contribuer à la lutte contre la pauvreté.
texts.en:
The Mbogga Fapp group of the eco-village of Mbam (http://www.sem-fund.org/mbamfr.php) would like to receive a Kiva loan to bolster the demand for processed seafood (oysters, shrimp, lobsters, crabs, dried fish) of existing groups in the marketplace to combat the problem of outflow of suppliers from this economic zone. The goal is to combat joblessness and create jobs for women and thus contribute to the struggle against poverty.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of seafood

loans.name: Fatou Teugne

texts.fr: Fatou Teugne D. est mariée et mere de cinq enfants.Elle est agée de cinquante ans.Elle confectionne des habits qu'elle renvend dans son quartier à Cité Lamy et cela depuis plusieur années de cela
texts.en:
Fatou Teugne D., age 50, is married and the mother of five children. For several years, she's been making clothes that she sells in her neighborhood in Cité Lamy.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Manufacturing and sale of clothes

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata D. est mariée et agée de trente huit ans. Elle vend des vetements pour enfants des chaussures des patalons en djin pour adultes dans son quartier à Cité Lamy depuis un an
texts.en:
Aminata D. is married and is thrity-eight years old. For the last year she has been selling children's clothing and shoes as well as pants for adults from her home in the city of Lamy.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of various articles

loans.name: Ceberiana

texts.es:
Ceberiana esta casada con el Sr. Jerónimo de la Cruz, y son padres de dos hijas, que ya están casada. Inicio su negocio hace seis años, su tienda era de lamina, su casa eran apenas dos cuartos y un pasillo, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación Doña Ceberiana ha ido ampliando su casa, además de hacer mejoras en su negocio ya que su negocio ahora es de cemento y block, tiene una área de maquinitas para los niños y mesas, para quienes quieran comer ahí elotes o fritos con queso. Además de esto elabora tortillas de harina para su venta, y combinando estas actividades ha obtenido buenas ganancias.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una maquina para cortar tortillas. Con tu apoyo doña Ceberiana saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Ceberiana is married to Jerónimo de la Cruz, and they are the parents of two married children. When she began her business six years ago, her shop was built of metal laminate, and their home was just two rooms and a hallway; however, thanks to hard work and dedication, Ceberiana has added on to the house, in addition to making improvements to her business. Now her shop is constructed out of block and mortar. There is an area with arcade games for the children, and tables for those who wish to eat their fried corn with cheese there. In addition, she makes flour tortillas for sale, and in combining these two ventures has earned a good profit. Ceberiana needs a six-month loan for $950 in order to buy an appliance for cutting tortillas. She will make progress with your assistance.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of an appliance

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose S. sells soya beans at Bantama in Elmina. Rose has received no formal education. She is married and has 1 child. Her husband is an electrical repairer. Rose has been selling soya beans since 1998. She is responsible for helping her husband in the payment of the children's school fees and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more soya beans for sale to meet the demand of her ever increasing customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in the business to increase sales, which will eventually increase her income.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more soya beans for sale to meet the demand of her ever increasing customers.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana T. is married and has 2 children. She has received schooling through primary level four. Christiana sells cassava dough, maize, and other food items at Bantama in Elmina, which she has done since 1998. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Christiana uses her income to pay for feeding the family and utility bills. Christiana will use the loan to add to her capital to buy more cassava to use to make the dough and more maize for sale. With the new profits, Christiana plans to save towards the expansion of the business.

loans.use: to buy more cassava and maize for re-sale

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Kofi G. is married and has three children. He has received no formal education. Kofi has been a corn mill operator at Bantama in Elmina since 1998. His wife is a trader. Kofi uses his income to pay for his children's school fees and other utility bills.

Kofi will use this loan to purchase equipment and tools to increase the efficiency of his machine. With the new profits from his expanded business, he plans to reinvest in the business to increase operations, which will eventually increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and tools to increase the efficiency of his machine.

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en:
Godwin S. is married and has 2 children. He has received schooling through Senior High level. Godwin is a fisherman who goes to fish from the sea and sells his catch to the fishmongers who buy and preserve the fish and later send them to the market for sale at Bantama in Elmina. Godwin has been doing this since 2003. His wife is a fishmonger.

Godwin uses his income to pay for his children's school fees and utility bills. Godwin will use the loan to add to his capital to buy nets, an outboard motor, and other fishing materials which he needs to make his work more efficient. With the new profits, Godwin plans to reinvest into the business to increase sales which will eventually increase his income.

loans.use: to buy nets, an outboard motor and other fishing implements

loans.name: Saul Alcides

texts.es:
hola mi nombre es Saul H. tengo 31 años de edad, estoy casado y tengo 4 hijos, los cuales los hemos sacado adelante luchando junto a mi esposa con la venta de pescado, negocio que tenemos hace 5 años y que distribuyo en disferentes lugares como ser restaurantes y casas particulares.
tomamos la decision de crear este negocio ya que tenemos el proyo de unos familiares que son los que producen el pescado y ellos nos los venden a un precio muy comodo, asi tenemos mas ganancias.
yo creo que el credito es una buena opcion para el desarrollo de mi negocio.
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Saul H.. I am 31 years old, I am married and I have 4 children. My wife and I have managed to care for them together by selling fish, a business we have been running for the past 5 years, distributing to different locales such as restaurants and private homes.

We decided to start up this small business because he have the support of our family members, they are the producers fo the fish and they sell the fish to us at a very good rate, just so that we can have better earnings. This loan will be a good way to help my business grow.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fish.

loans.name: Maria Lidia

texts.es:
hola mi nombre es Maria G. tengo 25 años de edad, estoy casada, tenemos 2 hijos, los cuales hemos luchado por salir adelante junto con mi esposo, yo vivo en la colonia Ismael Acosta que es una comunidad ubicada al noreste de la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
tengo 3 años y medio de dedicarme a esta actividad, tome la decision de vender tortillas ya que es un alimento que se vende mucho en nuestro pais ya que este es acompañante en los 3 tiempos de comida, y se vende muy bien.
en estos momentos necesito un credito para poder comprar mas materia prima para fabricar mis tortillas y asi tener una mejor venta y con las ganancias que tenga poder alimentar mi familia.
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Maria G.. I am 25 years old and married. We have 2 children, for whom we have fought to help get ahead in life. I live in the Ismael Acosta neighborhood, which is a community located northeast of the city of San Lorenzo. I have been working in this business for 3 and-a-half years. I decided to sell tortillas because they are a food that sells well in our country, since they accompany all three meals. At this time, I need a loan to buy more ingredients to make my tortillas so that I can sell more. With the earnings I will be able to feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy salt, water, corn, corn flour, and fire wood

loans.name: Emilda

texts.es:
La señora Emilda B. S. tiene 33 años  y vive en la calle 28 de julio sin número del distrito de Mache provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió educación primaria completa pero no continuó estudiando debido a que sus padres no contaban con los medios necesarios para mandarla a estudiar a otro lugar ya que en Mache solo había escuela primaria.
Se casó a los dieciocho años con el señor César Benites Zavaleta  y tiene  cinco hijas las que dependen económicamente de ellos.
Su primer préstamo a Manuela Ramos  fue de 300 soles devueltos en cuatro meses con los que compró ovejas, las volvió a vender y compro una cerda y otros animales pequeños.
Con este préstamo de S/ 300 soles, el cual será devuelto en cuatro meses, comprará solamente animales menores porque son más fáciles de vender  obteniéndose mejores ganancias.
El máximo sueño de la señora Emilda es de ver a sus cinco hijas profesionales y que sean mujeres de provecho para Mache contribuyendo a  su  transformación social y económica.
Emilda pertenece al comedor popular de su barrio y también al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Mache.
texts.en:
Mrs. Emilda B. S. is 33 years old and lives on July 28th St in the Mache District of Otuzco Province in the La Libertad Department of Peru. She completed primary school, but could not continue her studies because her parents could not afford to send her somewhere else to study, and in Mache there is only a primary school.

When she was 18 years old, Emilda married Mr. César Benites Zavaleta. The couple has five daughters, all of whom are still dependents.

Emilda's first loan from Manuela Ramos was for 300 soles (slightly more than US $100). She used it to buy sheep, which she then sold and used the profit to buy a pig and other small animals. She repaid the loan in four months.

With this loan of 300 soles, which she will also repay in four months, Emilda will only buy young animals, since they are easier to sell and she can make more money this way.

Emilda's greatest dream is to see her five daughters grow up to be professionals who benefit the Mache District by working for its social and economic transformation. Emilda is a member of the working-class eatery in her neighborhood, and is also a member of the Mujeres de Mache Communal Bank (a group loan).

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy young animals

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
hola mi nombre es Candida O. tengo 36 años de edad, estoy casada con el señor Jose Castro con el cual hemos procreado 6 hijos, yo tengo 12 años de dedicarme a esta actividad comercial, en la cual me ha ido muy bien ya que mi producto lo vendo en mi casa de hogar, tengo en la sala como una pequeña tieda para exhibicion de mis productos y asi no descuido a mis hijos ya que estoy en mi casa.
mis clientes son muy buenos ya que mi casa esta ubicada en un lugar estrategico porque esta pegada a una estacion de gasolina y muchos clientes que llegan a comprar gasolina pasan por mi negocio viendo mis productos.
en estos momentos necesito un credito para comprar mas mercaderia y asi poder cubrir con las exigencias de mis clientes.
texts.en:
Hello. My name is Candida O., I'm 36 years old, and I'm married to Mr. Jose Castro and we have 6 children. I have had this business for 12 years, and it has gone very well as I sell my products from my home. I have a living room that serves as a small store to show my products and that way I can take care of my children as I am in my home. My customers are very good and my house is located in a strategic place because it is attached to a gas station and many customers who arrive to purchase gasoline pass by my business and see my products. So for those moments I need a loan to buy more merchandise and in that way meet the demands of my customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Nazareno Group

texts.es:
hola nuestro grupo se llama Nazareno estamos ubicados en la comunidad de el Jicaro, Alauca, nos conocemos muy bien y siempre hemos trabajado juntos.
nuestro grupo se integra de esta forma:
Oscar F.: me dedico  hace 2 1/2 años a la elaboracion y venta de rosquillas y tambien vendo queso, actividad que realizo de forma ambulante, este negocio es la fuente principal en la generacion de ingresos que me permiten cubrir con los gastos de mi hogar.
Otilia F.: ella tiene mas de 25 años de dedicarse a la venta y produccion de rosquillas, actividad que ella realiza en su casa de habitacion y que distribuye en diferentes negocios de Danli y el Paraiso.
Francisca F.: ella tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la venta y produccion de rosquillas y pan de casa, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos, con los ingresos que ella genera le ayuda en gran parte a su esposo para cubrir con todos los gastos de la casa.

necesitamos un credito para salir adelante con nuestros negocios para seguir mejorando nuestras condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Hello, our group is called Nazareno. We are located in the town of Jicaro, Alauca. We know each other very well and we have always worked together. Our group works in this way: Oscar F.: I have worked for two and a half years making and selling rosquillas (a regional cookie specialty), and also I sell cheese, an activity that I do in open air markets. This business is the principal source of income generation that allow me to cover the expenses of my household. Otilia F.: She has worked for longer than 25 years selling and making rosquillas, an activity that she does in her home and that she distributes in different businesses of Danli and the Paraiso. Francisca F.: She has spent 20 years selling and making rosquillas and bread in her home. She is married and she has 2 children. With the income that she generates she helps her husband cover a large part of the household expenses. We need a loan in order to move forward with our businesses in order to improve our qualities of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make rosquillas

loans.name: Emereciana Idelfonsa

texts.es:
La señora Emereciana Idelfonsa  C. D. M. vive y tiene su negocio en la Avenida Simón Bolívar Manzana P lote 10 Semirustica  el Bosque Trujillo La Libertad Perú.
A la señora Emereciana a quien con cariño la llaman Chana y tiene 55 años.
Ella recuerda con gratitud a su querida Carabamba, tierra donD. nació y donD. estudió primaria completa, no siguió estudiando porque sus padres pensaban que las mujeres no debían educarse,  eso era cosa D. hombres.
Chana se casó a los 20 años con Amaro Jacobo M. Arroyo  y tuvieron 6 hijos D. los cuales solo 2 dependen D. ella, su esposo no pueD. trabajar por encontrarse delicado D. salud, ahora ayuda a su esposa en el pequeño restaurant.
Ella trabaja en este tipo D. negocio desD. que era soltera, en Carabamba también vendía comida, quesos, quesillos, carne y papas, “Allá también pertenecía a un Banco Comunal” nos dice; “y aquí yo les animé a las señoras para formarlo”.
“Me acuerdo mucho  que con el primer préstamo que me dio Manuela D. 300 soles compré verduras para llevar a Carabamba “comenta  con mucho entusiasmo.
Actualmente venD. 70 almuerzos diarios y cuida mucho la calidad D. su trabajo.
Con este préstamo D.  S/. 1500 soles  que los devolverá en 4 meses, comprará 80  a  100 kilogramos D. pollo y gallina que enviará a Carabamba para ser vendidos y poder tener más capital para su negocio.
Su actual sueño es agrandar su negocio y hacer un gran restaurant con personal capacitado.Emereciana es tesorera en su Banco Comunal Trabajo y Amor.
texts.en:
Ms. Emereciana Idelfonsa C. D. M. lives and runs her business on Simón Bolívar Venue, block P, lot 10 Semirustica Trujillo Forest La Libertad, Perú. Emereciana, whom people lovingly call Chana, is 55 years old. She gratefully remembers her beloved Carabamba, the place where she was born and where she completed elementary school. She did not continue with her studies because her parents believed that women did not need to be educated; that was a man’s thing. Chana got married at the age of 20 with Amaro Jacobo M. Arroyo, and together they had 6 children, two of which are still their dependants. Her husband is unable to work because he is ill, so he now helps his wife with her small restaurant. She has been working in this type of business since she was single. In Carabamba, she also sold food, cheese, milk curd, meat, and potatoes. “I was also a member of a microfinance institute there, and here I motivated the women to start one,” she tells us. “I remember that I purchased vegetables to sell in Carabamba with the first loan of 300 PEN that Manuela gave me,” she comments with much enthusiasm. She currently sells 70 lunches daily, and she is very attentive to her quality of work. With this loan of 1,500.00 PEN, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase 80 to 100 kilograms of chicken, which she will send to Carabamba to be sold so that she can have more business capital. Her current dream is to expand her business and create a big restaurant with a trained staff. Emereciana is treasurer of the Labor and Love microfinance institute.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wholesale poultry (chicken and hens)

loans.name: Las Vegas Group

texts.es:
hola nuestro grupo se llama LAS VEGAS estamos ubicados en el Barrio el Centro, municipio de Alauca, nosotros nos conocemos muy bien y siempre hemos trabajado juntos.
este es el detalle de nuestro grupo
Luis C.: tengo 6 años de realizar esta actividad, me dedico a al compra de cerdos para el destazo, este negocio es la fuente principal en la generacion de ingresos que tengo, gracias a este negocio he podido sacar adelante a mi familia, 
Miguel Fortin26 años de dedicarse ala Sastreria, actividad que realiza en su casa de habitacion y es su unico ingreso monetario para cumplir con todas las necesidades que tiene de su hogar.
Oswaldo C.: su actividad principal es la venta de leña y la agricultura tiene mas de 7 años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio, es casado y tiene 3 hijos, 
gracias al credito que estamos solicitando podremos seguir mejorando con nuestros negocios y de esta manera contribuir al engrandecimiento de nuestra comunidad.
texts.en:
Hello. Our group’s name is LAS VEGAS. We are located in the Centro neighborhood in Alauca municipality. We know each other well and we have always worked together. Here are the details about our group. Luis C.: I have been doing this business for 6 years. I buy pigs for meat processing, this business is the main source of income that I have. Thanks to this business I have been able to help my family get ahead. Miguel F. is 26 years old and is a tailor, a trade he practices in his home and it is his only source of income to meet the needs that he has in his home. Oswaldo C.: His main activity is selling wood and farming. He has be doing this for more than 7 years, is married, and has 3 children. Thanks to the loan we are seeking we will be able to improve our businesses and in this way contribute to the growth of our community.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Dora Erminda

texts.es:
La señora Dora Erminda Ibáñez S.  tiene cincuentaiun años y vive en la avenida Los Incas sin número del distrito de Mache provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Tiene Primaria completa y como no pudo continuar estudios aprendió costura, mirando y ayudando en el oficio.
Actualmente tiene su pareja con quien se comprometió desde los treintainueve años, no tienen ningún hijo pero a su cargo están dos sobrinos.
Erminda siempre se dedico a la costura, pero su pareja le enseñó a hacer negocio de menestra, papa, chocho, etc.
Su primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos fue de 300soles hace ya ocho años, con el préstamo, empezó a trabajar en la compra venta de menestras y papa. Devolvió en cuatro meses.
Con este préstamo de S/ 800 soles, comprará papa seca, trigo, cebada y chocho que son productos de la estación.  Este préstamo será devuelto en cuatro cuotas.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal Progresistas y es una mujer muy activa, que no se puede quedar sentada debido a que le gusta mucho el trabajo.
Su actual sueño es viajar conocer otros lugares, otros países.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dora Erminda Ibáñez S. is 51 years old and lives on Los Incas street in the Mache District of Otuzco Province, in the La Libertad Department of Peru. She completed primary school, and since she could not finished her studies she learned to be a seamstress by watching and helping others work. She has been in a relationship since she was 39, and though the couple does not have any children, she is raising two of her nephews.

Erminda has always worked as a seamstress, but her partner taught her the business of selling vegetable stew, potatoes, and corn. She took out her first loan of 300 soles (about US $100) from Manuela Ramos eight years ago and started to work buying and selling vegetable stews and potatoes. She repaid the loan in four months.

With this loan of 800 soles, she will buy dried potatoes, wheat, barley and corn, which are all in season right now. She will repay this loan in four installments.

She belongs to the Progresistas Communal Bank (a group loan) and is a very active woman. She likes her work so much that she can hardly sit still.

Her current dream is to travel so that she can get to know other places and other countries.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy potatoes, wheat, barley, etc.

loans.name: Los Tres Amigos Group

texts.es:
hola nuestro grupo se llama los TRES AMIGOS, estamos ubicados en la comunidad de Quebrada Larga, un lugar muy bonito de Jamastran, todos nos conocemos desde que eramos niños y nos hemos llevado muy bien en toda nuestra vida, por eso decidimos hacer un grupo y crear nuestros negocios para salir adelante ya que la situacion de nuestro pais es muy dificil para la gente que vive en pueblos.
nostros somos:
Santos I.: tengo 5 años de dedicarme a la vente de carne de res, cerdo y pollo, mi negocio es muy bueno ya que la carne se vende rapido porque es un alimento que se utiliza mucho en el almuerzo, entonces este es un producto que se moviliza con facilidad.
Noemi F.: ella se dedica a la venta de ropa americana clasificada, tiene 3 años de dedicarse a ese negocio.
Maria I.: se dedica a la venta de conos de diferentes sabores, este producto lo vende en su casa de habitacion, tambien vende platanos y bananos, todo esto le ayuda a salir adelante con los gastos financieros que tiene en su hogar.

necesitamos un credito para poder crecer y asi poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. gracias
texts.en:
Hello, our group is call the THREE FRIENDS. We live in the community of Quebrada Large, in a very nice area of Jamastran. We have known each other since we were children and we have gotten along well all of our lives. This is the reason why we decided to form a group and to start our own businesses so that we can get ahead, since the situation in our country is very difficult for people who live in small towns.

We are: Santos I.: For the past 5 years I have sold beef, pork and chicken. My business is very good and the meat sells quickly because it is used a lot for lunch, so this is a product that moves easily.

Noemi F.: She sells used American clothing and has been in this business for 3 years.

Maria I.: She sells different flavored snow cones, she sells this product from home. She also sells plantains and bananas. All this helps her to take care of household expenses. We need a loan to be able to grow and in this way to be able to have a better standard of living. Thank you.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for supplying our businesses

loans.name: Denis Gleydi

texts.es:
Denis Gleydi  tiene 23 años, nacida en AgaLLpampa de la provincia de Otuzco,  vive en Manzana B lote 25 Barrio 2 Alto Trujillo La Libertad Perú.
Denis fue becada por círculo Solidario gracias a su buen aprovechamiento escolar y estudió Enfermería  Técnica en el Instituto  San Luis y desea hacer una especialización en la Cruz Roja.
Ella se casó con Máximo Segura y tiene un hijo que aun es muy pequeño razón por la cual no puede seguir estudiando, tiene que trabajar para poder dar comodidad a su pequeño.
Denis se dedica a diversos negocios desde vender ropa, artículos de belleza hasta vender pollo, los compra pequeños, los alimenta y los vende a los 45 días.
El primer préstamo que le brindo Manuela Ramos fue de 300 soles con los que compró ropa para vender nuevamente, luego con las ganancias compró artículos de belleza y algunos pollos.
Con este préstamo de S/ 500 soles comprará comida de pollos para alimentar a más de 70 pollos que tiene actualmente, su préstamo lo devolverá en 4 meses.
Denis tiene un gran sueño aparte de ejercer su profesión, ella desea tener un restaurant  y una pequeña granja.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal Trabajo y Amor del cual a aprendido mucho a disciplinarse con los gastos de su dinero.
texts.en:
Denis Gleydi is 23 years old. She was born in Agallpampa in Otuzco province and currently lives on B block of Neighborhood 2 in Alto Trujillo, La Libertad, Peru.

Denis received a scholarship from the Solidarity Circle thanks to her good grades and studied Technical Nursing in the San Luis Institute. She would like to specialize with the Red Cross, but because she married Máximo Segura and they had a child, she cannot continue her studies. Her child is still very young, so she has to take care of the little one.

Denis is involved in various businesses, from selling clothing and beauty products to selling chickens, which she buys young, feeds, and sells after 45 days. Her first loan from Manuela Ramos was of 300 soles (about US $100), which she used to buy clothing to sell. Then, with the profits, she bought beauty products and some chickens.

With this loan of 500 soles, she will buy chicken feed for the more than 70 chickens she currently owns. She will repay this loan in four months.

Denis has a great dream aside from continuing her current work: she would like to open a restaurant and a small farm. She belongs to the Trabajo y Amor Communal Bank (a group loan), from which she has learned a lot about using discipline when spending money.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens in bulk

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Cristina E. S. tiene 46 años y vive en el caserío Campo Bello que pertenece al distrito de Mache en la provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Ella estudió  hasta el cuarto año de educación Primaria, porque solamente hasta ese grado había en la escuela donde asistía.
Es madre de tres hijos pero ya ninguno depende económicamente de Cristina.
Actualmente vende abarrotes en una pequeña bodega ubicada en su casa de Campo Bello, empezó con ese negocio porque en aquel tiempo era la única que tenía una tienda por la zona.
Recuerda que el primer préstamo que obtuvo de Manuela Ramos fue de 300 soles, con los que compró abarrotes para surtir su negocio, los devolvió en 4 meses.
Manifiesta que ahora ya no se venden mucho los abarrotes, porque hay mucha competencia.
Con este préstamo de 2,500 soles, comprará una vaca con ternero para vender la leche y hacer quesillo.  El préstamo lo devolverá en cuatro meses.
Cristina pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Mache y es una buena socia.
 Su gran sueño es tener un  bonito establo lleno de vacas y abastecer a toda su comunidad de buena leche.
texts.en:
Cristina E. S. is 46 years old and lives in the hamlet of Campo Bello, in the district of Mache of the province of Otuzco, which is in the departament of La Libertad, Peru. She only studied up to grade 4 as that was all her school offered. She has 3 children and none of them depend on her financially.

She currently sells household items in her tiny grocery store located in her home in Campo Bello. She started her business because at the time, it was the only store in that area. She remembers the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, 300 soles, she used to keep her store well stocked. She repaid it in 4 months. She says that she doesn't sell much now because there's a lot of competition.

With this loan of 2,500 soles ($1 US = 3 soles, approx.), she'll buy a cow and a calf in order to sell the milk and make curd. She'll repay the loan in 4 months.

Cristina is a member of the "Banco Comunal Mujeres" (Communal Women's Bank) of Mache and is a good associate. Her big dream is to own a beautiful stable full of cows and supply good milk to the entire community.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy diverse grocery items

loans.name: Cristal Precioso Group

texts.es:
hola nosotras somos el grupo CRISTAL PRECIOSO. todas nos dedicamos a diferentes cosas, pero tenemos tiempos de conocernos y casi somos como hermanas, por eso decicmos formar un grupo para ayudar con los gastos economicos de nuestros hogares. 
a continuacion les detallo un poco de los que realizamos:
Mercedes H.: me dedico a la venta de cafe por tazas y tambien vendo tortillas, mis clientes son potenciales, son personas viajeras y en especial los volqueteros que halan arena de rio, soy casada y tengo 3 hijos, este venta de cafe es muy buena porque en la mañana y en la tardes se vende mucho porque los obreros se quitan el sueño y les da energia para seguir trabajando.
Leonarda C.: se dedica a la elaboracion  y venta de pan, tambien vende golosinas y refrescos, todo esto lo vende es su casa de habitacion.
Maria Ventura R.: tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa ameriacana, tiene 5 años de realizar esta actividad, las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y la ropa la vendo rapido ya que tengo unos clientes que siempre me comprar todo los que les llevo de producto.
Alba R.: tiene 1 año de dedicarse a vender ropa americana y tambien produce y vende tortillas, mis dos productos los vendo de manera ambulante en el mercado de nuestra comunidad, soy madre de 5 hijos.
Sagrario R.: tiene una pequeña pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, actividad que realiza hace menos de 1 año vive en union libre y es madre de 2 hijos.

todas somos madres y necesitamos credito para salir adelante con nuestros negocios, espeR. su colaboracion. gracias
texts.en:
Hello, this is the Cristal Precioso ("beautiful crystal") group. We all work in different areas, but we have known each other for a long time and are almost like sisters. That's why we decided to form a group to help us with our household expenditures. 

Here are a few details about what we do:

Mercedes H.: I sell coffee by the cup as well as tortillas. My customers are people who travel, especially dump truck drivers who take sand out of the river. I'm married and have three children. Selling coffee is a good business because I can sell a lot in the mornings and the afternoons, since it wakes up the workers and gives them the energy to keep working. 

Leonarda C.: I bake and sell bread, as well as sweets and drinks, all from my home.

Maria Ventura R.: I have a small business where I sell American clothing, which I have been doing for five years. I'm an ambulatory vendor, and I sell my clothing quickly, since I have several customers who always buy all of the products I bring them.

Alba R.: I have been selling American clothing for one year, and I also make and sell tortillas. I sell both of my products as an ambulatory vendor in a local community market. I am the mother of five children.

Sagrario R.: I have a local store located in my home, which I have been running for less than one year. I live with my partner and am the mother of two children.

We are all mothers, and we need this loan so that we can get ahead with our businesses, and we hope you will collaborate with us.  Thank you.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Jairo Rufino

texts.es:
hola mi nombre es Jairo F. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace un par de años, tambien trabajo con UNICOMER que es una compañia que distribuye productos de cosumo a nivel nacional esto debido  a que la situacion economica es muy dificil y deseo superarme monetariamente para darles una mejor calidad de vida a mi esposa e hijos que son lo mas importante en mi vida. mi esposa es que atiende la pulperia por las mañanas ya que en la tarde que yo llego atiendo el nogocio y ella pasa a ver las tareas y las necesidades de mis hijos.
en estos momentos necesito un credito para poder sacar adelante mi negocio.
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Jario F.. I work selling popular consumable products. I have had my business for a few years. I also work with UNICOMER that is a company that distributes consumables at a national level. I do this because the economic situation is very difficult and I want to improve my monetary position in order to give a better quality of live to my wife and children, who are the most important part of my life. My wife works in the general store in the mornings and in the afternoon when I arrive to attend the store she goes to check on homework and the needs of my children. At the moment I need a loan in order to move my business forward.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Ena Cristina

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Ena A. tengo un negocio de venta de abarroteria y mercaderia en general, este tipo de actividad es mi fuente principal en la generacion de ingresos, los cuales me ayudan a cumplir con los conpromisos y obligaciones que tengo. tengo 3 hijos los cuales estan en edad escolar y estudian en la escuela Publicade la localidad, con el credito solicitado me permitira surtir mi negocio y brindar una mejor atencion a los clientes y por consiguiente agenciar mejores ganancias, de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de vida de mis hijos.
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Ena A. and I have a business where I sell dry goods and general merchandise. This is my primary source of income and allows me to pay for my expenses and commitments. I have three school-age children who attend our local public school. With this loan I will buy a wider variety of merchandise for my business in order to offer better customer service and improve my earnings so that I can improve my children's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Fe Y Progreso Group

texts.en:
Celina F. is the representative of the group "Fe y Progreso" which mean Faith and Progression.  Celina is a hardworking mother to five children and wants to open her own store one day. This group has 19 other loan recipients who are eager to start their business! The businesses range from food vender to beauty salon.

On behalf of Celina, her group, and everyone at Esperanza International---- we thanks you for your support!

loans.use: Food Vendor

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen Gutiérrez Sánchez nació en Calamarca provincia de Julcán hace 42 años  y vive en el Pasaje San Luis Manzana Q lote 23 Semirustica el Bosque.
Carmen estudió primaria completa pero no pudo seguir estudiando porque quedó huérfana de padre a muy temprana edad.
Se separó de su esposo hace siete años y tiene de él siete hijos, actualmente dependen de ella solamente dos.
Su negocio funciona en su misma casa y también reparte mercancía a domicilio, vende papa, carne, queso, menestras. 
Con el primer préstamo que obtuvo de Manuela Ramos, de 300 soles, compró en Calamarca 315 kilogramos de papa que trajo a venderlas a  Trujillo. Ella comenta que Manuela Ramos la ha ayudado en su vida porque pudo adquirir un capital para poder depender de ella misma y poder trabajar dice  también que los temas que se tratan en las reuniones la hacen reflexionar y la ayudan para seguir adelante.
Con este préstamo de S/  1,100 soles, el mismo que cancelará en 4 cuotas, comprará 12 cajas de cerveza y 20 paquetes de gaseosa para venderlos en Calamarca y con ese capital comprar  630 kilos de papa, 2 arrobas de ñuña, 3 arrobas de maíz.
Carmen sueña con el día en que tendrá una casa grande y bonita. Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal Trabajo y Amor.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen G. S. was born in Calamarca, in Julcán province 42 years ago. She currently lives on San Luis Passage on Q Block, Plot 23 in Semi-Country El Bosque. Carmen completed primary school, but could not continue her studies because her father died when she was very young. She and her husband separated seven years ago. They have seven children together, of whom only two are still dependents. She sells potatoes, meat, cheese and vegetable stews from her home; she also does home deliveries.

With this loan of 1,100 soles, which she will repay in four installments, she will buy 12 boxes of beer and 20 packs of soda, which she will sell in Calamarca. With those earnings, she will buy 630 kilos of potatoes, 50 pounds of nuna beans, and 75 pounds of corn.

Carmen dreams of the day when she will have a big, beautiful house. She belongs to the Trabajo y Amor Communal Bank (a group loan).

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beer and soda

loans.name: Grimaldina Rosmeri

texts.es:
La señora Grimaldina Rosmeri G. F. tiene treintaicinco años,  vive en el caserío la Primavera en el distrito de Mache provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió primaria completa pero no continuo estudiando debido a la falta de apoyo económico de sus padres.
Se casó a los dieciséis años con el señor Francisco Medina con tienen cuatro hijos, dos de ellos ya trabajan independientemente y los otros dos están estudiando.
Empezó a negociar con animales pequeños para carne ahora compra reses y las vende en las plazas pecuarias de Otuzco y Julcán.
Hace dos años recibió su primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos que fue de 300 soles, con los que compró cuyes y gallinas, el préstamo fue devuelto en cuatro meses.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2000 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas,  comprará una vaca de 1500 soles y una cerda de 300 soles. Los 200 soles restantes los utilizará en comprar  balanceado para el alimento de sus animales.
Pertenece al Comedor Popular Corazón de Jesús de la Primavera y al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Trabajo.
Tiene un gran sueño y es el de comprar una linda casa en Trujillo para que sus hijos continúen educándose.
texts.en:
Mrs. Grimaldina Rosmeri G. F. is 35 years old and lives in the La Primavera farmhouse in the Mache District of Otuzco Province, in the La Libertad Department of Peru. Grimaldina completed primary school, but could not continue her studies due to the lack of economic support from her parents. When she was 16 years old, she married Mr. Francisco Medina. They have four children, two of whom work and are independent, while the other two are still studying.

When she first started her business she worked with small animals, but now she buys beef and sells it in the livestock plazas of Otuzco and Julcán.

Two years ago, Grimaldina received her first loan from Manuela Ramos for 300 soles (slightly more than $100), which she used to buy guinea pigs and hens. She repaid this loan in four months. With this loan of 2000 soles (about $700), she will buy a cow for 1500 soles and a pig for 300 soles. The remaining 200 soles will be used to buy animal feed. Grimaldina belongs to the Corazon de Jesus Comedor Popular (an eatery for low-income families) and is a member of the Mujeres de Trabajo Communal Bank (a group loan). Her dream is to buy a nice house in Trujillo so that her children can continue their studies. .

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cow, a pig and animal feed

loans.name: El Gran Poder De Dios Group

texts.en: Maria Leonard is one of five women hoping to start a business. This collection of women is called "El Gran Poder de Dios." Maria is a hardworking mother of five who is looking to better her life through this loan. She wants to start a small business of selling chicken. Her dream is to raise enough money to put her family in a house of their own. On behalf of Maria, the group, and the all of Esperanza International----Thank you for your support!

loans.use: To buy chicken to sell

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La señora Gladis E. Ramírez tiene cincuentainueve años y vive en el caserío Olaya del distrito de Mache provincia de Otuzco departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Curso hasta el segundo año de primaria y no continuo por falta de apoyo económico de sus padres.
Se casó a los veinte años con Benjamín Polo Pascual tuvieron ocho hijos de los cuales viven cinco, son estudiantes tres de ellos los otros dos tienen sus propios trabajos.
Su negocio actual es la fabricación y venta de tejas.
Con el primer préstamo que le dio Manuela Ramos y que fue de 300 soles compró y vendió animales menores y además compró material para la elaboración de teja.
Con este préstamo de S/. 500 soles, el cual cancelará en 4 cuotas, los invertirá en ampliar el negocio de las tejas debido a que es el negocio que le da mejores beneficios.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal Progresistas.
Sueña con tener un gran negocio en el que pueda exportar sus tejas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gladis E. Ramírez is 59 years old and lives in the Olaya farmhouse in the Mache District of the Otuzco Province of La Libertad Department, Peru. She completed elementary school up to second grade, but could not continue due to a lack of economic support from her parents. When she was 20, she married Mr. Benjamin Polo Pascual. The couple had eight children, of whom five are alive today. Three of her children are currently studying, while the other two work.

Gladis makes and sells roof tiles. With her first loan of 300 soles (slightly more than $100) from Manuela Ramos, she bought some small animals, which she later sold, and also bought materials to make roof tiles. With this loan of 500 soles (about $175), she will expand her tile-making business, since this is her most profitable business. She will repaid the loan in four installments.

Gladis belongs to the Progresistas Communal Bank (a group loan). She dreams of having a large business that will allow her to export her tiles.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to make roof tiles

loans.name: Flor Violeta

texts.es:
La señora Flor Violeta  A.  B. tiene veinticuatro años y vive en la Avenida Primavera sin número en el distrito de Mache , provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La libertad Perú.
Flor Violeta cursó hasta segundo año de secundaria, pero ya no siguió estudiando porque contrajo matrimonio.
Se casó a los dieciséis años con el señor William Rafael Vidal y tiene  una hija mujer y un hijo varón, todavía muy pequeños.
Se dedica a la fabricación y venta de tejas y a la compra venta de animales.
 Su primer préstamo a Manuela Ramos fue de 300 soles, recuerda que compró con ello trigo, maíz y otras menestras, lo mismo que cuyes, los que volvió a vender a mayor precio. El préstamo lo devolvió en cuatro meses.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2000 soles, lo invertirá en  la compra de dos cerdos, dos ovejas y material para la elaboración de teja.  Este préstamo lo cancelará en 4 cuotas.
Flor Violeta sueña con seguir estudiando y llegar a ser una buena enfermera.
En su barrio se desempeña como una buena socia del comedor popular Corazón de María, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Trabajo y es una socia cumplida y responsable.
texts.en:
Mrs. Flor Violeta A. B. is 24 years old and lives on Spring Avenue in the district of Mache, Otuzco Province, in La libertad, Perú. Flor Violeta studied through the second year of high school, but she did not continue studying after she got married. When she was 16 she married William Rafael Vidal and she has a daughter and son, both still very young. She is dedicated to making and selling tiles and to the purchase and sale of animals. Her first loan from Manuela Ramos was for 300 soles (approximately $100 US), and she remembers that she purchased wheat, corn, and other basics, along with guinea pigs, which she resold for a higher price. She repaid the loan in 4 months. With her current loan request of 2000 soles ($700 US), she will invest in the purchase of pigs, two sheep, and material for making tiles. This loan will be repaid in four installments. Flor Violeta dreams of continuing her studies and becoming a good nurse. In her neighborhood she serves as a good member of the communal diner Corazón de María (Heart of María), and she also belongs to the Communal Bank Mujeres de Trabajo (Women of Work), where she is a responsible and reliable member.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase small animals (pigs and sheep) and to purchase material for making tiles

loans.name: Flor Elicenda

texts.es:
La señora Flor Elicenda B. V. tiene treintainueve años, vive en la avenida Campo Bello sin número del distrito de Mache de la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió la primaria completa y ya no pudo seguir estudiando porque en Mache no había como continuar porque no había secundaria.
Se casó muy joven con Hernando Mendocilla y con él tienen cinco hijos, él mayor trabaja independientemente y los otros cuatro todavía son estudiantes.
Flor, compra cerdos, los alimenta hasta lograr un buen peso y luego los vende en carne, así obtiene mayores ganancias.
Hace cuatro años Manuela Ramos le prestó 300 soles y con ello compró cinco cerdos los que engordo y vendió a muy buen precio.
Con este préstamo de S/. 800 soles, el cual cancelará en 4 cuotas, comprará cinco cerdos pequeños, los engordará y venderá en carne.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal Progresistas y es una socia muy cumplida.
Flor sueña con ir de paseo a la Argentina.
texts.en:
Mrs. Flor Elicenda B. V. is 39 years old and lives on Bella Campo street in Mache District of Otuzco Province, in the La Libertad Department of Peru. She completed primary school, but was unable to continue her studies since there is no secondary school in Mache. She married Hernando Mendocilla when she was very young, and the couple has five children. Her oldest child works and is independent, while the others are still in school.

Flor buys pigs, feeds them until they reach a good weight, then sells their meat for a profit. Four years ago, Manuela Ramos lent her 300 soles (about US $100), which she used to buy five pigs, which she fattened up and sold for a very good price. With this loan of 800 soles (about US $275), she will buy five piglets, which she will fatten and sell for meat.

Flor belongs to the Progresista Communal Bank (a group loan), where she is a very reliable participant. She dreams of vacationing in Argentina someday.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy piglets

loans.name: Eleuteria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Eleuteria Isabel Z. E.  tiene cincuentaidos años vive en la Avenida Primavera  sin  número del distrito de Mache, provincia de Otuzco departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Eleuteria estudió educación primaria completa pero ya no siguió estudiando porque, sus padres eran muy pobres y no pudieron apoyarla.
Se casó de treinta años con el señor Fernando Javier Rafael Vidal, con el que tienen dos hijos, de los cuales uno es trabajador independiente y el otro todavía es estudiante.
Eleuteria se dedica a la compra venta de quesillo, verdura, cuyes y gallinas, sus actividades las realiza en su casa.
No recuerda desde hace cuanto tiempo pertenece a Manuela Ramos pero si recuerda que su primer préstamo de 300 soles los utilizó en comprar dos cerdos y una oveja, el préstamo fue devuelto en cuatro meses.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2300 soles, el cual cancelará en 4 cuotas, comprará una vaca de 1300 soles y el resto lo empleará en comprar material para la fabricación de teja (material para construcción).
Sueña en viajar a ver a sus hermanos que viven en el extranjero y pasar unos días con ellos.
Eleuteria pertenece al Comedor Popular María Victoria y al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Trabajo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eleuteria Isabel Z. E. is 52 years old and lives on Primavera Avenue in the Mache District of Otuzco Province in the La Libertad Department of Peru. Eleuteria completed primary school, but could not continue her education because her parents were very poor and could not support her any more. When she was 30 years old, she married Mr. Fernando Javier Rafael Vidal, with whom she has two children, one of whom works and is independent, while the other is still in school.

Eleuteria buys and sells quesillo (a soft, mild cheese), vegetables, guinea pigs and hens from her home. She cannot remember how long she has been a client of Manuela Ramos, but she does remember that she used her first loan of 300 soles to buy two pigs and a sheep and repaid the loan in four months. With her current loan of 2300 soles (about $800) she will buy a cow for 1300 soles and will use the remaining 1000 soles to buy materials to make roof tiles.

She dreams of travelling to spend time with her brothers, who live outside Peru. Eleuteria belongs to the Maria Victoria working-class eatery and the Mujeres de Trabajo Communal Bank (a group loan).

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cow, materials to make roof tiles

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
El microempresario José Ángel B. M. tiene 31 años de edad, es casado, tiene 1 hijo el cual se encuentra estudiando en nivel primario, este señor se dedica desde hace 4 años a vender trastes de cocinas, trastes plásticos, flores plásticas, escobas, electrodomésticos, entre otros productos. Para asegurarse sus ventas compra algunos productos por encargos los cuales vende al crédito y otros los vende de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación. En esta actividad el microempresario B. manifiesta tener una ventaje y es que la mayoría de sus productos por ser de material plástico le permite poca depreciación. Este señor obtiene parte de sus productos al crédito a corto plazo por lo que tiene que recuperar rápidamente la venta de esos productos y las ganancias son pocas. Trabaja por un lado de la modalidad por encargo que consiste que sus clientes le encargan productos y solo los entrega y por otro lado oferta su producto al publico en general. Sin embargo no cuenta con mucho capital, por tal razón esta solicitando se le financie para comprar lo siguiente:

6 Abanicos corrientes a US$ 12.00 cada uno, 8 planchas Black & Deker a US$ 10.00 cada una, 1 lote de flores plásticas a US$ 74.00 el lote, 3 docenas de chinelas variadas a US$ 18.00 cada docena, 1 lote de traste de cocina a US$ 150.00 el lote, 3 docenas de escobas a US$ 60.00 cada docena, y ½ lote de trastes plásticos a US$ 160.00 el medio lote.
texts.en:
The small business owner Jose Angel B. M. is 31 years old, is married, and has a son who is currently attending primary school. For the past 4 years he has been selling dishes, plastic dishes, silk flowers, brooms, and electrical appliances among other products. To supplement his sales he takes some orders for products sold on credit and he also carries out door-to-door sales as well sales from his home. Mr. B. seen an advantage because most of the products he sells are plastic based and they depreciate slowly. He obtains some of his products on short-term credit loans but he is required to quickly sell off those products and his earnings are small. He also takes orders from his clients and he himself delivers the products, but he also sells to the general public. But through all of this he still cannot accumulate much capital, which is the reason why he is requesting a loan. He will put those funds towards the following purchases:

6 standard fans at $12 each; 8 Black & Decker irons at $10 each; 1 lot of silk flowers at $74/lot; 3 dozen flip-flops at $18/dozen; 1 lot of kitchen dishes at $150/lot; 3 dozen brooms at $60/dozen; and, 1/2 lot of plastic dishes at $160/half lot.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 6 standard fans; 8 Black & Decker irons; 1 lot of silk flowers; 3 dozen flip-flops; 1 lot of kitchen dishes; 3 dozen brooms; 1/2 lot of plastic dishes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Casilda Yanet

texts.es:
La señora Casilda Yanet L. A. tiene treintainueve años y vive en la calle Soledad 108 del distrito de Mache en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento de La  Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta el tercer año de educación secundaria, pero por falta de medios económicos sus padres ya no pudieron apoyarla para seguir estudiando.
Casilda Yanet se casó de 18 años con el señor Walter Miro López Rodríguez y tiene dos hijas que aun son estudiantes.
Tiene una bodega en su casa, pero también compra y vende queso quesillo,  carne de carnero y cerdo, la carne y el queso o quesillo los  vende en los mercados de Trujillo.
Recuerda con gratitud que la primera entidad de la cual obtuvo su primer préstamo fue de Manuela Ramos y fue de 300 soles, con lo que compró queso, quesillo y artículos para su bodega.
Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000 soles, el cual cancelará en 4 cuotas, comprará quesillo y artículos de primera necesidad para su bodega.
Casilda pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Mache desde hace aproximadamente siete años, en los que aprendió a administrar su negocio y a tomar sus propias decisiones.
Sueña con tener una linda casa propia en Trujillo donde estudia una de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Casilda Yanet L. A. is thirty nine years old and lives at 108 Soledad in the district of Mache of the province of Otuzco, in the region of La Libertad in Peru.

She attended high school until her 3rd year in high school but due to a lack of financial resources her parents were no longer able to support her to continue going to school.

Casilda Yanet was married when she was 18 years old with her husband Walter Miro Lopez Rodriguez and they have two daughters who are still in school.

She runs a small grocery store from her home but she also buys and sells fresh cheeses, beef and pork meats, all of which she sells in the markets of Trujillo.

She recalls with gratitude the first time when she received a loan from Manuel Ramos and it was for the sum of 300 soles with which she purchase cheeses and other articles for her grocery store.

This loan, amounting to 3000 soles, will be repaid in a term of 4 months and the funds will be used to purchase cheeses and staple items for her grocery store.

Casilda belongs to the Banco Comunal Mujeres de Mache community bank and she has been a member for about 7 years, and in her experience she learned how to manage her business and make her own decisions.

She dreams of having her own beautiful home in the city of Trujillo where one of her daughters goes to school.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Benedicta Angélica

texts.es:
La señora Benedicta Angélica R. D. H. tiene setenta años y vive en  Avenida Los Incas 318, en el distrito D. Mache provincia D. Otuzco departamento D. La Libertad Perú.
Estudió solo transición, lo que ahora es primer grado D. primaria, “Los padres no apoyaban porque pensaban que si se aprendía a escribir íbamos a escribirnos con los hombres”, dice sonriendo con gran nostalgia, Benedicta.
Se casó a los veinte años con el señor José H. Mariñas y tienen doce hijos, siete varones y cinco mujeres, dos D. los doce dependen D. ella económicamente porque aun siguen estudiando.
Ella empezó a vender pan, dulces, etc. DesD. los catorce años D. edad. Actualmente venD. ropa D. polar y lo hace en su casa.
Trabaja con Manuela Ramos desD. hace aproximadamente diez años, su primer crédito fue D. 300 soles que los invirtió en harina, manteca y azúcar, devolvió su préstamo en cuatro meses.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000 soles,  el cual cancelará en 4 cuotas, comprará ropa, traerá 64 casacas D. taslam.
Benedicta pertenece al Comedor Popular D. su barrio y al Banco Comunal Mujeres D. Trabajo.
Su gran sueño es tener a todos sus hijos y esposo reunidos en mache y hacer una gran fiesta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Benedicta Angélica R. D. H. is 70 years old and lives on Avenue Los Incas 318, in the district of Mache, province of Otuzco, department of La Libertad Perú. She only studied until first graD., "My parents didn't support my schooling as they thought we would write boys," she says with a nostalgic smile. Benedicta married Mr. José H. Mariñas at the age of 20 and together they have 12 children, 7 boys and 5 girls. Two of them still depend on her financially as they're still studying. She started selling breads, sweets, etc. when she was 14. Now she sells winter clothes that she makes herself. She's been working with Manuela Ramos (microfinancier) for approximately 10 years. Her first loan was for about $100 which she used to purchase flour, lard, and sugar; and that she paid back in 4 months. With this loan for $1025, that she will repay in 4 months, she will buy clothes (64 jackets maD. of taslam fiber, a breathable, waterproof fabric). Benedicta belongs to the neighborhood Comedor Popular (where poor families share donated food and cook together) and the Communal Bank Working Women. Her wish is to reunite her entire family and have a big party.

Translated from Spanish by Liz West, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
La señora  Anita G. R. tiene cuarentaicuatro años y vive en la avenida Primavera sin número, del distrito de Mache  provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Curso el quinto año de secundaria, pero no continuo estudiando porque se casó, con el señor Segundo Lozano Gamboa y tienen cinco hijos, de los cuales la mayor ya es casada.
Su negocio consiste en comprar y vender menestra, trigo, cebada  y chocho, su negocio lo realiza en su propia casa.
Anita es una mujer emprendedora que le gustan los retos ella siempre cumple con las metas que se  propone es por eso que la invitaron a Manuela Ramos para pertenecer al Banco Comunal Progresistas, donde consiguió su primer préstamo de 300 soles para ser devueltos en cuatro meses, con el que compró trigo.
Con este préstamo de S/. 500 soles, el cual cancelará en 4 cuotas, comprará chocho y trigo, porque son granos de la época.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal Progresistas es socia.
Sueña con ir de viaja turístico con su esposo por todo el Perú, siempre quiso conocer la patria de palmo a palmo, dice.
texts.en:
Anita G. R. is forty-four years old and she lives in on Primavera street, a locale with no street number, in the district of Mache in the Province of Otuzco, in the regon of La Libertad in Peru.

She finished her fifth year of high school, but she didn't keep going because she married her husband, Segundo Lozano Gamboa and together they have five children, the eldest of whom is married.

Her business consists of the buying and selling of vegetable stew, wheat, sweet drinks and vegetables, and she runs the business from her own home. Anita is a hard working woman and she enjoys having goals and reaching them. For her strong spirit she was invited to join Manuela Ramos and become member of the Banco Comunal Progresistas where she received her first loan of 300 soles. She will repaid the loan in a term of 4 months and the funds were used to purchase wheat.

With this loan of 500 soles, which will also be repaid in a term of 4 months, she will purchase grains and wheat because they currently in season.

She is a member of the community bank Banco Comunal Progresistas.

She dreams of taking a trip touring all of Peru alondside her husband. She always wanted to see her country from palm tree to palm tree.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grains (such as wheat) wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more undergarments, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in beauty products for her salon.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto R. G. se dedica al transporte público de esta misma ciudad Acuña, el comenta que ya tiene un camión pero el necesita otro para trabajarlo ya que cuando este se le descomponga ya tenga otra para sustituirlo. El quiere comprar el vehiculo transporte de motor de diesel por que se le hace mas económico este combustible y son mas las ganancias, las rutas que el realiza son 5 al día de un extremo de la ciudad a otro y viceversa.

El señor R. ya tiene una parte de lo que le cuesta el camión pero aun así le falta la cantidad de $1050 dólares El tiene varios años trabajando en este oficio de conductor y su esposa se dedica al hogar con los ingresos de este medio de transporte va apagar el préstamo recibido.
texts.en:
Humberto R. G. works in public transportation in the city Acuña. He tells us that he already has a truck but he needs another one in order to work as when one breaks the other could replace it. He wants to buy a diesel transport vehicle because it is more economical and he would get better earnings. There are 5 routes that he does in a day, from one edge of the city to the other, and vice versa. Señor R. already has a part of the cost of the truck but he lacks the amount of $1050 dollars. He has worked as a driver for several years, and his wife is a housewife. With the income from his mode of transportation he will repay the loan he receives.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a truck

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoeun H., 44, is farmer who grows rice and raises pigs, typically earning US$3.00 per day. Her husband, Mr. Khorn Touch, 43, is a farmer who also cooks for wedding parties, earning around US$4.00 per day. They have three children at home, all of whom are students, and they live in Snam Pras Commune, Pursat Province. 

Because of pig business is going well and is an excellent source of income, Yoeun needs to purchase more piglets and to buy food to fatten her existing pigs so that she can sell them on time for a high price. Hence, she would like to request a loan $1,100 USD. She plans to buy twenty piglets and pig food. With the remainder of the loan, she plans to buy fertilizer for her rice crop. 

Yoeun's husband is pictured, because she was not available.

loans.use: To buy twenty piglets, pig food, and fertilizer

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha K., 48, is a farmer who also sells vegetables in her village, typically earning around US$3.00 per day. Her husband, Mr. Song Svay, 46, is farmer who also raises pigs, earning around US$2.00 per day. They live in Snampras Commune, Pursat Province, Cambodia with their three children, all of whom are students, 

Because the rice crop is their primary source of income, Sokha needs to add to the amount of farmland available to grow rice. Hence, she would like to request a loan of $1,100 USD to buy 1 hectare (about 2.5 acres) of farmland for growing rice.

loans.use: To buy 1 hectare of farmland for growing rice

loans.name: Met

texts.en: Mrs. Met N., 56, and her husband, Mr. San Sat, make jar (made from cement and sand). She sells it from her house and also takes it to customers' homes. Met has six children, three of whom are married. Three others stay home; one is a student and two help in their parent's business. Together they earn approximately US$9.00 per day. Met faces difficulty with transporting jar to sell due to the fact that her existing motorcycle is very old. So Met would like to request a loan of US$800 to purchase a second-hand motorcycle with a trailer to use instead to transport jar to sell. Met and her family live in Roleap Commune, Pursat Province.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand motorcycle with trailer to instead to use to transport jars to sell

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeun N., 46, is a primary school teacher who also raises pigs. Her husband, Mr. Savy Et, 48, a farmer, earns about US$2.00 per day. Saroeun has seven children, one of whom is married. Her other children live at home and go to school. She also has a nephew who lives with the family and help with their businesses. The family lives in Ptasrong Commune, Pursat Province, Cambodia.

Rice crops and raising pigs are the main source income for Saroeun's family. Because her farmland is infertile, she would like to request a loan of $500 USD. She willl buy pig food to fatten her pigs so that she can sell them on time at a high price. With the rest of the loan, she will buy fertilizer to use on her rice crop.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice crop and pig food to fatten her pigs

loans.name: Voeun

texts.en:
Mr. Voeun R., 28, is businessman who sells oxen and buffalo. He buys oxen from farmers and stocks to resell for a profit. He has been growing his business since 2005 and earns approximately around 12,000 Riel (US$3) per day. 

His wife, Mrs. Sokhon Pat, 28, is farmer who grows rice. Voeun lives with his wife and two children in Ptasrong Commune, Pursat Province. 

To sustain and improve his business, Voeun needs a loan of 2,000,000 Riel ($500 USD) to use as capital for his oxen and buffalo-selling business.

loans.use: To use as capital for his ox and buffalo-selling business

loans.name: Sovanthavy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sovanthavy P. is 37 years old. She sells groceries at a school, including a large variety of products such as porridge cake, candy, and fritters. Typically she earns around US$ 3.00 daily. She cares for two young children and cooks food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Savuth Eng, is 38 years old and an electronic repairman who fixes televisions, CD players, and radios.

For aid in increasing their income, Sovanthavy is requesting a loan of US$1,100 for her husband to buy additional electronic materials for his repair business. They would also like to build a cottage to house his shop.

loans.use: To buy additional electronic materials for her husband's repair shop.

loans.name: Mon

texts.en: Mrs. Mon D. is 40 years old and widowed with two children. She makes and sells rattan baskets, earning around US$5.00 per day. Her children are young and need much care, which is why she works so hard every day. In order to grow her business and increase sales, Mon needs a loan to purchase more raw materials with which to make additional baskets to sell.

loans.use: To purchase rattan to make additional baskets to sell.

loans.name: Bina

texts.en:
Mrs. Bina C. has already paid back her first loan from Kiva. She was the first member of her loan group to repay and she paid back well before the term. Mrs. C. purchased green vegetables with her first loan. She sells her vegetables in the town of Bholdhoka. Her husband, Mr. Puspa C., has no work, so her family's living conditions are still very miserable. She has not been able to send her children to boarding school. They all depend solely on the small vegetable shop.

Mrs. C. is a very hard-working woman. She wants to expand her business to earn more from her shop. So she is requesting a loan of Rs 15000.00 fb. She is very grateful to all the lenders who supported her by giving her the first loan.

loans.use: To expand her shop further

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeun S. is 40 years old and sells groceries from her house such as vegetables, meat, and other recipe ingredients. Her husband, Mr. Tai Tam, is a 33 year old motorcycle driver. They live in the Omperl Commune in the Siem Reap Province.

With her grocery sales, Soeun typically earns around US$5 per day, while her husband usually earns around US$4 per day. They have two young kids at home. In order to expand her business and increase their income, Soeun needs a loan of US$600 to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Asha's Riziki Haigawanyi Group

texts.en:
Asha is 29 years and she is single. She is a bites (maandazi and bread) seller since 2008. Every day, she works from 7am to 11am at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Asha isow looking for a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with tailoring, painting, juice sales, charcoal sales, bites, and clothing sales.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Sakun

texts.en:
Sakun B. is 24 years old and sells groceries in front of her house, including products like cakes and soft drinks. She typically earns US$4 per day. Sakun lives in the Omperl Commune, Siem Reap Province, where she cares for her grandmother.

To satisfy increased customer demand, Sakun wants to expand her inventory. Hence, she needs a loan of US$200 to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kaije's Riziki Haigawanywi Charcoal Sales Group

texts.en:
Kaije  is 30 years old. She is married with 5 children, ages between 9 years and 6 months. She has been a charcoal and snack seller since 2005. Every day she works from 7 am to 9 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Kaije is now requesting a loan to buy more charcoal for the expansion of her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with juice sales, charcoal sales, food sales, coconuts and clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Kibibi's Riziki Haigawanywi Group

texts.en:
Kibibi is 26 years old. She is a divorced mother of three children, aged eight, six and one years old. She has been a charcoal and chapati seller since 2007. She works every day from 6 am to 8 pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Kibibi is now looking for a loan to buy more charcoal in order to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Kiwanja, who runs her own restaurant.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Shumbana's Hakuna Kulala Group

texts.en:
Shumbana is thirty years old. She is married with three children, aged two, three, and four. She also cares for two other children, aged six and eight. She became a food seller in 2004. She works every day from 8 am to 6 pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Shumbana is now requesting a loan to buy more milk for resale. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling chips, perfumes, juice, and firewood.

loans.use: To buy more milk for resale.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
With skillful experience in motorcycle repairs, Mr. Tom T. decided to open his own repair business, where he also provides motorcycle washing services outside his home. He opened his business in 2008, and so far it is going well. He earns around US$8.00 per day. His wife, who is 23 years old, sells groceries and earns around US$4.00 per day. The couple lives with one child in Kontang Commune, Siem Reap Province.

Because of his quickly growing business, Tom is requesting a loan to purchase more repair service instruments. He would also like to use part of the loan to buy a faster and more efficient washing machine.

loans.use: To purchase additional instruments to repair motorcycles.

loans.name: Lutfiya

texts.en:
Lutfiya A. is 47 years old. She is married and the loving mother of four children. Lutfiya started her business in order to help her husband with the household expenses, especially because her mother-in-law lives with them and is an elderly woman who requires special care and medications. Lutfiya also wants to provide a good education for her son.

She got started in May 2002 after a neighbor told her that the sale of women's clothing was a good business. Lutfiya sells her goods in the central local market. She shows very good taste in choosing the clothing she buys and amazing marketing skills in convincing her clients which clothing they should buy.

Today she is requesting a loan for 2000 Somoni ($600), which she will repay in six months. She will use it to purchase more seasonal clothes because she has a lot of clients during this time. Lutfiya is thankful for your generosity and help.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing to increasing her range of goods.

loans.name: Zulfiniso

texts.en:
Zulfiniso’s principal occupation is the cultivation and production of vegetables. She is an excellent and admirable farmer. She received from her husband the techniques and secrets of this beautiful activity. These skills have allowed her to develop multiple agricultural capabilities and given her the possibility of maintaining her loving family in these times of numerous financial problems.

Zulfiniso has two children who have been her aid in the most difficult moments of her life and are her principal motivation to progress. For this reason, she wishes to contribute to their dreams by furnishing their small home in the best way possible and opening a small store there to cover the household expenses.

Zulfiniso requests your help in the form of a loan that will allow her to obtain greater revenue this year and reach each of her goals.
