She is asking for a loan of 2100 Somoni ($625) for the term of nine months. She will use the loan to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer to sow seasonal vegetables. Zulfiniso expresses her gratitude to everyone for supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Kholbibi

texts.en:
Kholbibi C. is 55 years old. She is a widow and the mother of five children. It was very difficult for her to raise her children alone but the love of her children made her work hard day by day.

As her family has been living off the crops they grow, the property has been divided among the children and grandchildren over the years. Now all of her children are adults and she works along with them cultivating potatoes, corn, and other vegetables. When their crop comes in, they transport it to Dushanbe to sell. This business has helped to pay the family's economic expenses and provide an education to her children.

Today she needs a loan to pay the salary of hired workers and also the transportation of the crop. With this desire in mind, she asks your consideration to receive them in your kind heart. She requests 2100 Somoni ($625) for the term of nine months. Kholbibi wants to thank everyone for supporting her and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: To pay the salary of hired workers and transportation of the crop.

loans.name: Thouk

texts.en:
Mrs. Thouk Y. is 35 years old and has been selling paste-fish (Khmer Cheese) and dried fish in the market since 2005. She earns about US $5.00 per day. Thouk lives with her husband and four children in Chomkar Somrong Commune, Battambang Province. Her husband, 34, sells sugarcane juice and also operates a motorcycle taxi service.

To increase her family's income, Thouk is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase more paste-fish and dried fish from a wholesale supplier to sell in the market.

loans.use: To purchase more wholesale fish products to sell in the market.

loans.name: Salama's Hakuna Kulala Group

texts.en:
Evelyne is thirty years old. She's married with three children, aged two, three, and four. She also cares for two other children, aged six and eight. She became a food seller in 2004. She works every day from 8 am to 6 pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Salama is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes and perfume for resale to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling clothes, firewood, charcoal, perfume, and potatoes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and prefume for resale.

loans.name: Fathiya's Hakuna Kulala Group

texts.en:
Fathiya, 26, is single. She has been a tailoring and selling clothes since 2003. Every day, she works from 8am to 3pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Fathiya is requesting a loan to buy more tailoring items and clothes for the expansion of her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Veronica, who also has a business selling clothes.

loans.use: To buy tailoring items and clothes.

loans.name: Saylavkhol

texts.en: Saylavkhol K. is 45 years old. She is married and has five children. With  persistence, dedication, and the help of her husband, they have been able to cultivate their land. With the help of his parents, she has been able to get an education, and she’s a well-rounded individual. Saylavkhol’s expertise is the cultivation of vegetables such as potatoes, cabbage, carrots, and other vegetables, thanks to the teachings that she inherited from her family. Saylavkhol would like to manage her land more efficiently, which will make it more productive and it will enable her to grow different varieties of crops. In order to do so, she is requesting a loan of 2100 Somoni ($625 USD) for the term of nine months for purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer. Let's help Saylavkhol continue with her noble intention of improving her quality of life and that of her children.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Saltan Mohammad

texts.en:
Saltan Mohammad is 30 years old. He lives in a household of 13 members. He has a catering shop that he has been involved in for more than 11 years. He has 4 workers and one of his brothers is also involved with Mohammad in the business. During the war, he was out of the country for about 5 years but when he came back to Afghanistan he started his business again.

Now he needs to expand his business. He wants to take out an individual loan of 50000 Afghanis with a term of 18 months to complete his stock and enlarge his shop. He has some good numbers of clients. They are very happy with him.

Saltan wants his business to become more popular. He wishes to have anther shop in the next few years and become very strong in his business. It is one of his best wishes and he hopes to do it. He would like to thank lenders that help people through this process.

loans.use: To complete his stock and enlarge his shop

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en: Nargis S. is an enterprising woman with a big desire to improve the quality of life of her family. She is a single mother with two children. She has led a difficult life, particularly when she became a widow and was unable to find work to replace her husband’s income and support her family. One and a half years ago, she found a job and since then she has been working for the cell phone company “Beeline.” Today Nargis is planning to expand her business and to buy more SIM cards and cards for the replenishment of the balance amount. For this reason, she needs a loan of 2000 Somoni ($600 USD) that she will repay over a period of 12 months. The love of her children is the biggest reason for Nargis to make an effort to provide what they need. Today is a good day to help someone in need. Don’t hesitate, your support will be a big help to this family. Thanks!

loans.use: Purchasing SIM cards and cards for the replenishment of the balance amount

loans.name: Mtumwa's Riziki Haigawanywi Group

texts.en:
Mtumwa is 27 years and married. She has been a juice seller since 2006. She works every day from 8:30 am to 6:30 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $65 from her sales.

Mtumwa now hopes for a loan to expand her business by adding items to her current stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with tailoring, juice sales, firewood sales, and bites sales.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding items to her current stock.

loans.name: Asha's Nia Njema Group

texts.en:
Asha is 45 years old. She is married with 4 children aged 20, 18, 10 and 7 years old. She has been a charcoal and soup seller since 2004. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Asha is now requesting a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with shop ownership, juice sales, charcoal sales, chips, and clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Patima's Daima Tudumu Group

texts.en:
Patima is 36 years old. She is divorced with four children, aged 15, 13, 10 and 2 years old. She has been a clothes seller since 2006. She works every day from 6 am to 8 pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $155 from her sales.

In the past, Patima has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She is now looking for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Khadija, who has a business selling firewood.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Muhiddin

texts.ru: Негматов Мухиддин парень в возросте 26 лет имеет двоих детей , вместе с женой торгует на рынке г. Худжанда арендовав отдел в магазине. В его ассортимент товаров входит разновидность туалетного мыла, щотки, губки для мытья посуды,заколки и резинки для женских волос и .т.д. Уже 5 лет как они самостоятельно видут свой бизнес , за товаром ездит сам Мухиддин , а торговлю при его отсутствии ведет его жена, для увеличения товара Мухиддин решил обратится в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Muhiddin N. is 26 years old, he has two children. Together with his wife he sells on the market of the town of Hudjanda by renting a space in the store. The assortment of his merchandise includes soap, brushes, sponges for washing dishes, women's hair decorations and other items. They have been independently running their business for five years now. Muhiddin travels for the merchandise and his wife sells in the store while he is away. To increase their assortment Muhiddin decided to come to MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling retail of every day convenience items

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is 22 years old and single. She has been a food seller since 2006. She works every day from 7 am to 4 pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

Mwanahawa is now seeking a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma, 32, is divorced with two children ages 7 and 5. She has been tailoring clothing since 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

Fatma is looking for a loan to buy more tailoring items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items for her business.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is 50 years old and married with one child, who is 18. She has been a bites seller since 2006. She works every day from 6 am to 6 pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

In the past, Mwanajuma has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Mwanajuma is now looking for a loan to expand her business by increasing her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by increasing her current stock.

loans.name: Sulton

texts.ru: Курбонов Султон кредитор Микроинвеста , с 2007 года по сей день. Первый займ он брал для покупки телевизора и подставки под него, для своего дома , как потребительский займ.Удачно без проблемно погасив его он решил повторно получить кредит. Следующий займ он планирует потратить на покупку мелкорогатого скота.Он объяснил , что в дальнейшем сезонн для откорма скота и его продажи, поэтому он хочет увеличить численность своего скота. Султон очень любит заниматься уходом за баранами.Сейчас у него дома 6 баранов.Султон Курбоновблагодарен за поддержку  KIVA  процветания в их деятельности.
texts.en:
Sulton K. has been a customer of MicroInvest from 2007 to the present. The first loan he took out was a consumer loan to buy a television set and stand for his home. Having successfully repaid it without problem, he decided to once again obtain a loan. He plans to spend his next loan on the purchase of small livestock, sheep and goats. He explained he wants to increase the size of his flock to fatten next season for sale. Sulton really loves caring for sheep. At present he has six in his flock. Sulton K. is grateful that Kiva supports the well-being of his business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fattening of livestock

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila is 28 years old and married. She sells clothing. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales. Mila requests a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Nuru's Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Nuru is 45 years old. She is married with two children, aged 20 and 7. She has owned and run a small food store since 2007. She works every day from 9 am to 7 pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Nuru is now looking for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who either own a shop, sell clothes, or sell home products.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Florence's Nakyeyune Group

texts.en:
Florence is the leader of this five member group. She is 42 years old and married with four daughters, who are between the ages of 24 and 15. All her children go to school. She owns a five-room house where she stays with six people. Florence doesn't take care of any additional family members. There is no electricity or piped water at her home but the family gets three meals a day.

Florence resides in and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She sells chicken and rents a stall at Kalerwe in the city suburbs. She sells to an average of 30 people a day and works seven days a week. Florence's major monthly expenses include rent for the business premises, school fees, and medication. She uses a bicycle to commute to and from work. She has been in this business for six years. Her main challenges are the rainy season, which disturbs her a lot, and seasonality.

Florence has been with MCDT for over six years and this is her twelfth loan, working all along with the same groupmates. She wants to use this loan to increase stock in her business. Florence also aspired to build rental rooms in the available space near her house.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Amina's Mkorofi Si Mwenzetu Group

texts.en:
Amina, 47, married with five children ranging in age from 24 to 14, has been a milk seller since 2001. She works daily from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Amina is now requesting a loan to buy more milk for resale in order to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses in clothing sales, juice sales and tailoring services.

loans.use: To buy more milk for resale in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: ASTOU K.  est une femme mariée et mere de plusieurs enfants.Pour aider son mari retraité,elle fait la transformation des poissons .les poissons transformés sont vendus au marché.Elle a eu bénéfié de plusieurs prets pour le renforcement de son activité. les revenus tirés de l' activité servent à payer les frais de scolarité et le frais medicaux des enfants mais aussi la nourriture pour la famille.
texts.en:
Astou K. is a married woman who has several children. To help her retired husband, she processes fish. The processed fish are then sold in the market. She has benefitted from several loans to improve her business. The income generated by this business is used to pay her children’s school fees and medical expenses as well as to purchase food for the family.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To impove her business

loans.name: Barakatou

texts.fr: Cette femme est une tailleuse elle gere un atelier ou elle emploie deux (02) personnes payées mensuellement.le pret sollicité serve au renforcement de son activité par l' acquisition d' une nouvelle machine à coudre et des tissus.
texts.en:
Barakatou D. is a seamstress who manages her own salon where she has two monthly paid employees. The requested loan will allow her to improve her business by purchasing a new sewing machine and some fabrics.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and some fabrics.

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en: Hayat has run this small store for eight years. She is 42 years old, single, and has settled in Khirdalan town. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Djabrayil region in the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy the goods for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Lala

texts.en: Lala (her husband is pictured) is the mother of 2 children. She  is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Agdam region in the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, settled in the Absheron region. Her husband has been in building materials sales business for 10 years. Now this family needs a loan of $1200 to buy spare parts so as to improve their business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for re-sale

loans.name: Pierrine

texts.fr: Pierrine  C., 40 ans, mariée avec 06 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois des Femmes Catholiques de Vélingara depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter et revendre des thioubs (tissus teintés) et des ensembles. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. <b>Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Pierrine C., age 40, is married and has six children in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Femmes Catholiques de Vélingara for three and a half years. She wants this loan to buy and resell “thioub” (dyed cloth) and some outfits. Her income allows her to help with family expenses.The loan that she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell dyed cloth and outfits

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 32 year old mother of one school-going child. She lives with her family in Nyalenda Kisumu in Kenya. She operated a dressmaking shop in Nairobi until 2004 when she moved her business to Kisumu. She specializes in making women's dresses and school uniforms.

The central location of her shop in busy environment coupled with many years of doing good business within the community, has gained her a good reputation and a wide customer base. She intends to acquire additional stock of dressmaking materials with a portion of $500 for which she has applied.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of dressmaking materials.

loans.name: Shagufta's Group

texts.en:
Shagufta baji is the wife of A. G. and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its historical places. She has been living in this city for the last 25 years. She completed her education through the 8th standard. She is the mother of six children: two sons and four daughters. Her elder son helps his father in his business. Her younger son is not yet of school-going age. Her eldest daughter is in the 8th standard in school. The next younger is in the 7th standard. 

Shagufta baji's husband has a fruit-selling business. He has been in this business for the last 10 years. Shagufta baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more seasonal fruits to expand her husband's fruit business. 

She is joined in her loan group by three other members. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies (wires, tube lights and switch boards) for her husband's electric shop. Jamila baji and Shahida baji want loans to buy more cloth to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more fruits to resell

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma baji is a wife of U. H. and lives in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 35 years. She completed fifth grade in school. She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. Her husband makes and sells furniture. Her first two sons help in their father's furniture-making business. Her youngest son is in seventh grade. Her daughter is in fifth grade. Her husband has been in this business for the last 25 years. He has a good reputation in his community and within the city. Najma baji is a housewife who prefers to do household work and to take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy material (woods and nails) for her husband's furniture making business.

There are five people in Najma’s loan group: Fozia baji wants a loan to buy wood for her furniture-making business. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy cloth to resell. Shabana baji wants a loan to buy scrap (iron, steel) for her scrap business. Zaib-un-Nisa baji wants a loan to buy more garments to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wood and nails for her husband's furniture-making business

loans.name: Kosar Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Kosar Parveen Baji is the wife of I. A. Butt and lives in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places. She has been living in this city for the last 20 years. She received her education until 8th standard. She is the mother of four children: three daughters and one son. Her son is in 14th standard. Her eldest daughter is in 10th standard. The daughter younger than her is in 8th standard. Her younger daughter is in 6th standard. Her husband has a scrap business. Kosar Baji is a seamstress by profession. She sews clothes for her neighbors. She has been in this profession for the last 20 years. She is applying for a loan to buy a sewing machine to expand her clothes sewing business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy a welding machine. Bushra baji wants a loan to buy wood for her furniture making business. Nusrat baji wants a loan to buy old computer bodies to repair and to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia baji is the wife of M. H. and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its historical places. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 19 years. She is the mother of four daughters; they are in school in the 8th standard, 6th standard, 5th standard, and 4th standard. Shazia baji's husband has a carpet-making business. Shazia baji is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighbors. She successfully repaid her three previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy a sewing machine to expand her clothing business.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members. Samina baji wants a loan to buy artificial jewelry to resell. Ameer Fatima baji wants a loan to buy material (such as cooking oil and spices) for her nimko making and selling business. Saima baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies (tube lights and switchboards) for her electric shop. Abida baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Parveen M.ashraf Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji is the widow of M. A. and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its historical places. She has been living in this city for the last 13 years. She is the mother of two sons. Her elder son is a salesman in an electronic items shop. Her younger son is a professional driver. Parveen baji has a business selling clothes. She has been in this profession for the last 10 years. She is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members. Sajida baji wants a loan to buy iron to make iron chains, which are used to tie cattle. Azra baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Ayesha baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics for her beauty parlor. Rani baji wants a loan to buy wood for her furniture-making business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Sagar

texts.fr: Sagar S. est vendeuse au marché Grand Thies de pagne ,encens ,tissu,etc..depuis dix ans.Elle est agée de quarante trois ans et est mariée et mere de cinq enfants
texts.en:
Sagar S. is in sales at the Grand Thies marketplace. She has been selling pagnes (colorful West Africa cloth), incense, fabrics, etc. for ten years. She is 43 years old, married, and the mother of five.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sellling various items

loans.name: Aly

texts.fr: Monsieur S. est coordonnier qui achete des peaux de betes dans les quartiers pour ensuite les taner pour les vendre à Dakar depuis plusieurs années. Il habite au quartier Cité Lamyet agé de cinquante cinq ans
texts.en:
Monsieur S. is a shoemaker who buys animal skins locally, tans them, and then sells them in Dakar. He has been doing this for the past several years. He lives in the Cité Lamy neighborhood and is fifty five years old.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell animal skins

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia esta casada su esposo es empleado den una empresa y tienen un niño pequeño de 8 años, cuando el niño empezó a crecer ella veía que también los gastos aumentaban, y decidió empezar a elaborar y vender meriendas para piñatas, despedidas y baby shower, y así siguió desde hace 7 años que empezó con su negocio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para invertirlo en materia prima. Con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Leticia is married. Her husband is employed in a business, and they have one 8 year old boy. When the child began to grow, she saw that the household expenses also grew, and she decided to begin to make and sell picnic lunches for Christmas parties, farewell parties and baby showers. She has continued this activity for 7 years since she began with her business. She needs a loan of US $300 that she would repay in 4 months in order to invest in primary ingredients. With your help she will continue improving her life.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Elena es casada su esposo es trailero, tiene dos hijos. Ella inicio su negocio cuando los niños entraron a la escuela, ya que los gastos se empezaron a incrementar y con el sueldo de su esposo era difícil completar para solventar los gastos; entonces ella empezó a vender taquitos en la barda de la escuela de sus hijos, y así comenzó a hacer comidas en su casa y después venderlas, poco a poco ha aumentado sus clientes y ha logrado salir adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar una estufa que le permita hacer mayor cantidad de comidas y así incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Elena is married. Her husband is a truck driver and they have two children. She began her business when her children started school since their bills began to increase. With her husband's salary, it was difficult to cover all their expenses. So, she began to sell taquitos at the gate of her children's school. Then, she began to make food in her home and then sell it. Gradually, she has increased her number of customers and has been able to get ahead.

She needs a loan of US $300, which she will repay in four months, in order to purchase a stove that will allow her to make a greater quantity of food and therefore increase in her income.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a stove.

loans.name: Fabiola Berenice

texts.es:
Fabiola es madre soltera y una mujer muy emprendedora. Al tener la necesidad de tener un ingresos para poder sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo deicidio buscar una actividad que le permitiera tener un ingreso, ya que si trabaja en alguna empresa estaría lejos de su hijo mucho tiempo, fue hace 2 años que empezó a elaborar y vender comida a sus vecinos y conocidos, y poco a poco ha logrado salir adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para invertirlo en materia prima y así poder continuara con su negocio.
texts.en:
Fabiola is a single mother and a very entrepreneurial lady. Due to her necessity to have an income to be able to help her young son get ahead, she decided to find a way of living that allows her to have an income as working in a company would keep her away from her son for long intervals. Two years ago she started to prepare and sell food to her neighbors and friends, and little by little she has succeeded in moving ahead.

She needs a loan of $300, to be repaid in 4 months, to invest in raw materials and thus be able to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw material to increase food production and sale.

loans.name: Tricolor Group

texts.es:
La asociación “tricolor “pertenece al centro focal de Villa Tejada, con la ayuda de su asistente de créditos trabajan muy responsables en todas sus actividades de grupo.
Casi todas casadas, con familias numerosas nos cuentan que los gastos diarios que tienen en sus hogares sobrepasan al ingreso que obtienen en sus negocios ya que sus hijos van creciendo y necesitan mayores necesidades.
La actividades de negocio de la asociación Tricolor es variada , por ejemplo, venden variedad de cosméticos, venta de condimentos, Martha se dedica a la fabricación de rodillos de pintura que los comercializa principalmente en el interior del país, Mirtha, Pamela y Álvaro tienen un centro de llamadas telefónicas. La asociación  Tricolor afirma que necesita mayores créditos para la compra de mayores productos en general, en el caso de la central telefónica, desean comprar accesorios telefónicos .Luego mejorarían sus ingresos y su estabilidad economica para el bien de sus familias.
texts.en:
The “Tricolor” association is at the center of Villa Tejada. With the help of their credit assistant they work very responsibly in all the activities of the group. Almost all of them are married and have large families. They tell us that the cost of daily life in their homes exceeds the income they earn in their businesses since their children are growing and they have more needs. The businesses of the Tricolor association are varied. For example, they sell a variety of cosmetics, condiments. Martha makes rolling pins, which she sells mainly in the interior of the country. Mirtha, Pamela and Álvaro have a phone call center. The Tricolor association affirms that it needs larger loans for the purchase of more products in general. In the case of the telephone center, they would like to buy telephone accessories. They will improve their incomes and their economic stability, for the good of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The Tricolor association affirms that it needs larger loans for the purchase of more products in general.

loans.name: San Juana

texts.es:
San Juana vive con sus tres hijos, hace aproximadamente un año y medio se separo de su pareja, por lo que tuvo que buscar una actividad para obtener ingresos, y que esto le permitiera sacar a delante a sus hijos, pues lo que le da su ex pareja es muy poco y no le alcanza para solventar los gastos. Hace un año empezó a vender artículos para el hogar por catalogo entre sus vecinos y familiares, gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido salir adelante con su negocio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu apoyo San Juana podrá continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
San Juana lives with her three children. For about a year and a half she has been separated from her spouse. Because of this she had to look for work in order to get an income, which allows her to improve her children’s lives. Her ex-husband gives her very little support, not enough to pay the bills. A year ago she began selling articles for the home by catalog among her family and friends. Thanks to her efforts she has moved ahead her business. She needs a loan of US$575 that she would repay in 6 months in order to buy merchandise. With your help San Juana will be able to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of animals to keep operating her butcher shop.

loans.name: Nory

texts.es:
Nory es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua.

Nory es soltera y tiene 23 años, Nory es la mayor de 7 hermanos y vive con sus padres a quienes apoya en el sustento del hogar. Nory vende hoja de coca al por mayor y menor de manera ambulatoria en el paradero de Huatatas que se encuentra a la salida de la ciudad de Ayacucho a otros distritos, su producto lo compra en el mercado Nery García actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su mama, en algunas oportunidades dependiendo de la demanda de su producto viaja a las ferias.

Nory necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de hoja de coca. Nory sueña con ampliar su negocio, tener un puesto de venta adecuado y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Nory is a member of the Wiñarisun Communal Bank which means “Let’s Grow” in Quechua.

Nory is single and is 23 years old. Nory is the oldest of 7 siblings and lives with her parents who she supports in paying household expenses. Nory sells coca leaves wholesale and retail as a traveling salesperson in the Huatatas area, which is at Ayacucho’s exit to other districts. She buys her product in the. Nery García market, an activity she carries out with her mother’s help and sometimes travels to agricultural fairs depending upon demand.

Nory needs a loan of 1000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of coca leaves. Nory dreams of expanding her business, having an good quality market stand and that her children will be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Nory needs a loan of 1000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of coca leaves.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester is 20 years old. She lives in Kisumu, Kenya with her husband and two children.  She is the proprietor of a retail shop adjacent to her home. In her shop, she sells essential items such as bread, flour, cooking oil, sugar, kerosene, and soap. She has applied for a loan of US $500 to enable her to increase her stock and obtain supplies that sell quickly in her community.

loans.use: Increase stock of supplies.

loans.name: Fiorela Katherine

texts.es:
Fiorela es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua.

Fiorela es soltera y tiene 19 años, Fiorela vive en la casa de sus padres y estudia enfermería en la universidad, en algunas oportunidades trabaja a medio tiempo en boticas, también realiza servicios de aplicaciones de inyectables a domicilio. Fiorela implementó un pequeño tópico en su casa donde brinda servicios de primeros auxilios, vende algunos documentos y también tiene una fotocopiadora, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su mama.

Fiorela necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicamentos y materiales para el tópico. Los sueños de Fiorela son culminar sus estudios, estudiar una maestría y tener una farmacia bien surtida.
texts.en:
Fiorela is a member of "Banco Comunal Wiñarisun". Wiñarisun means "Let's grow" in Quechua.

Fiorela is single and 19 years old. She lives with her parents and study nursing at the university. Sometimes she works half-time in pharmacies and she also gives injections at home. Fiorela has a small facility at home where she gives first-aid, sells some documents, and she also has a photocopy machine. She is assisted by her mother.

She needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy medicine and material for her first-aid services. It is Fiorela's dream to finish her studies, study a master's degree, and own a well assorted pharmacy.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase medicine and material for her first-aid services.

loans.name: Senobia

texts.es:
Senobia es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua.

Senobia es casada, tiene 47 años y 3 hijos, Senobia tiene un puesto en el mercado central en donD. venD. comida típica como caldos, que prepara muy D. madrugada en su casa y luego transporta a su puesto, sus ventas lo realiza desD. las 7 D. la mañana hasta las 3 D. la tarD., actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su hija. Además Senobia tiene una tienda pequeña D. abarrotes en su casa y quien se encarga D. la atención es su otra hija.

Senobia necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, leche, leña y carne. Los sueños D. Senobia son tener un recreo campestre en su casa, sacar adelante a sus hijos y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Senobia is a member of Wiñarisun Communal Bank, which means “Let’s Grow” in quechua.

Senobia is married, is 47 years old and has 3 children. Senobia has a stand in the central market where she sells typical food such as soups, which she prepare early in the morning at home and then transports to her stand. She sells from 7 a.m. until 3 p.m., an activity that she carries out with her daughter’s help. In addition, Senobia has a small grocery store in her house of which her other daughter is in charge.

Senobia needs a loan of 3000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, firewood and meat. The dreams of Senobia are to have an outdoor patio at her house, that her children advance and that they become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Senobia needs a loan of 3000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, firewood, and meat.

loans.name: Nelly Caro

texts.es:
Nelly es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad.

Nelly es casada, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, Nelly tiene un colegio Adventista Unión, que se ubica en la Urb. Jardín en un local alquilado, el colegio tiene 2 años de funcionamiento y recién este año esta a su cargo, para lo cual la iglesia adventista realizó la transferencia a Nelly, Actualmente funciona inicial, secundaria y cuenta con 60 alumnos en total. Además Nelly trabaja en una Organización no Gubernamental como asistente proyectos, actividad que realiza por las mañanas y por las tardes se encarga de supervisar las actividades del colegio.

Nelly necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una computadora para la implementación del colegio. Nelly sueña con tener un local propio para el colegio y que sus hijos sean cristianos, profesionales al servicio de los demás.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of the Bank Communal Amor y Verdad. Nelly is married, has 3 children and is 36 years old, Nelly has a school called Adventista Unión, which is located in the Urb. Garden in a rented space. The school has been in operation for two years. Recently this year, the Adventist church made the transfer to Nelly, and she became in charge of the school. The school currently has primary and secondary schools and has 60 students in total. In addition Nelly works in an NGO as a project assistant in the mornings; in the afternoons, she is responsible for supervising the activities of the school. Nelly needs a loan of $675, which she will invest in the purchase of a computer for the school’s use. Nelly dreams of having her own location for the school and that her sons will become Christian professionals in the service of others.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of a computer for a school

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add selling fruit and vegetables to her present business

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es:
Valeriana es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad.

Valeriana es casada, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, Valeriana vive en la asociación Santa Teresa ubicado en la periferia de la ciudad, Valeriana viaja 2 veces por semana a las diferentes ferias de las región, de donde compra animales menores, quesos, que transporta a la ciudad de Ayacucho, los animales los beneficia en su casa y luego lo vende de casa en casa a clientes ya establecidos, también vende en su casa a sus clientes.

Valeriana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de carnero, gallinas y quesos. Valeriana sueña con brindar una buena educación a sus hijos para que sean profesionales, tener una tienda de abarrotes y construir mas niveles en su casa.
texts.en:
Valeriana is a member of the Bank Communal Amor y Verdad. Valeriana is married, 42 years old, and has 2 children. Valeriana lives in Santa Teresa located on the outskirts of the city. Valeriana travels twice a week to various fairs in the region, where she purchases small animals and cheese, which she transports to the city of Ayacucho. She butchers the animals in her house and then sells the meat from house to house to her established client base. She also sells to her customers at her home. Valeriana needs a loan of $350 to invest in the purchase of sheep, chicken, and cheese. Valeriana dreams of providing a good education to her children so that they can become professionals, having a grocery store, and building more floors in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase lamb, chicken, and cheese

loans.name: Betty Yolanda

texts.es:
Betty es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad.

Betty es casada, tiene 39 años y 4 hijos, Betty junto a su esposo tiene un carro con el cual realizan transporte al distrito de Paras, su hermano es el chofer y una vez por semana Betty viaja a la feria del distrito de donde compra quesos, animales menores, cereales, productos que vende a los comerciantes del mercado 12 de abril, Además Betty tiene otro carro que realiza servicio turístico, que es conducido por su esposo, mayormente viaja a la ciudad de Cuzco con las promociones de colegios.

Betty necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de carnero, gallina y queso. Betty sueña con construir su casa en el centro de la ciudad, su hija estudie medicina y tener una tienda mayorista de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Betty is a member of the Love and Truth Communal Bank (a group loan)

Betty is 39 years old, married, and has four children. She and her husband own a car which they use to provide people with transportation to Paras District. Her brother is the driver, and once per week Betty travels to the district fair, where she buys cheeses, young animals, and grains, which she then sells to the vendors in the 12 de Abril Market in the town where she lives. She also has another car, which she uses for tourism-related transport. Her husband drives this car, and mostly uses it to take school children to the city of Cuzco.

Betty needs a loan of 1500 soles (about $525) to purchase a cow, hens and cheese. Her dreams are to build a house in the city center, for her daughter to go to medical school, and to own a large dry goods store.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cow, hens and cheese

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of jewelry, perfumes, clothing and other goods for her small business.

loans.name: Romualda

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=33597&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Romualda es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño. Romualda es casada, tiene 50 años y 6 hijos, Romualda junto a toda su familia se dedican a realizar tejidos artesanales en Telar, su taller cuenta con 5 telares que producen frazadas, alfombras, individuales para lo cual cuenta con 2 operarios y también tejen sus hijos en sus horarios libres, Romualda se encarga del teñido, enrollado de la lana, sus tejidos los vende a los comerciantes de los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Además Romualda en algunas oportunidades viaja a las ferias de la región 2 veces por semana, dependiendo de sus ventas, donde compra quesos, cereales que vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho. También Romualda vende frutas, sus ventas lo realiza caminando por el centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Romualda necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lana, tintes. Romualda sueña con construir su casa con material noble, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos para que salgan adelante y ampliar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Romualda is a member of the Retoño Communal Bank. Romualda is married, 50 years old with 6 children. Romualda and her whole family create handmade fabrics on looms. Her workshop has 5 looms that produce blankets and small carpets. She has two operators, and her children also weave in their free hours. Romualda sees to the dyeing and the spinning of the wool. She sells her fabrics to dealers from markets in the city of Ayacucho. Romualda also sometimes travels to bi-weekly street fairs in the region, depending on her sales, where she buys cheeses and grains that she sells in the city of Ayacucho. Romualda also sells fruits strolling through the center of the city of Ayacucho. Roumalda needs a loan of $475 that will be invested in the purchase of wool and dyes. She dreams of building her house with fine materials, of providing a good education to her children so they can get ahead, and of expanding her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roumalda needs a loan of $475 that will be invested in the purchase of wool and dyes.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is a 50 year old widow with six children. One of the kids is currently in school, while the others have completed their schooling. Rose enjoys selling and has a great deal of experience in customer care. She has been selling maize and gari for thirty years to support her family.

She treks to farming communities to buy her stock from the farmers. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher price. She wants to use this loan to buy maize and bags of gari in bulk to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids who are ready to enter university this year.

Rose is a member of a community group called First Kings Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy maize and bags of gari in bulk.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño. Eugenia es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos que son estudiantes, Eugenia vive en la casa de su tío, Eugenia viaja a la selva ayacuchana 2 veces a la semana a comprar hoja de coca de los productores, luego de acopiar lo transporta a la ciudad de Ayacucho, sus ventas lo realiza a los comerciantes de los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho, sus ventas son al contado.

Eugenia Necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de hoja de coca. Eugenia sueña con tener casa propia, equipar su casa con todas las comodidades y que su negocio prospere.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the Retoño (sprout) Microfinance Institute. Eugenia is a 39-year-old woman with 3 school age children and a live-in partner. She lives in her uncle’s home. Eugenia travels to the Ayacuchan jungle twice a week in order to purchase coca leaves from the growers. After stocking up, she transports the leaves to the city of Ayacucho, where she sells them for a single cash payment.

Eugenia needs a loan of 1,000 PEN, which she will invest in purchasing coca leaves. She dreams of having her own home, equipping her home with all the amenities needed, and having a prosperous business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coca leaves

loans.name: Donatilda

texts.es:
Donatilda es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño. Donatilda es casada, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, Donatilda vive en casa alquilada, Donatilda viaja cada 15 días a la feria de San Felipe que se ubica a 4 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, donde vende maíz pelado, cereales procesados como harinas, y de la feria compra queso, carne, animales menores, luego de acopiar lo transporta a la ciudad de Ayacucho, los animales los beneficia en su casa y luego lo reparte de casa en casa y también restaurantes.

Donatilda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos y animales. Donatilda sueña con tener casa propia, hacer crecer su negocio y que todos sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Donatilda is an associate of the “Retoño Comunal Bank”. She’s 36, married with 3 children. She lives in a rented house. She travels 4 hours to the San Felipe fair every 15 days outside the city of Ayacucho. There she sells corn and processed grains like flour. She buys cheese, meat, and small animals, which she gathers together and brings to the city of Ayacucho, where she takes care of the animals in her home before selling them off to neighbors and local restaurants. Donatilda needs a loan of 1000 soles ($1US = 3 soles, approx) to invest in cheese and animals. Donatilda dreams of owning a house, growing a business and that her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Donatilda needs a loan of 1,000 soles to invest in cheese and animals.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
Bernardina es socia del Banco Comunal Imperio. Bernardina es casada, tiene 33 años y 5 hijos, Bernardina junto a su esposo se dedican a ala elaboración de panes, el horno es rustico, sus ventas lo realizan en el mismo horno y también reparten a las tiendas, Además Bernardina viaja a las ferias de la región 3 a 4 veces a la semana, donde vende verduras, abarrotes y panes y de las ferias compra cereales, papa, quesos y animales menores que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho y también en su barrio.

Bernardina necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, harina. Bernardina sueña con ampliar su negocio, sus hijos sean profesionales e implementar con las maquinarias necesarias una panadería más grande.
texts.en:
Bernardina is a member of the Imperio Communal Bank (a group loan). She is 33 years old, married and has five children. She and her husband bake breads in a rustic oven. They sell straight from where they bake the bread and also distribute bread to local stores. Bernardina also travels to regional fairs three to four times per week, where she sells vegetables, dry goods and bread and buys grains, potatoes, cheese and young animals, which she sells in the Abastos Market in Ayacucho as well as in her own neighborhood.

Bernardina needs a loan of 1050 soles (US $375) to buy sugar, rice, and flour. She dreams of expanding her business, of establishing a larger bakery with the additional necessary machinery, and that her children will grow up to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice and flour

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
Eulogia es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad. Eulogia es casada, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, su casa esta ubicado en el distrito de Carmen Alto, Eulogia junto a su hijo se dedica a la elaboración de bellos tejidos en telar como pasadizos, individuales, para lo cual utilizan lana de ovino, y también confeccionan gorros, correas, carteras, cojines que luego son bordados para lo cual cuenta con trabajadoras a quienes renumera de acuerdo a su producción, sus ventas lo realiza en el mercado artesanal de la ciudad a través de pedidos y en algunas oportunidades lo venden en la ciudad de Lima a donde viaja su hijo.

Eulogia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lana, hilo y tintes. Eulogia sueña con mejorar su casa, que sus hijos sean profesionales, producir más tejidos y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Eulogia is a member of "Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad". She is married, 42 years old and has 3 children. Her house is located in the district of Carmen Alto. Eulogia, together with her son, makes beautiful woven fabrics such as ponchos and place mats for which she uses lamb's wool, and she also makes hats, belts, wallets, and pillows which are embroidered by workers who need to be paid according to their production. She sells her products through orders at the local craftworks market and sometimes she sells in the town of Lima when her son travels there.

Eulogia needs a loan of 1000 soles to be invested in buying wool, yarn and dye. Eulogia dreams of improving her house, of her children becoming professionals, of making more fabrics, and of expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool, yarn, and dye to increase production of woven fabrics.

loans.name: San Juana Guadalupe

texts.es:
Juay necesitaba dinero para poder solventar sus gastos, ya que su familia no podía pagárselos y ella quería salir adelante, por lo que hace un año empezó con la venta de zapatos, primero vendiendo solo a sus familiares pero le ha ido muy bien y poco a poco ha ido adquiriendo mas clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu apoyo Juany podrá seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Juay needed money to be able to cover her expenses as her family could not pay them. She wanted to advance in life, which is why one year ago she started selling shoes. First she sold only to her relatives, but it has gone very well for her and little by little she has acquired more clients.

She needs a loan for US $300 which will be re-paid in 6 months to buy merchandise. With your support Juany will be able to continue studying.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad. Haydee es casada, tiene 24 años y 2 hijos, Haydee tiene una casa de material rustico muy amplia que esta ubicado en el Distrito de Carmen Alto. Haydee junto a su esposo realizan trabajos en telar como pasadizos, frazadas con diseños y figuras de la cultura Wari, para lo cual cuenta con 3 telares y 2 operarios que son sus cuñados, Haydee se encarga del teñido, hilado de las lanas, sus ventas lo realizan en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho y también realizan los trabajos a través de pedidos.

Haydee necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lanas y también fierros para la construcción de su casa. Haydee sueña con construir su casa de material noble, ofrecer sus productos a distintos lugares y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Haydee is a member of the Amor y Verdad Communal Bank (a group loan). She is 24 years old and married with two children. She has a very large, rustic house in the Carmen Alto District. She and her husband make loom weavings like blankets with designs or partterns from the Wari culture. Haydee owns three looms and employs two of her in-laws as weavers. Haydee dyes the wool and makes yarn from it. She sells her wares in the markets of the city of Ayacucho, and also fills custom orders.

Haydee needs a loan of 3000 soles ($1,025), which she will use to buy wool for weaving and iron rods for the construction of her home. Haydee dreams of building her house from solid materials, of selling her wares in different places and of providing her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool for weaving and iron rods for home construction

loans.name: 23 De Marzo Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra el centro focal de Villa Exaltación  a éste pertenece, la asociación “23 de marzo”, integrada 17 mujeres ansiosas de progresar en sus pequeños negocios.
La mayoría en el grupo son casadas y afirman que necesitan ayudar a sus parejas en la economía del hogar, ya que tienen un promedio de 4 niños , muchas de ellas por distintos motivos, se separaron de su pareja y tuvieron  que hacerse cargo de su familia por lo que necesitan mayores recursos para cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos. La actividad principal en la asociación “23 de marzo” es la costura de edredones, sabanas y también la confección de camisas, ropa deportiva y otros, estas prendas las comercializan al  Perú, las venden al por mayor. Ellas precisan capital para comprar materia prima en mayor cantidad de ésta manera aumentar su producción y generar mayores ganancias para el bien de sus familias.
texts.en:
In the city of El Alto there you will find a central region called Villa Exaltacion and belonging to this region is the Association "23 Marzo" and it is composed of 12 women dreaming of making their small business grow. The majority of the group are married and they indicate that they need to help their partners with the household finances. They average 4 children per family and many of the women, for various reasons, have separated from their partner and had to care for the family themselves and are faced with the need for greater resources to cover their children's necessities. The primary goal of Association "23 Marzo" is the production of bed linens and bedding sets as well as the production of shirts, sports attire among other items. These things are sold in Peru and they also sell their items wholesale. They hope to acquire with their new capital materials in greater quantities to increase their production and generate greater earnings for the good of their family.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials in greater quantities.

loans.name: Zaida Antonia

texts.es: La Sra. Zaida habita en el barrio Villa Venezuela, tiene 39 años de edad, es soltera, con dos hijos de 14 y16 años de edad, que están cursando la secundaria. El negocio de doña Zaida es la venta de ropa nueva y usada, venta de frutas y verduras  y comida. Pues vende variedad de productos para salir adelante, comenzó  hace seis años en las ventas con dinero propio y por iniciativa de su mamá, sus dificultades han sido las ventas bajas y los ingresos para invertir más a su negocio. Con la solicitud que está haciendo es para comprar productos para invertir en la compra de verduras y frutas. Sus planes son seguir creciendo en el negocio, mejorar su nivel de vida y poder ayudar a sus hijos que salgan a delante con los estudios para que sean hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zaida lives in the Villa Venezuela neighborhood, is 39 years old, and is the single mother of two children who are 14 and16 years old and are in secondary school. Zaida’s business is the sale of new and used clothing as well as fruits, vegetables and food, so she sells a variety of products to be able to get ahead. She started her business six years ago with her own money and her mother’s initiative. Her difficulties have been low sales and having the income to invest more in her business. With the request that she is making, she will buy more products and invest in the purchase of fruits and vegetables. Her plans are to continue growing her business, improve her quality of life and be able to help her children advance with their studies so that they can be successful adults.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. F. is 51 years old and the mother of two children. Her children are currently working. To support her household, Grace has been selling foodstuffs such as maize and gari in the local market in her neighborhood to her loyal customers. She says selling these products is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income to support her family.

Grace is a member of the group called 'Adekye Nnsuroma' meaning Morning Star Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like maize and gari for re-sale

loans.name: Maria Ignancia

texts.es:
Mary necesitaba aumentar ingresos, para mantener a sus 3, ya que es madre soltera por lo que hace 10 años empezó su negocio de elaboración y venta de comida y poco a poco ha logrado salir adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una parrilla y poder continuar con su negocio. Con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Mary needed to increase her income in order to support her 3 children, as she is a single mother. 10 years ago she began her business making and selling food and little by little she has been able to get ahead and be successful. She needs a loan for US $300 which will be repaid in 6 months to buy a grill and be able to continue with her business. With your help she will be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a grill

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Primer prestamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=33573&_tpos=9&_tpg=2

Ana Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño. Ana Maria es casada, tiene 28 años y 2 hijas, Ana Maria vende maderas en un local alquilado ubicado en el Jr. Rioja, este local es amplio y esta compartido por otras personas que tienen el mismo negocio, Ana Maria vende palos, carrizos, esteras, maderas variadas dependiendo de la demanda, todos sus productos los adquiere de los productores que le traen a su negocio, además que su esposo también viaja a comprar directamente las maderas. Ana Maria también alquila motosierras por hora para lo cual cuenta con un personal que realiza este servicio.

Ana Maria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tablones y palos. Los sueños de Ana Maria son tener una casa bonita, brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y descansar en su vejez.
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=33573&_tpos=9&_tpg=2

Ana Maria is a member of the Banco Comunal Retoño community bank.

Ana Maria is married, is 28 year of age and has 2 daughters. Ana Maria sells wood from a rented store local situation in Jr. Rioja. Her store is of a good size but it is shared with other people that run a similar business. Ana Maria sells wooden staffs, bamboo sticks, mats, and various woods all depending on the demand. All of her products she acquires from her two producers that tend to her business. Additionally, her husband also travels to purchase the woods direct from producers. Ana Mari also rents out power saws by the hour, but she depends on her staff to run this service.

Ana Mari requires a loan amounting to 2000 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of planks of wood and wooden staffs. Ana Maria's dreams are to have a beautiful home and to provide her children with a better education so that they may grow into professionals. She also wishes to retire in her golden years.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ana Maria requires a loan of 2000 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of planks of wood and wooden staffs.

loans.name: Yessica Yaneth

texts.es:
Yesica esta casada con Marco Antonio, el trabaja como empleado, tiene un hijo, el negocio empezó una vez que su esposo estaba desempleado, por lo que tenia fuertes necesidades económicas y entonces fue cuando ella busco una fuente de ingresos, y empezó con la venta de lácteos en su casa vendiendo entre sus familiares y después a conocidos y vecinos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Yesica is married to Marco Antonio, who works as a clerk, and she also has a son. Her business started at a time during which her husband was unemployed, and they were in great financial need. Due to their situation, Yesica went in search of a source of income and started a dairy business in her house. She started out selling to other family members and eventually to neighbors and acquaintances. She needs a $300 (U.S.) loan that she will pay back in 6 months in order to purchase merchandise. With your help, she will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=33569&_tpos=3&_tpg=2

Zenaida es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño. Zenaida es conviviente, tiene 24 años, 1 hija y esta en espera de su segundo hijo, Zenaida junto a su esposo tienen una maderera en un local alquilado que esta ubicado en el Jr. Malecón Romero, Zenaida vende palos de eucalipto, maderas variadas, sus productos los adquiere en el mismo negocio de proveedores. Además brinda servicios de aserrados para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de un operario, Zenaida se encarga de la atención al publico y la cobranza.

Zenaida necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de madera. Los sueños de Zenaida son tener las maquinarias necesarias en su negocio y luego ampliar y tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Zenaida is a member of the Retoño Communal Bank. Zenaida is 24, living with her partner and one daughter, and is expecting her second child. Zenaida and her husband have a lumber business in a rented location located in the Malecón Romero district. Zenaida sells eucalyptus lumber and various other woods. Their products are acquired from suppliers in the same business. She also provides sawing services with the help of an operator. Zenaida is in charge of serving the public and debt collection. Zenaida needs a loan of $350 that will be invested in the purchase of wood products. Her dreams are to have the machinery for her business and then to expand and have her own business location.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Zenaida needs a loan of $350 that will be invested in the purchase of wood products.

loans.name: Jose Juan

texts.es:
José Juan esta casado, y aprendió el oficio de carpintería de su papa, tiempo después el decidió independizarse para tener ingresos en su propio negocio y poder así ofrecerles mejor calidad de vida a su familia, poco a poco ha hecho crecer su negocio y ha aumentado sus clientes.

El necesita un préstamo por US$300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una sierra, con tu ayuda el saldrá delante.
texts.en:
Jose Juan is a married man. He learned the trade of carpentry from his father and decided to branch out on his own to earn his own money from his own business to provide his family with a better quality of life. Slowly his business has been growing and his client base has increased.

He requires a loan in the amount of $300 US, that will be repaid in a term of 6 months. The funds will be used to purchase an electric power saw. With your help he will be successful.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a power saw.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Basilia es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Los Milagros. Basilia es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, Basilia junto a su esposo tienen una ferretería en su casa ubicada en la Av. El Ejercito en donde vende artículos de ferretería como fierros, tubos, cemento, arena, piedras, sus ventas también son a domicilio, actividad que realiza con un carro pequeño de su propiedad. Los agregados (arena, piedra) son traídos de las canteras existentes en la ciudad, para lo cual cuenta con un volquete que es conducido por su esposo.

Basilia necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cemento. Los sueños de Basilia son tener más carros, surtir con mas productos su ferretería, tener capital propio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Basilia is a member of the Señor de Los Milagros (Our Father of Miracles) Communal Bank.

Basilia is 39 years old and lives with her husband and their three children. She and her husband own a hardware store in their home on El Ejercito Avenue where they sell iron rods, tubes, cement, sand, and stones. They also deliver to clients' homes with a small car that they own. Her husband brings in the sand and stone from the city's quarries with a dump truck.

Basilia needs a loan of 3000 soles (about US $1,025), which she will use to buy cement. Her dreams are to have more cars, offer a wider variety of products in her hardware store, to have her own money and for her children to grow up to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cement

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia es socia del Banco Comunal Imperio. Aurelia es separada, tiene 38 años y 5 hijos, Aurelia se dedica a la producción de joyas de metales finos (oro y plata), actividad que aprendió observando cuando trabajaba como ayudante en una joyería, y posteriormente perfecciono su técnica estudiando unos meses. Actualmente Aurelia tiene un taller en un local alquilado ubicado a 1 cuadra de la plaza principal de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en algunas oportunidades cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos, Aurelia crea sus propios diseños como también realiza los modelos que le solicitan sus clientes.

Aurelia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de oro. Aurelia sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales, implementar su joyería con todas las maquinarias necesarias y construir otra casa.
texts.en:
Aurelia is a member of the Imperio Communal Bank (a group loan). She is 38 years old, separated from her husband and has five children. She makes jewelry from precious metals (gold and silver), a trade she learned from observing when she used to work as an assistant in a jewelry store. She then spent several months studying to perfect her technique. She currently has her own workshop located a block from the main plaza in the city of Ayacucho. Her children sometimes help her out at work. Aurelia creates her own designs and also does custom designs as per the requests of her clients.

Aurelia needs a loan of 1050 soles (about $375), which she will use to buy gold. She dreams of her children growing up to be professionals, of buying all the necessary equipment for her jewelry workshop, and of building another house.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy gold to make jewelry

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua A. is 45 years old, widowed, and the mother of four children. Two of her children are currently in school. To support her household, she has been selling foodstuff like maize and gari in the local market to her loyal customers for the past 20 years. She says selling these products is very lucrative and, therefore, she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income to support her family. Akosua is a member of the group called First King Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee loans for each other by providing social collateral and assisting one another to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs like maize and gari.

loans.name: Leonora Vicente

texts.es:
Leonora es socia del Banco Comunal “Amaquella” que significa “No seas Flojo” en quechua. Leonora es casada, tiene 48 años y 4 hijos, Leonora junto a su esposo tienen un puesto en el mercado 12 D. abril, su puesto se ubica en una esquina muy concurrida en donD. venD. abarrotes, cereales, especerías, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo desD. las 6 D. la mañana hasta las 7 D. la noche. Además Leonora tiene una casa en una avenida el cual lo alquila y le genera ingresos para la educación D. sus hijos.

Leonora necesita un préstamo D. 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, fideo. Leonora sueña con que sus hijos terminen D. estudiar, ampliar su negocio y ahorrar lo suficiente para su vejez.
texts.en:
Leonora is a member of the Communal Bank “Amaquella” which means “Don’t be lazy” in Quechua. Leonora is married, 48 years old, and has 4 children. Leonora along with her husband has a stand in the 12 of April market. Her stand is located on a busy corner where she sells groceries, grains, and spices, a business they run together from 6 in the morning until 7 in the evening. In addition Leonora has a home on an avenue which she rents and sues the income for her children’s education. Leonora needs a loan for 2100 soles which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, and noodles. Leonora dreams that her children finish their schooling, of expanding her business and saving enough for her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, and noodles.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha Lorena de 51 años, soltera, habitante del Barrio El Paraisito, Lic. En Cosmetología y Estilista, tiene dos hijos mayores de edad, casados, los cuales trabajan en pro-de su familia. La Sra. M. tiene una sala y Academia de Belleza con 18 años de experiencia en el ramo, el negocio lleva su nombre, “Sala y Academia de Belleza Martha”, su ideal es modernizar las clases de Belleza y Estilismo adquiriendo computadoras para la adaptación de programas adecuados, El Crédito lo quiere para iniciar la compra de 3 computadoras que necesita para el buen desempeño de la exposición de sus clases. Cuenta con mucha popularidad en el sector donde habita ya que es muy reconocida como una  señora Emprendedora. Inició su negocio con fondos propios y de una manera muy pequeño ofreciendo el Servicio de Belleza, ampliándolo en los últimos años como una Academia.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena is 51 years old, single and lives in the El Paraisito neighborhood. She graduated as a Cosmetologist and Stylist, and has two adult children who are married and work to support their families. Mrs. M. has a salon and a Beauty Academy, with 18 years of experience in the field. She named the business after herself: the "Martha Salon and Beauty Academy." Her goal is to modernize Beauty and Stylist classes by providing computers with the appropriate programs.

Mrs. M. is requesting this credit so that she can start buying the three computers that she needs to do a good job teaching her classes. She launched the business with her own money, and by starting small and offering beauty services, she has been able to expand over the past few years to open her Academy.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy computers for beauty school

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal “Amaquella” que significa “No seas Flojo” en quechua. Victoria es casada. Tiene 59 años y 5 hijos, Victoria vive en el Distrito D. San Juan Bautista, Victoria tiene una tienda surtida donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, carne, pollo, bebidas y también tiene un teléfono publico, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. sus hijas en sus ratos libres.

Victoria necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, arroz, fideo, cerveza. Victoria sueña con mejorar su negocio, apoyar a su hijo menor hasta que sea profesional y realizar paseos, viajes para distraerse.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the "Amaquella" Communal Bank, which means "Don't be Lazy" in Quechua. Victoria is 59, married with 5 children. She lives in the District of San Juan Bautista. She has a variety shop where she sells groceries, vegetables, meat, chicken and drinks, and also has a public telephone. She carries out this activity with the help of her daughters in their free time. Victoria needs a loan of $525 that will be invested in the purchase of sugar, rice, noodles, and beer. Victoria dreams of improving her business, helping her minor son to become a professional, and taking trips for her personal enjoyment.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Victoria needs a loan of $525 that will be invested in the purchase of sugar, rice, noodles, and beer.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza es socia del Banco Comunal “Amaquella” que significa “No seas Flojo” en quechua. Lorenza es casada, tiene 65 años y 2 hijos, Lorenza vive en el barrio del calvario nombre que se debe a la iglesia cercana, Lorenza tiene una tienda en su casa donD. venD. abarrotes, bebidas, algunos útiles D. escritorios y golosinas, actividad que realiza desD. las 6 D. la mañana hasta las 10 D. la noche, con la ayuda D. su esposo.

Lorenza necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, arroz, fideo, cerveza. Los sueños D. Lorenza son surtir más su negocio, Tener días D. descanso y distracción.
texts.en:
Lorenza is a member of the "Amaquella" communal bank, which means "don´t be lazy" in Quechua. Lorenza is married, 65 years old and has 2 children. She lives in the El Calvario neighborhood, which is named after a nearby church. Lorenza has a general store in her house where she sells groceries, drinks, some stationery supplies and candy. She works from 6 in the moning until 10 at night, with help from her husband.

Lorenza needs a loan for 1200 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of sugar, rice, pastas and beer. Lorenza dreams of being able to stock her business with more goods and of having some days off to enjoy.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice, pastas and beer.

loans.name: Brillantes Group

texts.es: En la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal de Villa Adela, a éste pertenece la asociación “Brillantes”, grupo muy alegre, simpático y unido sobre todo. Ellos se reúnen cada 14 días, a las 12:30hrs, realizan sus actividades en forma organizada y responsable. La salud de los niños es una de las mayores preocupaciones para la asociación Brillantes es por eso que ellos se dedican a  la fabricación y venta de artículos ortopédicos para niños, por ejemplo fabrican plantillas, arnés para las caderas. Reciben pedidos de hospitales y también de personas particulares. Afirman que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de materiales para la fabricación de sus productos y aumentar sus ventas, de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para el bien de sus familias.
texts.en:
Villa Adela is a neighborhood located in the city of El Alto, Bolivia. This is where you will find the "Brillantes" group, a very cheerful, friendly and above all united communal bank. The group meets once every two weeks at 12:30pm. Each member runs their own business in a responsible and organized fashion. One of the group's main concerns is children's health. The group members make and sell orthopedic devices for children, like shoe inserts and hip braces. They fill orders for both hospitals and individuals. The group is requesting this loan to buy materials to make the products they sell in order to sell more and generate more income to provide for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to make children's orthopedic devices

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christiana A. is a 32 years old. She is married and has two children who are in school. She is resourceful and supportive to her family. She operates a local restaurant and sells local foods like cooked rice with soup.
