End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main policy because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to support his field

loans.name: Mr. Muth Vuthy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Muth V. is a village bank president in Hang Heng Village in TaK. Province, in which 13 people live. Each person plans to use the loan in different purposes. Mr. Muth V. has a plot of land where he grows rice to earn a living. His wife, Mrs. Muong Lai, owns a small grocery store in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so her husband, Mr. Muth V., decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for his wife's inventory. Mr. Muth V. is 49 years old and the father of two children who are both attending the local school. Mr. Meak B. C. does not want a loan but his wife does so she is in the picture. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Seven members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products for his wife's inventory

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Thoeun Y. , 38, is a grocery seller as well as a commune officer in Chomka Somrong Commune. Her husband, Mr. Di Khon, 39, is a motorcycle taxi driver. In addition to her business work, Thoeun is also a good housewife who cares for her two children and cooks food for the family. Thoeun always discusses with her husband when she wants to do anything. To increase her  family's income, Thoeun needs to expand her variety of products to satisfy her customers, but she lacks the money to do so. Hence, she would like to request a loan of US$500 to add grocery inventory to sell for customer satisfaction. The loan will increase her business and attract more customers. The family lives in Chomka Somrong Commune, Battambang Province.

loans.use: To add grocery inventory to sell against customer satisfaction

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en: Chanthou C., 26, lives with her widowed mother and three younger sisters. She works hard at her farming job, which is the family's main source of income. Her mother, Mrs. Lang Chin, 60, makes Khmer cake to sell as another source of income. Chanthou lives with her family in Snam Preah Commune, Pursat Province. Because her farmland is infertile, she needs to use fertilizer to improve the rice yield. As another source income, she wants to raise pigs. But Chanthou lacks the money to buy the fertilizer and the pigs. Hence, she is asking for a loan to carry out her plan. Chanthou's mother is pictured because Chanthou was not available.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pigs

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea S., age 55, is a wedding chef who resides with his wife and one child in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He typically makes around US$4 each day. His wife, Phoung Soeun, 53, for whom he will use this loan, is a true entrepreneur and has had a business selling rice and porridge from her home since 1999. On average, she brings in US$8.5 per day. This couple also has support from their child who works as security officer.

Phoung Soeun's business selling rice, noodle and porridge is making more profits to improve the standard of living. There are a few vendors who operate the same business as her, so to attract more customers she needs to expand her business by purchasing more chairs and more utensils and building a bigger stand.

loans.use: To purchase more tables, chairs and utensils.

loans.name: Mr. Eng Sakhan's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group is located in Vath Village in Kampong Chhnang Province and consists of seventeen people. They plan to use the loan for different purposes.

Mr. Eng S. is the village bank president. He is a farmer who has a plot of land (a hectar) where he cultivates rice to earn a living. In this plantation, he now faces a small problem because his field is infertile which affects his crop. To solve this problem, Mr. Eng S. is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers to support his field to produce a better crop.

His wife, Mrs. Ngaet Sorn, helps him in his plantation. Mr. Eng S. is 51 years old and the father of six children one of whom rents out speakers for parties to earn an income, while another one is a laborer who can make only a small income to support the household. The third one assists their parents on the plantation while the remaining three are attending the local school.

Mr. Mam S. did not come in to take the loan but his wife did so she is shown in the picture. Mrs. Suon Savoeurn is the group guarantee but she is also present in the picture.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Eleven members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to improve his field

loans.name: Mrs. Meng Yoen's Village Bank Group

texts.en: The Village Bank, which is located in Kandal Leu Village in Kandal Province, consists of 34 members. Each person plans to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Meng Y. is the village bank president, and she owns a grocery store in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Suong Hi, is a farmer who has a two-hectare field where he cultivates rice. Aside from this business, he is a fisherman but he does not have enough fishing tools to gather fish to support his family. To solve this problem, Mrs. Meng Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets and fish lines to catch more fish so they can meet the needs of their family. Mrs. Meng Y. is 41 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Mrs. Pheon Phan's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. P. P. is the president of the village bank in Anhchanh Village in Kandal Province. This village bank has 22 members who are requesting a loan. Mrs. P. P. is a cow breeder who has four cows and a farmer who cultivates rice on her 1.5-hectares field. Her plantation is not very fertile, so Mrs. P. P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer for her field in order to make her crop more productive. Mrs. P. P. is a 58-year-old widow with five children, four of whom are employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is attending the local school. 

Two members in this village bank have end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. The end-of-term loan members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial loans for Cambodia's poor. EoT loans allow people to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09 percent and AMK has a default rate of 0 percent on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mrs Yorn Thorn's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people in Kshach Village in Kandal Province formed this village bank. They will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs Yorn T. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. Mrs Yorn T. is 51 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local school. She has a plot of land to cultivate vegetable and she now faces a problem because she does not have enough money to purchase vegetable seeds to grow on her field. Thus, Mrs Yorn T. is requesting a loan to deal with this purpose. Her husband, Mr Suon San, is a bodyguard in one hotel in Phnom Penh city, Cambodia. He can make around $42 per month which is little income to support his family.

This is a village bank loan consisting mainly of end-of-term loans. Eight members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those members receiving end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.

End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seeds to grow in her field.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Akparali

texts.en: Akparali A.  is 35 years old and is married with two children. For the past 8 years, Akparali has provided a taxi service which is the main source of income for his family. Akparali has told us that this type of work is very difficult. In order to obtain a decent wage he has to work at night and into the early morning hours. Akparali does not have a higher education but it his dream that his children will be able to. Akparali is planning to fix his car in order to provide a higher quality of service in the future and earn more money. He is requesting 2000 Somoni ($600 USD) for the term of 12 months so that he can purchase spare parts for his car. The well-being of this family is on your hands. Help them by contributing to the growth of Akparali's business, and they will sincerely thank you.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Mrs. San Kunthea's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank president for this group is Mrs. San K. who has been selected by twenty members in Koh Kaev Kraom Village in Kandal Province. She is currently in the business of selling grocery items and she is now requesting a loan to purchase more grocery products to expand her inventory while her business is going well.

Mrs. San K. is 29 years old and she is married to Mr. Huon Heat who is a farmer. She has two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the younger one is too young to work or study because that child is only four years old.

Each week, Mrs. San K. makes approximately US$ 35 in income and with the extra income from this loan she hopes to be able to meet the needs of the family and improve their living conditions. The two men shown in the picture came to take a loan instead of their wives because their wives were busy with their work. All the members are shown in the picture except one who is blocked.

This is a village bank loan consisting of a number of end-of-term loans. Seven members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to expand her inventory

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en: Gulsara A. is 26-years old, has been married for 8 years and has one child. Her husband is a driver.For the past 9 years, Gulsara has been running her own small business that sells shampoos, soaps, detergents and other items. This business is one of her greatest accomplishments. She always dreamed of owning a business and not having to depend on anyone else. Thanks to the good quality of her merchandise, she has grown her business and is now requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni ($1175 USD) that will be used to purchase more goods to meet her clients' demands. Gulsara promises to repay her loan during a 12 month period and thanks everybody who decided to support her.

loans.use: To increase stock for the store

loans.name: Ravshanoy

texts.en: Ravshanoy Bekmurotova  is a 30 year old widow with 2 children. For the past 12 years, Ravshanoy has dedicated herself to selling eggs in Istaravshan's central market. She has led a difficult life, particularly when she became a widow and was unable to find work to replace her husband's income. As a result, she decided to invest the small amount of savings that her and her husband were able to collect over many years and started her business. She has been acquiring greater amounts of eggs which has slowly helped increase her earnings. Her plans are to invest more in her business through the purchase of additional product to sell. Ravshanoy has worked with IMON for loans over the past two years and, despite the competition, she is starting to see better results from her endeavors. She proposes to continue with the loans which have benefited her business greatly.

loans.use: To purchase additional eggs to sell

loans.name: Movsum

texts.en: Movsum is 32 years old. He is single and lives in Khachmaz town. He has been in a furniture making business for 3 years. Now, he needs a loan of $1200 to buy the necessary materials for making furniture.

loans.use: To buy the necessary materials for making furniture

loans.name: Valiyulla

texts.en: Valiyulla lives in the town of Khachmaz. He is 55 years old, married, and has 2 children. He would like to improve his farming business, so he is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy seedlings.

loans.use: To buy seedlings

loans.name: Art

texts.en: Art A., 68, has a business, together with his wife, planting small trees for sale. Since 1999, he has planted many kinds of fruit trees such as mango, papaya, orange, etc. On average, he makes around US$ 8. This couple together has four children, one of whom is a student and three others are employed with different jobs. Mr. Art is asking for a loan to plant more trees for sale.

loans.use: To plant more trees for sale

loans.name: Parishan

texts.en: Parishan is a mother of 3 children, and is 42 years old. She lives in the town of Khachmaz, where she has run a farming business for four years. Now, she needs a loan of $1200 to buy seedlings to improve her farming business.

loans.use: To buy seedlings

loans.name: Valeh

texts.en: Valeh is 28 years old. He lives in Khachmaz town. This young man has run this business for 2 years. Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy a cow to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Venn

texts.en: Venn C., 48, a widow who resides with six of her children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, has a business selling sugar cane juice from her home. Three of her children are students and the other three are employed in different fields. Venn would like to take out a loan of $1000 to create another business such as planting small mango trees to sell and to purchase a sewing machine to earn additional money. She believes that these measures will allow her family to double their income and thereby improve their standard of living

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and grow trees for sale.

loans.name: Rohat

texts.en: Rohat Bekmurotova is a married  36 years old mother of two. Rohat is a very hardworking and independent woman. In search of a way to help support her family, and supplement her husband's salary, she started selling eggs six years ago. Rohat has been an active client of IMON for the past two years. She has shown herself to be a reliable and honest person. The market where Rohat sells her goods is very damp which has badly effected her health. To improve her situation, Rohat is planning to build her own grocery store. To achieve her goal, Rohat is requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni ($1175 USD), which she will use to build her own store and purchase additional merchandise. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months. Rohat is sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: Building a grocery store and expanding the business

loans.name: Araz

texts.en: Araz is 32 years old. He has been in this business for 3 years. This man is single and lives in Khachmaz town.  Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy furniture to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy furniture for re-sale

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.en: Bahrom J. is 50 years old and is married with three children. He is a small entrepreneur that sells a variety of items like soap, shampoo, tooth paste, shaving cream, washing powder and many others items. Bahrom's family is actively involved in helping with the business.  Bahrom  currently has about $1000 in inventory and his monthly net profit is about $ 300-400. Bahrom is requesting a loan of $1100 USD for the term of 3 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices to become a successful entrepreneur. Bahrom's main goal is to educate his beloved children so that someday they'll become successful entrepreneurs themselves. We believe his perseverance and clear vision are key factors in  the success of his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell at his store

loans.name: Askerkhan

texts.en:
Askerkhan N. is a 59-year-old man who lives in the small village of the Imishli region. He is married and has 8 children. He is very proud to be a father of so big a family!  

Askerkhan's main source of income is trade. He rents a small place where he sells wholesale goods such as soft drinks, pastas and more. He is a professional electrician, but he works very rarely, only if local people call him to repair something. 

He would like to expand his business and purchase more food stuff for his store. For this purpose he has applied for a 1000 USD loan, which will help him improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more food inventory for his store

loans.name: Jahangir

texts.en: Jahangir is 56 years old. He lives in Khachmaz town. This man is married and has 2 children. 15 years ago he started this business. Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy foodstuffs for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Nak's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nak R., 49, a widow, sells porridge and noodles with soup in the Slaket Market. She has been selling food since 2005, earning US$ 4 per day, while Mr. Sharey Mot, her son, is 21 years old and a motorcycle taxi driver. Nak lives with five children. One son left to work in Thailand and three of her daughters stay home to help with Nak's business. Because of lacking capital to upgrade her business, she would like to request a loan of US$ 300 to use as capital to expand her porridge and noodle soup selling business. Nak was chosen to be group leader by the five other members as follows:

Mrs. Srou P., 52, is a widowed fish seller. She needs a loan of US$ 300 to add more fish to sell.

Mrs. Noeun I., 59, is a widowed housewife wH. helps in her daughter's grocery. Noeun needs a loan of US$ 300 to buy grocery inventory.

Mrs. Sophea S., 42, sells fish. She needs a loan of US$ 300 to purchase fish from suppliers to stock and sell.

Mrs. Monika H., 43, is a teacher. She needs a loan of US$ 300 to buy a second-hand motorcycle instead of the old one her husband uses to drive a motorcycle taxi.

Mrs. Phan P., 58, wH. is also widowed, buys and sells chickens. She requests a loan of US$ 200 to buy more chickens to sell.

They all live in Slaket Commune, Siem Reap Province.

Two men wH. are in the picture are not actual borrowers but co-borrowers; the one on the left side is Monika's husband and the other one is Sophea's husband.

loans.use: To use as capital to expand her porridge and noodle soup selling business

loans.name: Mrs. Prak Phach's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Prak P. is the group leader for six people who all live in Rumchek Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she can cultivate rice to earn a living. She is a 54-year-old widow with two children. One is a construction worker while the other is a silk weaver.

Since Mrs. Prak P.'s second child is doing well and has a lot of customers, Mrs. Prak P. decided to ask for a loan to purchase more silk for her child's business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her standard of living with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more silk for her child's business

loans.name: Mwamvua

texts.en:
Mwamvua K. A. is married with 5 children between the ages of 16 and 1. She has sold clothes and fish since 2000. She works every day from 8 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Mwamvua is now looking  for a loan to expand her business by adding items to her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding items to her current stock.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 37 years old. She is married and has 6 children. She has run her own shop since January 2008.

Every day Salma works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $115 from her sales. She is requesting a loan to buy more commodities to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities to expand her business.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam J. is 27 years old. She is a widow with two children, aged 7 and 4. She has been selling clothes and shoes since 2006. Every day, she works from 8 am to 6 pm at her business, and she can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Maryam is now seeking a loan to buy more clothes and shoes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and clothes for resale in order to improve her business

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhorn N., 55, and her husband, Mr. Boeun Phon, 55, are farmers. They both have been farming for twenty-five years and earn around US$ 3.50 per day. They live in Pteahrong Commune, Pursat Province, Cambodia. They have five children, of whom one is married.

Because her farmland is infertile, and with the purpose of increasing her rice yield, Chhon needs a loan of 200,000 Riel (US$ 50) to purchase fertilizer to use for her rice crop.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to use for her rice crop

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat baji is the wife of M.A. and lives in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places. She completed her education till 8th standard. She is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. Her eldest son has a cigarette shop. The next to him is a tailor by profession. Her youngest son helps his father in his grocery shop.

Musarat baji's elder daughter is in 11th standard. Her younger daughter is in 6th standard. Musarat baji's husband has a grocery shop with an experience of 22 years. Musarat baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her four loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more groceries (cooking oil, rice, and spices) to diversify her husband's grocery shop into a store.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for re-sale

loans.name: Mrs. Poa Dyna's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank president in Svay Village in Kandal Province is Mrs. Poa D. who was selected by the 15 members  of this village bank. Mrs. Poa D. is a  farmer, and she is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer for her rice field. Mrs. Poa D., 42, is married to Mr. Yoem Chantha, who is a construction foreman. He makes around $6 a day to support his household. They have four children, one of whom is a blacksmith while the remaining three are attending the local school. With this loan, she hopes to be able to make her crop more productive. 

Three members of this bank have end-of-term (EoT) loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. End-of-term loan members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial loans for Cambodia's poor. EoT loans allow people to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09 percent and AMK has a default rate of 0 percent on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Mrs. Nob Kim's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank in Trapaing Chrey Village in Kandal Province has 11 members. They each plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Nob K., the village bank president, sells groceries. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products. Mrs. Nob K. is a 53-year-old widow with a child who is attending the local school. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

One member of this bank has an end-of-term (EoT) loan, and the rest have monthly payment loans. The end-of-term loan member is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial loans for Cambodia's poor. EoT loans allow people to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09 percent and AMK has a default rate of 0 percent on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her store

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji is the widow of K. J. and lives in city named Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi food. She has been living in this city for the last 25 years. She has no children. After her husband's death, she became very frustrated then she decided to make herself busy with some work. Naseem baji started sewing clothes for her neighbors and then collecting orders from out of her community. She has been in this profession for the last 15 years. She is applying for a loan to buy another sewing machine to expand her clothes-sewing business.

Naseem baji is joined in her loan group by several more members. Ramzana baji wants a loan to buy tools used to cut wood into pieces. Naziran baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Parveen baji wants a loan to buy materials (cold drinks and cigarettes) for her "cold corner". Ghulam Fatima baji wants a loan to buy towels and socks to re-sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine

loans.name: Heng Sok Khon Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng S. K. is a group leader of five who all live in Kandal Kraom Village in Kandal Province. She is a Chinese fried bread maker. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ingredients to make more Chinese fried bread.

Her husband, Mr. Vorn Pros, is a construction worker who can make only a small income to support his household. Mrs. Heng S. K. is 30 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the others are too young to work or study because they are two and five years old.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make more Chinese fried bread for sale

loans.name: Mrs. Noun Lai's Group

texts.en: The leader of this small group is Mrs. Noun L..  She sells fruit in the local market in Yok Bat Village in Kandal Province. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more varieties of fruit to sell to her customers. Mrs. Noun L. is a 66-year-old widow with two children who are both blacksmiths but they do not earn enough to support their household. The other members of the group will use their loans to help their own businesses.

loans.use: To buy a variety of fruits

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en: Mrs. Sharon M., 30, is a rice farmer. She has been farming for 18 years and earns $1 USD per day. She lives with two young children, both of whom stay in the family's home. Her husband, Mr. Thy Noy, 31, sells chopped wood. Sharon needs a loan of $900 USD to buy two buffaloes to help with the labor of growing rice and to help her husband transport  his chopped wood to sell.

loans.use: To buy two buffaloes

loans.name: Shabana's Group

texts.en:
Shabana baji is the wife of K. I. and lives in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi food. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 18 years. She is the mother of two sons. Her first son is in 3rd standard. The next to him is in kindergarten.

Shabana baji's husband has a mobile phone shop with an experience of 15 years. Shabana baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more mobile phones for her husband's shop.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Bano baji wants a loan to buy tools to make furniture. Rubina baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies (wires, switches, and tube lights) for her electric shop. Rubina baji wants a loan to buy cloth to re-sell. Shafqat baji wants a loan to buy scrap (plastic, papers) for her family's scrap business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy  more mobile phones to re-sell

loans.name: Shamshad's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad baji is the wife of T. H. and lives in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi food. She has been living in this city for the last 26 years. She is the mother of six sons. Shamshad baji's husband has a furniture-making and selling business. Her first three sons are involved in their father's business. The others are free and don't do anything.

Shamshad baji's husband has been in this business for the last 25 years. Shamshad baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more wood to expand her husband's furniture-making business.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Shahnaz baji and Shazia baji both want a loan to buy iron to make chains which are used to tie up cattle. Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy construction material (cement and sand) to re-sell. Nasira baji wants a loan to buy more medicines to re-sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila baji is the wife of M. A. and lives in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi food. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 30 years. She is the mother of two sons.

Jamila baji's husband has a lathe workshop with an experience of 20 years. Her sons help their father in his business. Jamila baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy another lathe for her husband.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Kaleema baji wants a loan to buy iron to make chains which are used to tie up cattle. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy clothes to re-sell. Rani baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruit. Zahida baji wants a loan to repair her family's auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another lathe

loans.name: Pardaboi

texts.en: Pardaboi M.  is 34 years old and is married with two children. Pardaboi has a middle school special education in accounting. Pardaboi chose to go into agrobusiness because his accounting salary was too small to support his family and educate his children. Pardaboi works hard to cultivate his crops such as potato, onion, carrot and other vegetables. He works from early morning until late at night hoping to have a rich harvest. Pardaboi sells his crops in the market where they are always in high demand due to their good quality. His goal is to improve the quality of his agricultural products even more and grow his business further. Pardaboi is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni ($900 USD) for the term of 8 months to buy greater quantities of seed and fertilizer.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is the wife of M. I. and lives in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi food. She has been living in this city for the last 20 years. She is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son has a wood-selling business. The next to him has a lathe workshop.

Razia baji's husband has a shutter business with an experience of 25 years. Razia baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy material (beams) for her husband's shutter business.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Sonia baji wants a loan to buy mobile phones to re-sell. Alia baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Saba baji wants a loan to buy vehicle wheels to re-sell. Fakhira baji wants a loan to buy old computers to repair and re-sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wooden beams for her family's shutter business

loans.name: Mirsabur

texts.en: Mirsabur O.  is 42 years old and is married with 5 children. His wife is a homemaker that takes care of their children. Mirsabur owns a  minivan and provides transportation services for passengers within the city of Istaravshan. He has owned this business for 11 years. Initially he rented the car, but with the time and savings, he bought his own minivan. The business is stable and generates considerable income for Mirsabur’s family allowing for improved living conditions. While the business generates income it needs some additional funding for repairs. Mirsabur needs to purchase spare parts and pay for the repair of the minivan. With this purpose in mind he requests 3800 Somoni ($1125 USD) for the term of 3 months. Being the client of IMON for several years already, Mirsabur had demonstrated himself as a reliable client.  He thanks all for their support and promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts in order to repair his minivan.

loans.name: Sanavvar

texts.en:
Sanavvar R. is 51 years old. She is married and the mother of 2 sons. Her elder son is 23 and the younger is 15. Sanavvar 's husband is a watchman and his income is very low; that is why she decided to start her own business so that she could help him cover their living expenses.

Sanawar is selling children’s clothing in the local market of Istaravshan city. She is trying to have a wide range of goods so as to able to meet the requirements of her customers and to satisfy the needs of customers with different levels of income.

Today Sanavvar is requesting 3400 Somoni (1000 USD) with the purpose of purchasing additional merchandise to increase her range of goods. She promises to repay the loan within 6 months. Sanavvar is counting on your help. Be an important part of the growth of Sanavvar’s business.

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for children for re-sale

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.en:
Rafoat Z. is 51 years old. She is a very wise and hard-working woman. She is married, with three children. This entrepreneur dedicates herself to the sale of clothing and socks for teenagers. Rafoat says that lending services from IMON have helped her business grow over the past 3 years.

Little by little, she has expanded her inventory and thanks to the good service she offers, her business is growing rapidly. She says that with income from her activity she is able to provide education and food for her children.

Now Rafoat needs a loan of 3000 Somoni (900 USD) which she will use to buy clothing for teenagers for the autumn season to meet the demand of her customers and continue growing her business. She is committed to paying back this loan in 12 months. This is the time to help someone who needs it. Please do not hesitate to help improve the quality of life of this family.

loans.use: Purchasing autumn clothing for teenagers for re-sale

loans.name: Kimhean's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimhean M., 52, is a fish seller. She buys and sells fish in Kontout Market, earning approximately US$ 3 per day. Her husband, Mr. Kimshean Leang, 56, is a sewing machine maintainer, earning about US$ 3 per day. Kimhean has three children in the family home, all of whom also help in her business.

Kimhean wants to increase the amount of fish she has available for selling, but as she lacks capital, she would like to request a loan of US$ 250 to use to increase fish for sale.

Kimhean was chosen to be the leader of three members as following:

Mrs. Loeur K., 46, is widowed, sells rolls made of hashed fish. She is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 300 to use as capital to make more hashed fish.

Mrs. Velai N., 51, is also widowed and is a fish seller. She needs a loan of US$ 300 purchase more fish to sell.

Mrs. Chanthy P., 44, also widowed, sells fish and vegetables in the market. She needs a loan of US$ 100 to buy more fish and vegetables to sell.

They all live in Kdoldonteav Commune, Battembang Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: to have more fish for sale

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong K., 48, is a widow and resides with four of her children in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Her husband died from HIV a few years ago and she is also inflected with HIV.  She is taking medicine to prolong her life. Fortunately, none of her children have HIV. 

Kong has a business selling second-hand clothes and now she is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase a sewing machine so she can provide additional services and earn extra profit.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Run S., 26, is married and resides with her two children in Battambong, Cambodia. Since 2006, she has been selling groceries to earn a living and is able to make around US$ 6 in profit each day. Her husband, Uth Dam, 36, is a teacher in the village and normally he makes US$ 3 each day as well to support the family. Both their children are enrolled in school.

Run would like to take out a loan of US$ 1000 to add to her inventory of grocery products. She says that in the village there are many vendors who operate similar businesses so she needs to diversify her products, otherwise she will lose her customers.

loans.use: To add to her grocery's inventory

loans.name: Nuth

texts.en:
Nuth K., 52, lives in Kampong Cham Province with her husband and three children. She works selling groceries, making US$ 4 a day, and is helped financially by one of her daughters who has opened a hairdresser's shop, making US$ 5 a day.

In light of these times of economic difficulties, Nuth K. is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to add grocery inventory. She is an ambitious entrepreneur who one day hopes to own the biggest grocery store in the village. She sees this loan as a way to increase her income and is confident that her business venture will be successful. (She is in the picture with her husband in her home.)

loans.use: To add grocery inventory

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Mrs. Sor S. N., 30, is the mother of three children. She and her husband are brokers who buy rubber from the growers and resell it for a profit, making collectively around $5 each day. To increase their income, Mrs. Sor S. N. wants her husband to operate another business, which would enable him to earn a better income. She has humbly applied for a loan to purchase a motorbike, so that her husband can operate a taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Korng

texts.en: Mrs. Korng S. is married and has seven children. She has a stand at a busy market where she sells various kinds of fruits, making around $10 of gross income.  Her husband is ailing and he is not able to work, so she and her three employed children are trying to make their standard of living better.  To meet her growing customer demand, Mrs. Korng S. requests a loan to purchase fruits in bulk so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fruit in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as perfumes, pants and other goods for her small business.

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en: Mrs. Kunthea S., 24, crushes papayas (a Khmer food that is popular for ladies). She sells to customers in her area, and makes around $4 USD per day. She has two children, both of whom are in school. Her husband, Mr. Buntha Khim, 29, helps with this business. Mrs. Kunthea’s income is insufficient for her family; she wants to start a new business selling groceries in the market, but she lacks the capital to do so. Hence, she requests a loan of $1,000 USD to purchase a small store for selling groceries in Kampong Thom Market. They live in Kampong Krobav Commune, Kampong Thom Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase a small store for selling groceries

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in beauty products for her small beauty parlor

loans.name: Sokheiy

texts.en: Mrs. Sokheiy C., 31, sells groceries, earning around 8,000 Riel ($2 USD) per day. She lives in Domrei Choankla Commune, Kampong Thom Province, Cambodia. She has two young children at home. Her husband, Mr. Soeun Vong, 33, is a motorcycle taxi driver, who earns around 16,000 Riel ($4 USD) per day. Sokheiy needs a loan of 400,000 Riel ($100 USD) to purchase more groceries to satisfy her customers' needs.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more shoes and slippers to add to her stock

loans.name: Olim

texts.en: Olim A. is 32 years old and is married with two children. He and his his wife Olim sell fabrics for national dresses. Their store is located in the central local market and his been open for 8 years. In order to have a wide range of goods for any taste and any price, Olim travels every month to the neighboring town of Istaravshan to purchase new goods. While he travels, Olim’s wife helps him sell in the market. Olim has managed to increase his clientele, but he is not able to fully meet their demands. He is requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni ($1175 USD) for the term of 12 months. He would like to increase his inventory to earn more income so that he can provide his children with a good education and a better future. Your generosity can help change their lives.

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics to increase variety

loans.name: Khursheda

texts.en:
Khursheda A. is a very hard-working woman and knows that each day she has to give her best effort and all her courage. She's married with 3 children. She works raising animals and feeding them with the goal of later selling them. This activity creates feelings of satisfaction in her  because it allows her to provide for a considerable amount of the household income. 

The care that she takes to feed the animals and supply them with occasional medical visits from the veterinarian has increased their numbers and so now she guides them into the field each day for feeding. She makes sure not to neglect her role as a mother, because she’s also very dedicated to lovingly raising her three children, who also help out in caring for the animals during their free time. 

Khursheda wants to improve her stable's stalls and produce milk in a quantity sufficient for selling it commercially. It is for this reason that she’s requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni (1175 USD) for the term of 12 months to buy calves and fodder for her animals. Please support this woman who is determined to change the course of her life through dedication and hard work.

loans.use: Purchasing calves in order to expand her business

loans.name: Mislima

texts.en: Mislima A.  is 45 year old married woman with two children. She owns a specialized fabric store located in the central market in Dushanbe city. Mislima works in an area of trade where the demand is always consistent and high, because the national dresses in Tajikistan are a very popular and very important item of the dowry of any girl. Mislima is one of the leading fabric vendors in the market where she works. She is very persistent and determined in all of her business endeavors which has helped to sustain her venture for 9 years. Mislima is a skilled entrepreneur with integrity.  In order to promote the growth of her business, Mislima is requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni ($1175 USD) for 4 months to increase her assorted inventory and possibly open a new vending location in the future. One of her personal goals is to generate additional profits so she can remodel a new apartment that she recently bought for her family.

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics to increase the variety of good for sale

loans.name: Sat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sat S., 49, is a widowed grocery seller. She has been selling since 2001 in front of her house, earning approximately US$ 3.50 per day. She has five children, one of whom is married. Her son, Mr. Veasna Phat is a motorcycle taxi driver, and her daughter, Miss Soksin Khon, a gas and diesel seller. They all live in Tropang Resiey Commune, Kampong Thom Province.

Sat is requesting a loan of US$ 700 to decorate her house to attract more customers, using any remainder to purchase grocery inventory to sell. Sat's daughter is pictured because Sat was not available.

loans.use: To decorate her house to attract more customers and purchase grocery inventory

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba A.  is a 44 year old married woman with two children. Habiba is a very courageous woman who has endured alot so that her two children could have a good education. Habiba is a small business owner from Dushanbe, Tajikistan. For the past 11 years, she has been selling children’s shoes at the large Central market in Dushanbe.  As the holiday season is coming, she would like to buy more merchandise at wholesale prices and sell them in her community. She is requesting a loan of 3400 Somoni ($1000 USD) for the term of 6 months to purchase a new supply of shoe inventory. This loan will help her continue to operate a successful business so that she can provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase shoes for her store

loans.name: Sakine

texts.en:
Sakine N. is a 43-year-old beloved mother of four children. She rents a place in the local bazaar of the Sabirabad region. She has been running her business for eight years, selling galoshes and tights. Galoshes are very popular among farmers, especially in rural places and for people who seed. They are very comfortable during the raining season.  

The business is successful and generates a stable income allowing Sakine to contribute considerably to the family budget. As hers is the only source of income for her family, she needs to expand her business and so she has applied for a loan of 1000 USD. She will use this loan to purchase different socks and shoes. She would like to thank everybody who made the decision to support her.

loans.use: To purchase socks and shoes inventory

loans.name: Samandar

texts.en: This is Samandar  B. , who is married with two children. He is 32 years old and lives in Dushanbe city, Tajikistan. He has a retail shop and supports his family with this business. Samandar sells spare parts for foreign cars like Mercedes-Benz and Opel. He has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Samandar has a great demand for his spare parts thus he wants to buy more spare parts to sell to clients. He is requesting an individual loan of 3700 Somoni ($1100 US Dollars) to buy more spare parts and enlarge his shop to meet the requirements of his clients and increase the income for his family. He promises to repay the loan within 9 months. Samandar would like to thank everyone for the trust and support.

loans.use: To purchase additional spare parts for his shop

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar

texts.en:
Parveen Akhtar baji is the wife of M. N. and lives in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi food. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 10 years. She is the mother of three sons. Her youngest son goes to school.

Parveen baji's husband has a furniture-making and selling business. He has been in this business for the last 15 years. Parveen baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her children. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy material (wood, tools) to expand her husband's furniture-making business.

loans.use: To buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Pon

texts.en:
Mrs Pon T., 43, is fish seller in her area market. Her business is running well and has regular customers, earning around US$2.50 per day. She has been selling fish since 1997 in Kbal Thol Market. Besides her business, she cooks food for her children and husband. Her husband, Mr Kimsroeun Leang, 45, helps to transport fish to sell. They live in Achalak Commune, Kampong Thom Province.

Pon would like to request a loan of US$300 to purchase an ice-box to refrigerate fish for keeping good quality, and using the rest of the loan to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: To purchase an ice-box to refrigerate fish and to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Rahimakhon

texts.en:
Rahimakhon F. is 39 years old. She is married and the mother of two adorable children. Rahimakhon has a grocery store which she attends to herself, along with caring for her family and her home.

Rahimakhon began her small business 10 years ago with financial support from her husband who has sold spare parts for automobiles for some time. The reason for starting the business was to increase her large family’s income and her business has been gradually growing ever since.

In order to grow her business still more, she requests a loan of 2000 Somoni (600 US Dollars). Rahimakhon is planning to spend the loan purchasing more goods for re-sale thus increasing her range of goods. She promises to repay her loan within 12 months and thanks everybody who decides to support her.

loans.use: Purchasing the goods for selling to increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Rena

texts.en:
Rena I. is a 38-year-old mother of four lovely children. She sells milk and yogurt to the local people and has twelve years of experience in this field. Because of hard living conditions, she got married at a very young age. Her husband helps her with selling dairy products. 

Her dream is to provide her children with access to education, but this requires more funds that she is earning now. To improve their living conditions, she has decided to purchase one additional milking cow. For this purpose she has applied for a loan of 800 USD. Rena believes this loan will be one more step toward achieving to her dream, and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To purchase one cow

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
K. Gulchehra is married and has five adorable children who go to kindergarten and day school. A very responsible and hard working woman, 22 years ago she started offering her services as a seamstress to her neighbors and acquaintances, renting a sewing workshop where she produces national dresses for women.

Gulchehra's fondest wish is for her children to continue with their education, and this is the reason she needs to continue growing her business. She is asking for a loan of $1000 that will be used to buy supplies to increase her production and meet customer demand. She commits herself to repaying the loan in 12 months. From the extra money earned, she wants to fix the house and continue to pay for her children’s education.

Help this family improve their quality of life by contributing to the growth of Gulchehra’s business. They will sincerely thank you for it.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics for sewing national dresses.

loans.name: Baloglan

texts.en:
Baloglan E. is a 32-year-old trader who sells cosmetics such as shampoo, perfume, lacquer and more. He is married and has one daughter. He does not have a permanent job because it is very hard to find any employment in the region he is living in. 

He started his business in 1996 when he understood that he could never find a job and the only way to cover family needs is to start his own business. He took this chance and it worked. Baloglan lives with his old parents and his store brings him income that is just enough to cover basic family needs. He would like to improve their life and for this purpose he applied for a 1200 USD loan. He will use this loan to purchase more inventory for his store and increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor K. , a very responsible and hard working woman, is married and has four adorable children. Twenty-six years ago, having worked in a garment factory near her home and knowing a great deal about making clothing, she opened a small seamstress shop in her house, thereby helping her husband support the family. In time, she gained customers and a good reputation for her work, the business growing to the point where she now has four sewing machines and employs three workers. On average she sews two to three dresses a day, and her elder daughter assists her with the business.

Gulbahor’s children are all studying at school and over the next year two of her sons are planning to enter University. For that reason she needs to continue growing her business, so she is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy more fabrics to increase her production and meet customer demand. She commits to repay the loan in 12 months.

Help this family improve their quality of life by contributing to the growth of Gulbahor’s business. They will sincerely thank you for your generosity.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics for sewing the national dresses.

loans.name: Metanet

texts.en:
Metanet Z. is 52 years old. She and her husband have raised seven children. 

For 18 years Metanet has run her own business. In the largest local market, she has a store selling women's clothing. The store is located in the center of the market. She is very nice and polite, which allows her to easily expand her client base. She is trying to diversify the range of goods that she sells so she can satisfy the tastes of clients with various levels of income. For this purpose she applied for a 1200 USD loan in order to buy women's clothing for the winter season. 

Metanet thanks everyone who supports her and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: To increase her clothing inventory

loans.name: Leyla

texts.en: Leyla (her son is pictured) is the mother of four children. She was born in 1950, and she lives in Baku, Azerbaijan. Her son has transported loads for 10 years. Now they need  a loan of $1200 to buy the spare parts for this truck.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Khayriniso

texts.en:
Khayriniso M., 47 and married with four children, operates a business sewing national women’s clothes. She has a sewing workshop at her mother’s house and currently conducts this work with only one sewing machine. Fortunately, the good service she offers and the quality materials with which she works enable her to progress in her business, and she works daily from 8 a.m. until late evening hours, assisted by her two daughters. Thankfully, her volume of business allows her to meet the costs of both her home and the education of all her children.

As a result of the large quantity of orders, she needs another sewing machine and is therefore requesting a loan $1000 for the term of 12 months to purchase another machine as well as additional fabrics. With your help, Khayriniso can further develop her business and improve her family’s quality of life. She thanks you for your trust and support.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and additional fabrics.

loans.name: Shafiga

texts.en:
Shafiga B. is 53 years old and is married with four children. 

Shafiga has been running her business for more than 15 years. She is selling women's clothing and underwear. This business is the only financial income in her family; this income is sufficient for supporting the family but not enough to improve their living conditions. 

Now Shafiga has applied for a loan of 1000 USD. She plans to use the loan to increase her working capital. The generated income will be used for purchasing women's clothes for the winter season. She thanks everyone who supports her!

loans.use: To buy more clothing inventory.

loans.name: Shergiye

texts.en:
Shergiye S. is 41 years old. She is married and has 2 sons. Her primary activity has been selling children's and women's clothes in the local central bazaar since 2000. She puts aside part of the income from the business for the education of her children.

Shergiye and her husband hope that their children will receive higher education. She has applied for 900 USD for the purchase of new goods for the winter season. Shergiye promises to repay the loan and asks for your help by supporting her loan.

loans.use: to purchase new children's clothes for the winter season

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married with a 4-year-old daughter. She is an entrepreneur from Berdyansk. She owns a small kiosk where she offers a variety of seasonal clothing. Natalya has been a client of Nadiya Ukraine for several years. She acknowledges that loans have been an essential part of the growth of her business. Currently, Natalya's profit margin amounts to 50 percent, which helps create stable growth for her business.  

Natalya is requesting a loan to increase her inventory of clothing for retail sale. She is able to purchase merchandise in bulk for good prices at a wholesale market. Prompt loan repayment and self-discipline have characterized Natalya in the past. Financial assistance will continue to promote the growth of her business and help her provide for most basic needs of her family.  

Note: this is a short-term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Temur

texts.en:
Temur K. is 39 years old, is married, and has three children. He is a hard-working man struggling to feed his children and parents (who live with him) by selling fabric for traditional dresses. Temur has a trading place in the central local market in the city of Dushanbe. All of the fabric is bought from the neighboring town of Istaravshan. 

Temur is trying to have a wide range of goods to better meet the requirements and different levels of income of his customers. Temur, being a devoted father, is doing his best for his children to be well educated and to make them happy. Today, Temur feels that with more working capital his business could generate more income, so he is asking for a loan of 4000 Somoni (1175 USD) to jump start the business and raise the family's standard of living. Let's help this incredible father give his children a brighter future.

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics to increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with two daughters. She runs a small business selling outer clothing and underwear. Svetlana currently has about $1,000 of working capital. Her monthly gross income amounts to $750.    

Svetlana has a perfect credit history with Nadiya Ukraine. She has promptly repaid all loans without any delinquencies. Her neat kiosk, a beautiful array of inventory, customer-friendly service and exceptional prices have ensured preeminent success of her business. Svetlana would like to get a loan of 1,000 Grivnas to re-stock her inventory. She is planning to increase her supplies of clothing to attract more potential clients to her vending kiosk. Svetlana believes her efforts and determination, in combination with financial support, will eventually help her fully achieve her potential, leading to increased income and success.      

Note: this is a short-term express loan that will be repaid in a month.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with one child. She runs a small business selling clothing in the central market of Ordzhonikidze. She has a variety of clothing products at reasonable prices at her kiosk. Ludmila started her venture one-and-a-half years ago and has achieved stability since then. Currently, she has over $5,000 in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about $600. 

Ludmila has many customers. People come to buy clothing from her because they know she doesn't offer any low quality merchandise in her kiosk. Customer demand is constantly growing, which is why Ludmila decided to expand her trade. We believe Ludmila's determination and desire to provide only the best quality products will help her grow professionally and increase her sales.     

Note: this is a short-term seasonal loan that will be repaid in 2 months.

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothing

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.en:
Zulfiya Y. is 45 years old. She is married and the loving mother of 5 children. She started her own business 10 years ago because her husband’s salary was not enough for their family expenses.

Zulfiya is a market entrepreneur from Dushanbe city. She runs a stall selling candies and sweets. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and selection. Zulfiya is respectful and patient with all of her customers which attracts people and brings them back to her vending facility to buy groceries again.

Zulfiya is seeking to keep her business sustainable and has requested a loan of 800 USD for the term of 9 months to increase the inventory she has for sale. One of her plans for the future is to open a new vending facility. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Zulfiya reach all of her aspirations.

loans.use: Enlarging her range of goods and with the generated income purchasing a private store

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is married with three kids. He owns a business selling car parts and accessories in the downtown Vasilyevka market. Vladimir is full of ideas. He has rich experience working in this business. Moreover, he is very enthusiastic about his own small enterprise and has a good attitude. Vladimir sets high goals and takes daily action to achieve them. He has been in this business for 10 years. Presently, he has about $8,000 in merchandise. 

Vladimir would like to get a loan of 4000 Grivnas to increase his working capital. He believes financial assistance will support him in his endeavors. He is determined to work on his entrepreneurial dreams to make them a reality, understanding that real success and wealth take time. Vladimir is hoping to generate more profit and provide for his kids, who study in college now.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Viktor

texts.en:
Viktor is married with a 5-year-old son and a 7-year-old daughter. Viktor had to find a way to support his family, and that is how he ended up as a taxi driver. He owns a car and provides transportation services throughout Ukraine. The business is the only source of income for his family. Viktor works very hard, sometimes without days off or vacation, in order to bring in enough income. He uses a walkie-talkie to help him facilitate his work and get to a pick-up a lot faster. 

Viktor has been in this business for 6 years. His determination and strong will to succeed have helped him keep his business stable and sustainable and have promoted its expansion. Currently, his daily income is about $30-40. Viktor would like to get a loan for 3400 Grivnas to make repairs to his car. One of his other plans is to eventually repay a loan for his vehicle. We are confident that the modesty, diligence and responsibility that have helped Viktor develop his venture and gain a good reputation among other taxi drivers will help him promptly repay this loan and allow him to succeed in his business endeavors.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Zulfugar

texts.en:
Zulfugar M. is 34 years old. He is married and has a two daughters. Zulfugar runs his own store selling soft drinks along with personal use items like perfumes, toothbrushes, razors, and other items. His wife helps him by working as a sales person in the store. 

He purchases the goods to sell in his store in the neighboring city. Currently, he's planning to purchase additional inventory in order to increase the range of goods in his store. For this purpose he has applied for a loan of 1000 USD. 

This is the first loan for Zulfugar; he thanks all who trust and support him, and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir K. is a 48 year old trader. He is married and has 3 children, and is proud to be a grandfather of one grandchild. Tahir is an entrepreneur, and he sells foodstuffs like confectioneries, sugar, tea, and eggs. He has been in this business for 15 years. His wife is also involved in the business and helps Tahir in the market. The business is successful and generates sufficient income to support their large family. He is requesting a loan to increase his capital for purchasing foodstuffs, and to improve the condition of his shop.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs and improve the condition of his shop.

loans.name: Mamedov

texts.en:
Mamedov S., 44 and married with three sons, has extensive experience in food sales, having operated his wholesale shop selling noodles, sugar and tooth paste since 1982. Since his wife is currently unemployed, Mamedov is working hard to ensure that his sons have everything they may need, including the opportunity to pursue higher education.

Now Mamedov is planning to increase the range of goods he sells, and for this purpose is requesting a loan of $1200. The success of his business depends on you.

loans.use: To increase the range of goods he sells.

loans.name: Akhmadaga

texts.en:
Akhmadaga A. is 55 years old. He is married and has four children. His primary activity is selling dairy products. He currently has one cow and because of this cow, he can sell milk and yoghurt, which are very popular products among the local people. Every day he works from morning to night caring for his cow and selling his dairy products. He started selling milk 18 years ago. He is an agronomist by profession and this has helped him to run this business successfully. 

This business is the main source of income for the family. Akhmadaga has applied for a loan of $1200 USD to purchase two additional cows for $600 USD each. This is his first loan. Akhmadaga thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to be very accurate when managing the loan.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia A. operates a local restaurant where she sells a variety of local dishes such as fufu which is made out of cassava and plantains pounded together and other dishes at Kodadwen in Cape Coast. Cecilia has received Junior High level education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a tailor.

Cecilia has been operating this small local restaurant since 2008. She is responsible for helping her husband in the payment of the children's school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more ingredients, spices and food items for the food preparation at her restaurant. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband to start putting up a house for the family.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients, spices and food items for food preparation

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia Z. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through the Junior High level. Since 1999, Leticia has sold T-shirts and ladies and gents wear at Kodadwen in Cape Coast. Her husband is a trader. Leticia uses her income to pay for her children's school fees and other utility bills. Leticia will use the loan to purchase more clothing to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Leticia plans to save towards a family house that she wants to build.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is single and has no children. She has received schooling through Senior High level. Elizabeth sells footwear and groceries such as sugar, rice, biscuits and others at Mfantsipim Junction in Cape Coast, which she has done since 2004.

Elizabeth uses her income to help her husband in the payment of rent and utility bills. Elizabeth will use the loan to increase her capital to buy more shoes and groceries for sale to meet her ever-increasing customers' needs. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to save towards acquiring a piece of land she wants to buy with her husband.

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy more shoes and groceries for sale

loans.name: Kobbina

texts.en:
Kobbina T. sells jeans, T-shirts, men's shirts and other clothing at Kodadwen in Cape Coast. Kobbina has received Junior High level education. He is married and has 1 child. His wife is a businesswoman.

Kobbina has been selling men's clothing since 2003. He is responsible for helping his wife in the payment of utility bills and such. His loan will be used to buy more clothing (gents' wear) for re-sale. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to save towards a family house he wants to build with his wife.

loans.use: to buy more clothing (gents' wear) for re-sale

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en: Adamu Z. sells a local meal popularly known as 'Wakye' which is made from rice and beans. Adamu has a Junior High school level education.  She is a widow and has seven children. Adamu has been selling Wakye at the Tantri lorry park in Cape Coast since 2000. She is responsible for the payment of her children's school fees and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more ingredients, spices, and food items for the preparation of Wakye. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy building blocks for the house she wants to build for her children.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the preparation of Wakye

loans.name: Charles K

texts.en: Charles K G. is married and has one child. He has received technical training at school. Charles K sells mobile phones and accessories. He also repairs phones at Kotokoraba in Cape Coast. He has been in this business since 2005. His wife is a trader. Charles K uses his income to feed his family and to pay utility bills. Charles K will use the loan to buy more mobile phones to meet his ever increasing customer demand. He will also buy tools and equipment to enhance his phone repair work. With the new profits from his expanded business, Charles K plans to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more mobile phones as well as tools and equipment for his phone repair work

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.es:
Arsenio tiene 30 años de edad, quien es mecánico, es soltero vive con su madre a quien le ayuda con los gastos familiares.

Arsenio empezó a trabajar desde muy temprana edad con su papá de quien aprendió el oficio, luego de varios años de arduo trabajo y sacrificio pudo independizarse abriendo su propio taller lo cual le va muy bien, gracias a la calidad de su trabajo actualmente ya cuenta con clientela formada, quienes lo valoran mucho por su gran esfuerzo de superación en el ramo.

Trabaja con él su hermano a quien le enseña el oficio y le ayuda con los gastos de su estudio.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de herramientas varias para su taller.
texts.en:
Arsenio is 30 years old, a mechanic, single, and lives with his mother whom he helps with the family expenses. Arsenio began to work at a young age with his father from whom he learned this trade. Then after a few years of hard work and sacrifice he was able to go in to business independently opening his own shop which is going well, thanks to the quality of his work. Today he has a good customer base, they value him for his great effort in excelling in his trade. His brother works with him and he is training him to be a mechanic and Arsenio helps his brother with his education expenses. He needs a loan to buy various tools for his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various tools for his mechanic shop

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana A., a married father of two children, was educated through Junior High level and has manufactured palm oil for sale at Cape Coast since 2005. His wife is a trader. Nana uses his income to pay for the upkeep of his family, and is now requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients for the mass production of palm oil. With the resulting additional profits from this expansion, Nana plans to reinvest in his business to increase sales, thereby eventually increasing his income.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for the mass production of palm oil.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 26 años de edad, su actividad principal es la venta ambulante que significa vender artículos en forma ambulante, es soltero vive con su madre quien esta a su cuidado, desde muy joven se manifestó en él sentido de responsabilidad y de compromiso para mantener su hogar.

Carlos heredó el negocio y el conocimiento de dicha tarea de su padre, quien falleció en un accidente en ruta hace nueve años.

Realiza las ventas de sus mercaderías casa por casa en su moto recorriendo varios kilómetros diarios, cuenta con clientela formada por la variedad de sus productos, con precios muy accesibles y facilidad de los pagos.

Trabaja con él un primo a quien le paga comisión por las ventas realizadas.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de una motocicleta, para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Carlos is 26 years old and is a street vendor, he is single, and lives with his mother who is in his care. From a young age he has felt the responsibility and duty to support his home. Carlos inherited his business and knowledge from his father, who died in an accident 9 years ago. He sells merchandise house-to-house on his motorcycle covering various kilometers daily, he has a customer base for a variety of products, with prices accessible and offers payment plans. A cousin works with him and Carlos pays him a commission on his sales. He needs a loan to buy a motorcycle to expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José P. tiene 52 años de edad, está casado con la Ladislaa Villasboa, tienen 5 hijos, todos ellos estudian en el colegio de la ciudad. José vive con su familia hace más de 30 años en su casa propia.

José aprendió el oficio desde muy joven, trabajando con su padre, de quién heredó la profesión de zapatero. Actualmente cuenta con su propio negocio desde hace más de 25 años. Pretende utilizar el crédito para la compra de suelas y cuero (materia prima) para la producción de zapatos para damas y caballeros, que realiza en gran cantidad, ya que tiene muchos pedidos, por la buena calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
José P. is 52 years old and married to Ladislaa Vallasboa. They have 5 children, all of whom attend school in the city. José has lived in his house with his family for over 30 years. José learned his trade as a young child, working with his father, from whom he inherited shoemaking as a trade. He has actually had his own shoemaking business for the past 25 years. He claims that he will use this loan in order to buy soles and leather (a prime material) in order to produce shoes for men and women, and do so in a large quantity. He already has a lot of requests for his work due to the good quality of his products.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de cueros y suelas

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijas, todas ya son mayores de edad, al igual que su cónyuge trabajan y ayudan en los gastos de la casa.

Lidia es una persona muy sacrificada, quien gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación con ésta actividad puede brindarle una vida digna a toda su familia. Su despensa tiene en su propio domicilio hace más de 25 años, actualmente cuenta con una diversidad de productos satisfaciendo la demanda de su numerosa clientela.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías al por mayor, ya que tiene ofertas en ésta época.
texts.en:
Lidia is 50 years old, married, with 4 grown children. Her husband also works and together they help meet the household expenses. Lida is a sacrificing person, who, thanks to her effort and dedication to this job, can provide a dignified life to her family. Her convenience store has been located in her home for more than 25 years, today she has diverse products, satisfying the demands of her numerous customers. The loan will be used to buy merchandise at wholesale as there are sales during this time.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat, fruit, vegetables, canned goods and products for the home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
