loans.use: Purchase of new items to add to her stock of clothing and beauty products.

loans.name: Nery

texts.es:
Nery tiene 22 años de edad, quien se dedica a la venta en forma ambulante, es soltero vive con su madre y dos hermanos, quienes están a su cuidado.

Nery empezó a trabajar a los quince años como vendedor de su tío, después de cinco años se independizó y habilitó para su propio negocio.

Realiza las ventas casa por casa en su moto recorriendo varios kilómetros diarios, ya cuenta con una numerosa clientela por la buena calidad de sus productos y la facilidad en los pagos.

Es un joven muy sacrificado, quien a la noche estudia en la facultad cursando el tercer año de la carrera de Contabilidad.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías como sábanas, cacerolas, planchas y otros artículos.
texts.en:
Nery is 22 years old and is a traveling salesman. He is single and lives with his mother and two siblings that he takes care of. Nery started to work since he was fifteen years old as a salesperson for his uncle. After five years, he became independent and was able to furnish his own business.

He makes door to door sales on his motorcycle covering various kilometerd daily. He already counts on a numerous customer base because of the good quality of the products and the facility of the payments.

He is a very sacrificed man. During the night, he studies at the university being on his third year of Accounting. He needs the loan to buy merchandise like: sheets, pots, irons, and other articles.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise like:sheets, pots, irons, and other articles.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start a small cafeteria in her community

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Yaguarón, distante a 15 Km de la Oficina de Paraguarí, se reunieron unas mujeres con el objetivo de emprender actividades productivas y otras con la idea de aumentar su capital de trabajo con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, de ahí que se pusieron en contacto con nosotros para interiorizarse sobre el programa, quienes aceptaron por la oportunidad que se les está ofreciendo ya que ninguna otra institución lo ha hecho anteriormente.

El comité lleva por nombre San Roque, quienes actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo, con calificación excelente, integrada por 16 activas mujeres y emprendedoras mujeres.

Cada una de estas mujeres poseen actividades diferentes que le proveen de los ingresos necesarios para afrontar los gastos de la casa, los hijos entre otras cosas.

Los nombres y las actividades se describen a continuación: 1. Cipriana N. – despensa 2. Gladys A. - vendedora ambulante. 3. Melania Q. - venta de lencería. 4. Ubalda E. - cría de pollo. 5. Paulina T. - venta de frutas y verduras. 6. Sandra Benítez – empleada. 7. Dionisia F. – venta de frutas y verduras. 8. Amada S. – costurera. 9. Vilma Velázquez – venta de verduras. 10. Ma. Dolores C. – venta de chipa. 11. Mirna C. – venta de frutas y verduras. 12. Ma. Cirila M. – venta de comestibles. 13. Lourdes D. – almacén. 14. Ramona M. – almacén. 15. Vilma G. – venta de flores artificiales. 16. Hermelinda González – venta de comestibles.
texts.en:
In the city of Yaguaron, at a distance of 15 Km of the Paraguari Office, a group of women met with the objective of starting productive activities and others with the idea of incrementing their working capital with the goal of improving their quality of life and of their families too. From that point on, they contacted us to get information about the program and accepted the opportunity offered since no other institution had done it before.

The committee is named San Roque and actually they are in the first cycle with excellent qualifications. It is made up of 16 very active and entrerprising women. Each of these women have different activities that provide the needed income to afford the household expenses and to sustain their children among other things.

The following list describe their names and activities: 1. Cipriana N.-grocery store 2. Gladys A.-traveling sales 3. Melania Q.-lingerie sales 4. Ubalda E.-raising and selling chickens 5. Paulina T.- fruit and produce sales 6. Sandra Benítez - employee 7. Dionisia F. -fruit and produce sales 8. Amada S. - seamstress. 9. Vilma Velázquez -produce sales. 10.Ma. Dolores C. - chipa sales. 11.Mirna C. -fruit and produce sales 12.Ma. Cirila M. - grocery sales. 13.Lourdes D.-warehouse. 14.Ramona M. - warehouse. 15.Vilma G. -artificial flowers sales. 16.Hermelinda González - grocery sales.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Their loans will be invested in buying flour,noodles, rice,bread products, sugar, oil, dairy products, lingerie, general fruits and produce, fabrics,thread, meat, starch, etc.

loans.name: Ana Teresa

texts.pt:
Ana nasceu em namaacha uma vila que faz fronteira com a swazilândia, tem 42 anos estudou ate a 7 classe, teve que interroper os estudos devido a  gravidez precóce,é viuva e mãe de 4 filhas com idades compriendidas entre os 25 aos 18 anos de idade, a mais velha já esta empregada e as outras 3 estao no ensino secundario. 

Ana perde o seu esposo  num acidente de viacao em 1990 quando estava prestes a se casar. Apois essa tregédia, a vida fica dificil pois o falecido deixa-lhe com 4 filhas por criar e sem casa própria,pois viviam numa casacedido pelos serviços do marido e apois a sua morte tiveram que entregar a casa. Os pais acolheram lhe durante 3 anos  mas como o seu esposo era funcionario do estado ela recebe uma indimnização e uma casa. Em 1993 faz um curso de criacao de aves no centro social da namaacha durante 6 meses, entao com o valor ganho na indimnizacao e a pensao mensal de 2.700.00MT, inicia com a criacao de pintos actividade essa que exersse ate hoje. Tem metido 300 frangos e gasta 18.000.00MT  tem um lucro de 7.500.00MT e consegue poupar 2.000.00MT e 500.00mtn aluga capoeira, pois não se responsabiliza por mas niguem alem das filhas.

Este e o terceiro emprestimo da ana e primeiro com Kiva. O primeiro de 15,000.00mt e o segundo de 25,000.00mtn foram usados na compra de pintos e raçào e este terceiro de 15,000.00mtn tambem seram usados para mesmo fim, pretende futuramente pedir novos emprestimos para construir a sua propria capoiera e tornar se uma grande criadora de frangos.
texts.en:
Ana is 42 years old and was born in Namaacha, a village on the border of Swaziland. She studied up to 7th grade, then had to interrupt her studies because of an early pregnancy. She is a widow and mother of 4 daughters, between the ages of 18 and 25 years old. The oldest is employed, and the other three are in secondary school.

Ana lost her partner in a car accident in 1990 when they were prepared to get married. After this tragedy, life was difficult. He had left her with four children to raise and without a house of their own. They had been living in a house granted through his job, and after his death they had to vacate the house. Her parents took her in for three years, and because she was the wife of a state employee she received an indemnity benefit and a house. In 1993 she took a poultry-raising course for six months at the community center in Namaacha. Then with the money she had received from the indemnity benefit and monthly pension of 2,700 meticais (MZN), she started raising chickens, which she has continued until today. She has an average of 300 chickens; spends 18,000MZN; profits 7,500MZN; is able to save 2,000MZN; and rents a chicken coop for 500MZN. Now she is responsible for no one else besides her daughters.

This is Ana’s third loan and first one with Kiva. She used the first loan of 15,000MZN and the second of 25,000MZN to buy chickens and feed, and this third loan of 15,000MZN also will be used for the same purpose. In the future she intends to request more loans to build her own chicken coop and become a great chicken farmer.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chickens and feed for her poultry business

loans.name: Quiteria Fabião

texts.pt:
Quiteria tem 38 anos nasceu em gaza, fez a formão de professores primários vive maritalmente e mãe de 2 filhos o primeiro com 14anos e o segundo com 8anos de idade. Todos vão a escola, sai com seu tio de gaza para estudar em namaacha uma vila na fronteira com Zwaziândia, pois a escola dela distava se a 16km de casa e por dia tinha que percorrer 32km e era muito dificil.
Quitéria depois de concluir o curso de formaçào de professores, começa a trabalhar na escola das Irmãs.   Sai de casa do seu tio  quando junta se com o seu marido,é funcionária permanente trabalha das :45h as 12h auferindo mensalmente um valor de 3.374.00MT, quiteria começa com o negocio da venda de roupas devido ao custo de vida que sobe cada dia que passa e o salario não satisfaz com as necessidades da casa. Tem vendido muito mas as camisolas uma vez que estamos no inverno comprando jogo de doze (12) a 1.000R (3.500.00MT) e revendendo a 350MT cada  tem lucro de 4.000MT mensalmente e consegue poupar por mês  so 1.000.00MT porque tem que enviar por mês um valor de 500MT para a empregada que ajuda a sua mãe que vive em gaza  com uma idade avançado.

 Este é o primeiro emprestimo da Quiteria na Hluvuku com kiva que seram usados para aumentar o stock da sua mercadoria, ela pediu depois de ver sua vizinha conseguindo realizar seus projectos com o emprestimo da Hluvuku.tem como objectivo terminar de pagar o emprestimo dentro do prazo detrminado e solicitar um outro para concluir a sua obra que se encontra em boane no km16.
texts.en:
Born in Gaza, 38-year-old Quiteria is married and has 2 children: a 14-year-old and an 8-year-old, both are attending school. Quiteria graduated as a high-school teacher. When she was taking classes, she had no other option but to move in with her uncle in Naamacha.It was located closer to the school grounds, in a village near Swaziland's border, and she wouldn't have to endure the wearisome trip of 16 kilometers each way to reach it. After graduating from the high-school teacher's program, she started to work at the Irmãs (Sisters) School. She moved out from her uncle's home when she got married and became a permanent employee with a regular schedule from 8:45am to 12:00pm. Her monthly salary is 3.374.00 MT. Quiteria started a clothing retail business so she could keep up with increasing living costs that her salary alone was not covering anymore. During winter time, women's jackets sell strong and they are purchased at a price of 1.000R (3.500.00MT) for a dozen and sold for 350.00MT each, bringing in monthly 4.000MT in profits -- from that amount she is able to save 1.000MT, which helps pay her elderly mother's care giver salary of 500.00MT. This will be the first loan Quiteria requests from Hluvuku through Kiva and it will be used to stock up merchandise. Her friend's accomplishments achieved with loans from Hluvuku motivated her to apply for her own. As a goal, she wants to pay back the loan within its term duration so that she can request a second loan that will be used to finish up improvement work to her home at the 16th kilometer in Boane.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock merchandise

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.pt:
Jose tem 29 anos nasceu em homoine um distrito da provincia de inhambane, vive maritalmente e pai de duas filhas a primeira com 6anos e a segunda com 2anos de idade so a mais velha é que se encontra a estudar. Jose mudou se para Namaacha uma vila na fronteira com Swazilândia a procura de emprego  na companhia da sua tia que já vivia neste distrito.
José chega a Namaacha em 1997 em casa da sua tia. Trabalha num restaurante durante 2anos e recebia  mensalmente um salario no valor de 250.00mtn, mas  como o valor não conseguia satisfazer  as suas necessidades, inicia o seu proprio negocio com o valor colectado nos seus 2 anos de trabalho. Começa a vender bolos e recargas de telemoveis na fronteira, trabalhando das 7h as 20h quando a fronteira fecha as portas o seu negócio tem bons resultados hoje Daniel já tem sua propria casa onde vive com a sua familia. O melhor produto de Daniel são as recargas que compra por 15,00mtn, 45.00mtn, 74.00mtn e  90.00mtn e vende por 20.00mtn, 50.00mtn, 80.00mtn e 100.00mtn consecutivamente, tem um rendimento mensal de 3,000.00mtn e consegue poupar 500.00mtn, ajuda os seu avo que se encontra em homoine enviando-lhe uma caixa de sabao, 50kg de arroz e 25kg de acucar em cada 6 meses que coresponde a 1,500.00mtn..
Este é primeiro emprestimo de jose na hluvuku e kiva no valor de 12.000.00MT pretende aumentar o volume de mercadoria para satisfazer as necessidades e exigencias dos clientes. Tem como objectivo ampliar a sua barraca e iniciar com a obra de ampliaão da sua casa
texts.en:
Jose is 29 years old and was born in Homoine, a district of the province of Inhambane. He is married and the father of 2 daughters. The first is 6 years old, and the second is 2. Only the oldest is in school. Jose moved to Namaacha, a town on the boarder of Swaziland, searching for a job at his aunt's company who already lived in that district. Jose came to Namaacha in 1997 and stayed at his aunt's house. He has worked in a restaurant for 2 years and receives a monthly salary of 250MT, but because the income does not satisfy his necessities he started his own business with the earnings from his 2 years of work. He started selling rolls and cellphone refills on the boarder. He works from 7:00am to 8:00pm when the boarder closes. His business has good results. Jose already has his own home where he lives with his family. Jose's best product are the refills that he buys for 15MT, 45MT, 74MT and 90MT and sells fo 20MT, 50MT, 80MT, and 100MT consecutively. He has a monthly income of 3000MT and is able to save 500MT. He helps his grandfather who is in Homoine by sending him a box of soap, 50kg of rice, and 25kg of sugar every 6 months that corresponds to 1,500MT. This is the first loan for Jose with Hluvuku and Kiva for the amount of 12,000MT. He intends to increase the volume of his merchandise to satisfy the necessities and demands of his clients. His objective is to improve his stand and begin work enlarging his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chic pants and shoes to attract new people to her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy jewelry

loans.name: Clemêncio Raimundo

texts.pt:
Clemencio e solteiro de 33 anos de idade nasceu em namaacha um distriro que faz fronteira com a swazilandia, estudou ate a 10ªclasse teve que parar devido ao trabalho que não lhe permitia mais frequentar a escola.

Sai de casa dos seus pais quando a sua irma mais velha e cedida uma casa e pede a ele para cuidar da mesma. Porque ele não trabalhava na altura , a irma dava-lhe uma mesada de 250.00MT por mês. A responsabilidade já era maior e ele quis sempre ser dependente e aranja um emprego no restaurante chiconela onde trabalha durante 3 anos.A sua irma aranja um emprego mas condigno no hotel libombos pois esta e contabilista daquela reparticao, mas para isso ele tinha que ter no minimo a 10ªclasse já concluida, e na altura so tinha a 8 classe. Entao pede o seu patrao para continuar com os estudos  e este recusa alegando que o trabalho que ele fazia não lhe podia permitir estudar, em 2000 ele larga o emprego e volta a estudar, concluida a 10ªclasse comeca a trabalhar em 2003 como recepcionista cargo que exerce ate hoje. E funcionario permanente trabalha das 7h as 19h auferindo mensalmente um valor de 4.000.00MT por mês. Responsabiliza-se pela sua gemea e seus sobrinhos comprando lhes uniforme e  seu respectivo material escolar. Consegue poupar por mês 1.000.00MT pois não tem filhos e vive com a sua namorada.

Este e o segundo emprestimo de clemencio na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva. O primeiro emprestimo de 20.000.00MT ele usou para comprar material de construcao para a sua obra, conseguiu pagar o emprestimo dentro do praso determinado e pede este segundo de 20.000.00MT para concluir com a sua obra. Tem como objectivo ver a sua obra concluida e pedir um novo emprestimo para mobilar a mesma.
texts.en:
Clemencio is single and 33 years old. He was born in Namaacha, in a district on the border of Swaziland. He studied through tenth grade, then had to stop because work did not allow him to continue attending school.

He left his parents’ house when his oldest sister got a house and asked him to take care of it. Because he did not work at that time, his sister gave him a monthly allowance of 250 meticais (MZN). He grew more responsible and always wanted to be independent, so he secured a job at a small restaurant, where he worked for three years. His sister found him a better position at the Libombos Hotel, in the department where she was an accountant. It required, however, an education through at least tenth grade, and he had studied through only eighth grade at that time. So he asked his boss if he could continue his studies, and his boss denied his request, arguing that the job he was doing did not allow him to study. In 2000 Clemencio left that job and resumed his studies. Completing tenth grade, in 2003 he began to work as a receptionist, which he continues today. He is a regular employee, works from 7am to 7pm, and makes 4,000MZN per month. He has taken responsibility for his twin sister and his nephews and nieces, buying them uniforms and their necessary school materials. He manages to save 1,000MZN per month, as he does not have children and lives with his girlfriend.

This is Clemencio’s second loan with Hluvuku (Kiva’s Field Partner) and his first with Kiva. He used the first loan of 20,000MZN to buy construction materials for his house, and he repaid the loan on time. He requests this second loan of 20,000MZN to finish this work. His goal is to see this building completed and to request a new loan to furnish it.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua D. sells groceries like sugar, rice, biscuits and others at Braman in Cape Coast. Ekua has received a Basic level of education. She is married and has 5 children.

Ekua has been selling groceries since 2000. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more groceries for sale to meet her ever-increasing customers' needs. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into the business to increase sales which will eventually increase her income.

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy more groceries for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase wholesale the chicken, cow and pork meat she retails in her community.

loans.name: Maxwell

texts.en:
Maxwell H. sells groceries such as sugar, rice, biscuits, soap and others at Braman in Cape Coast. Maxwell has received Senior High level education. He is divorced and has 1 child.

Maxwell has been selling groceries since 1998. He is responsible for paying his child's school fees and utility bills. His loan will be used to increase his capital to buy more groceries for sale to meet the needs of his ever-increasing customers. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest into the business to increase sales which will eventually increase his income.

loans.use: to increase his capital to buy more groceries for sale

loans.name: António Filipe

texts.pt:
António Filipe Z. é natural da cidade da Matola uma zona que dista a 15 km da cidade de Maputo, tem 46 anos de idade, é casado e pai de 3 filhos com idade entre primeiro 14, 12 e 6 meses de idade respectivamente. Para alem dos seus filhos e esposa sustenta a sogra e a sua mãe enviando dinheiros mensalmente.

António estudou até 10ªclasse quando jovem e abandonou para ir a Republica Sul-africana trabalhar e neste momento frequenta 11ªclasse. Sempre viveu em Boane excepto quando foi trabalhar na RSA como infiltrado.( pessoas que entra no pais ilegalmente).

António é funcionário da educação a 10 anos como docente,  tendo se formado no instituto do magistério primário de Maputo. Tem um salário mensal de 2900,00mt trabalha das 12:10 as 17:30h. Este é o terceiro empréstimo para António e os dois primeiros destinou para compra de material de construção e este é para continuação com projecto. constitui grande sonho para António a continuar com os estudos aumentando assim o seu nível académico.
texts.en:
António Filipe Z. is from the city of Matola, an area situated 15 kilometers away from Maputo. He is 46 years old, married and has 3 children that are a 6-month-old baby and two boys, a 12-year-old and a 14-year-old. Besides his children he also supports his mother-in-law and his mother by sending them monthly allowances. Antonio attended school until the 10th grade when he dropped out to find work in South Africa. He is back in school now, attending the 11th grade. Except when he lived in South Africa as an illegal immigrant, he has always resided in Boane. Antonio is an education professional, a graduate from Maputo's Institute of High School Education. His monthly salary is 2900,00mt and his shift goes from 12:10pm until 5:30pm. This will be Antonio's third loan request and it will be applied to purchase construction material, as it was done with the previous two loans. Antonio's biggest dream is to continue his education and, therefore, improve his academic level.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice D. is married and has 6 children. She has received schooling through Basic level. Alice manufactures palm oil for sale in Cape Coast, which she has done since 1998. Her husband is a corn mill operator.

Alice uses her income to help her husband in the payment of the children's school fees and utility bills. Alice will use the loan to purchase more palm fruit for the production of palm oil. With the new profits from her expanded business, Alice plans to reinvest into the business to increase production and sales which will eventually increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit for the production of palm oil

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam O. D. is married and has 6 children. He has received schooling through Basic level. Sam manufactures palm oil for sale at Braman in Cape Coast, which he has done since 2001. His wife is an oil producer.

Sam uses his income to pay for feeding the family and utility bills. Sam will use the loan to purchase more palm fruit for the production of palm oil. With the new profits from his expanded business, Sam plans to reinvest to expand his oil palm plantation.

loans.use: purchase more palm fruit for the production of palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing so as to keep operating her small business

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina A. manufactures palm oil for sale at Braman in Cape Coast. Paulina has received no formal education. She is married and has 7 children. Her husband is a farmer.

Paulina has been manufacturing palm oil for sale since 2004. She is responsible for helping her husband in the payment of the children's school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more palm fruit for the production of palm oil. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband in the renovation of their family house.

loans.use: to buy more palm fruit for the production of palm oil

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi G. sells a local meal popularly known as 'Kenkey' which is made out of corn. It is one of the most commonly eaten foods in the country. Her business is located in Braman in Cape Coast. Esi has received no formal education, is married and has 6 children. Esi has been selling 'Kenkey' since 2003, and is responsible for helping her husband to pay their children's school fees and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more corn, and fresh fish which she will fry and sell, and other ingredients which are needed to prepare the food. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest and expand her 'Kenkey' business.

loans.use: To buy more corn, fresh fish, and other ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a large variety of products for her small salon

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia O., married with five children, has manufactured palm oil for sale at Braman in Cape Coast since 2007. Her husband is a commercial driver. Felicia uses her income to help her husband in the payment of the children's school fees as well as utility bills.

Felicia is requesting a loan to purchase more palm fruit for the production of palm oil, and she plans to reinvest any additional profits into the business in order to increase sales, thereby eventually increasing her income.

loans.use: To purchase more palm fruit for the production of palm oil.

loans.name: Fatima Massossote

texts.pt:
Fátima Massossote O. natural de Boane e tem 31 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 2 filhos com idade de 7 anos o primeiro e 5 anos o segundo. O primeiro estuda na 1ªclasse. Para alem dos seus filhos sustenta um sobrinho que vive com ele na sua casa.

Fátima estudou ate 12ªclasse de formação como professora primaria e por falta de condições teve que parar, nunca mudou se de cidade sempre vive na mesma. É funcionaria da educação como professora e tem um horário das 12:30 as 17:30h.

Fátima vive numa casa própria, e este é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, nunca solicitou noutras instituições, o primeiro no valor de 7000,00mt e pagou com sucesso. Tem como sonho continuar com os estudos, ampliar a sua casa e mobilar e conta com o credito. Fatima aparece na foto com o seu segundo filho.
texts.en:
Fátima Massossote O. is a native to Boane and is 31 years old. She is married and the mother of 2 sons with ages 7 and 5. The oldest is in 1st grade. Besides her sons she also supports a nephew that lives with her. Fátima studied until the 12th grade to be an elementary school teacher but because of poor conditions had to stop. She never moved from the city, and has always lived there. She works as a teacher from 12:30 until 5:30. Fátima lives in her own home. This is her second loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. She never solicited other institutions. Her first loan was for 7,000MT, and she repaid it with success. Her dream is to continue with her studies, improve her home and furnishings, and she counts on credit. Fátima appears in this photo with her second son.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina A., who is married and has nine children, received schooling through Junior High level. In business since 1991, Justina sells cooked rice, preparing both the rice and the sauce for her customers. Her enterprise is thriving in Cape Coast.

Her husband is a trader, and Justina uses her income to help him in the payment of the children's school fees and the utility bills. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice and other ingredients for her food preparations. With the new profits from her expanded business, Justina plans to help her husband begin construction of a house for the family.

loans.use: To purchase more rice and other ingredients for her food preparation business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel A., married with four children, has been selling groceries including sugar, rice, biscuits, and soap in Braman in Cape Coast since 2002. His wife is a trader. Samuel is responsible for paying his children's school fees and the utility bills.

He is requesting a loan in order to purchase more groceries for sale to meet the demands of his ever-increasing customer base. Samuel hopes to use the new profits to reinvest in his business, thereby eventually increasing his income.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Freduah

texts.en:
Freduah A., married with seven children, received schooling through Junior High level and has been selling agro chemicals at Cape Coast since 1999. His wife is a cold store keeper.

Freduah, who uses his income to pay for his children's school fees and the utility bills, is requesting a loan to purchase more agro chemicals to meet the demand of the area farmers. He plans to reinvest the new profits from his expansion back into the business, thereby eventually increasing his income.

loans.use: To buy more agro chemicals to sell to meet the demand of area farmers.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María inició el negocio por la necesidad de obtener un ingreso que le permitiera contribuir con el gasto familiar y para poder comprar sus cosas para sin tener que esperar a que le diera dinero su esposo. Comenzó en Febrero de 2007, ya que era empleada de un comedor pero ese trabajo le absorbía mucho y no le permitía estar al tanto de sus hijos, fue entonces que una hermana que vive en la ciudad de Reynosa, la convenció que vendiera ropa usada en los mercados rodantes cercanos a su colonia y ella le enviaría la ropa desde Reynosa para que la vendiera, lo cual llevó a cabo y desde entonces le ha ido muy bien.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar un extenso surtido de productos que en esta temporada tienen una mayor demanda y poder ofrecerles más variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria began her business out of the necessity to earn income that would allow her to contribute to the family bills and so that she could buy things without having to hope that her husband would give her money. She began in February 2007. She was a restaurant employee, but this job required a lot from her and did not allow her to be with her children much. It was then that a sister who lives in the city of Reynosa convinced Maria to sell used clothing in the mobile markets near her area. She sent clothing from Reynosa to sell, which Maria carried out, and since then it has gone well.

Maria needs a loan of US $300, which she will repay in four months, to purchase an extensive supply of products that, in this season, are in great demand and so that she can offer more variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Laura Viviana

texts.es:
Laura inició el negocio porqué deseaba obtener un ingreso aparte del D. su esposo lo cual les permitiera progresar económicamente y así ayudar a su esposo con los gastos y L. educación D. sus hijos. Comenzó en Febrero D. 2006, su hermana L. convenció para que vendiera cosméticos ya que elL. conocía mucha gente y eso lo podía aprovechar, entonces comenzó vendiendo entre sus vecinas y amistades y en L. actualidad ya cuenta con un buen número D. clientes.

ElL. necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar un extenso surtido D. productos que en esta temporada tienen una mayor demanda y poder ofrecerle más variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Laura began her business because she wanted to obtain an income apart from her husband’s which would permit them to progress economically and in this way help her husband with the household expenses and the children’s education expenses. She began in February 2006, her sister convinced her to sell cosmetics as Laura knew many people and she could take advantage of that fact. So she began selling to neighbors and friends and today she has a good number of customers. She needs a loan for US$300 which will be repaid in 4 months to buy an extensive supply of products because in this season she has a greater demand and she will be able to offer a greater variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for cosmetic sales

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia inició el negocio por superación personal, ya que le gustan mucho las ventas y para ella es una forma de conocer personas y ayudarlas a través de sus productos naturistas. Comenzó en Agosto de 2004, ella era consumidora de los productos que actualmente vende, pero una amiga que le vendía los productos la convenció para que ella también se convirtiera en vendedora, fue así como comenzó a vender dichos productos, primero entre sus familiares, y después entre vecinos y amistades, los cuales la fueron recomendando con otras personas y en la actualidad tiene un buen numero de clientes. A partir de su crédito anterior otorgado a través de KIVA ha podido incrementar sus clientes aunque este año ha sido un poco difícil por la situación económica.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para poder comprar más productos que le permita tener un mejor surtido que ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera incrementar sus ganancias
texts.en:
Julia began her business by overcoming personal obstacles, as she likes sales and for her it is a way of getting to know and help people through natural products. She began in August of 2004 as a consumer of the products she sells today. A friend was selling products to her and convinced her that she too should become a seller, and it was this way that she began to sell these products, first to relatives, then to neighbors and friends who were recommended by others and today she has a good number of customers. Beginning with a prior loan given through KIVA she has been able to increase her customers even though it as been a rather difficult economic situation. She needs a loan for US $300 which will be repaid in 4 months in order to by more jewelry and shoes that will permit her to have a better stock to offer her customers and in this manner increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy jewelry

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores inició el negocio por el deseo de sentirse una persona útil y porque siempre le han gustado las ventas. Comenzó en 1998 por invitación de una amiga para unos cursos de repujado y fieltro que impartían en el DIF (Desarrollo Integral de la Familia), los cuales tomó y ahí aprendió mucho. Ahora ya tiene muchos pedidos en diferentes tiendas de regalos de sus amistades porque les ha gustado su trabajo, y le ha ido muy bien desde entonces.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses. Esto la va a ayudar para invertir en material que le permita elaborar sus trabajos de repujado y poder surtir las tiendas que le hacen pedidos y así obtener mayores ganancias
texts.en:
Dolores began her business out of the desire to feel like a useful person and because she has always enjoyed sales. She began in 1998 when a friend invited her to take a course in embossing and felt given by the DIF (Integral Development of the Family). They took it and learned a lot. Now she has many orders from different gift shops owned by friends who have liked her work. It has been going very well for her since then.

She needs a loan of US $475, which she will repay in six months. This will help her invest in material that will allow her to do her embossing work and supply the stores from which she has orders and therefore obtain greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in material.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La señora Ana Miryan G. de Amarilla es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, de la Compañía “Defensores del Chaco”, tiene 39 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Justo Amarilla Chaparro de 46 años de edad, actualmente tienen 2 hijos, todos mayores de edad.

Tienen una carnicería en su casa particular, con clientela formada, y tiene buenos ingresos.

También son personas con buenas referencias comerciales y personales.

El cliente esta trabajando en esta actividad hace 10 años, y es una señora muy conocida y querida en la zona.

Ella desea un crédito pues con el podrá adquirir carnes de todo tipo para surtir más su carnicería. En Paraguay la población consume mayormente carne de vaca, es por eso que las carnicerías tienen mucho éxito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Miryan G. de Amarilla is from San Estanislao city, from the company “Defensores del Chaco,” she is 39 years old, married to Mr. Justo Amarilla Chaparro who is 46 years old. They have to grown children. They have a butcher shop in their home, with a customer base, and have good income. They also are people with good commercial and personal references. This client has been in this business for 10 years, and is a woman who is well-known and loved in this zone. She would like a loan to be able to acquire all types of meat to stock her butcher shop. In Paraguay the population primarily consumes beef, so the butcher shops are generally successful.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beef, pork, and chicken.

loans.name: Agustín

texts.es:
El señor Agustín Hermes C., es de la Ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Republicano, tiene 44 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Adelaida Ovando Duarte de 41 años de edad, tienen 4 Hijos, y todos están en edad escolar.

Tiene una despensa en su domicilio particular, con buena clientela, formada gracias a l buen trato a sus clientes y también buenos precios.

Son personas con excelente referencias comerciales y personales, tienen también una finca, con producción de tomate y otros rubros.

Desean este crédito pues les permitirá adquirir mercaderías como azúcar, aceite, lácteos, frutas, panificados, harina, verduras, gaseosas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Mr. Agustín Hermes C. is from San Estanislao city, from the Republican Neighborhood, is 44 years old, married to 41 year old Mrs. Adelaida Ovando Duarte. They have 4 children, all of whom are school aged. They have a convenience store in their home, with a good customer base, formed thanks to the good service to their customers and good prices. They have excellent commercial and personal references, they also have a farm, with production of tomatoes and other crops. They wish for this loan so that the can acquire merchandise like sugar, oil, milk products, fruit, baked goods, flour, vegetables, soda pop, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise such as sugar, oil, milk products, fruit, baked goods, flour, vegetables, soda pop.

loans.name: Claudina

texts.es:
La señora Claudina es de la ciudad de Santani, tiene 4 hijos, tiene una despensa bien surtida en donde atiende con sus hijos. Comenzó a trabajar con su pequeña despensa hace 4 años, anteriormente era vendedora ambulante, luego tuvo un accidente lo cual la obligó a dejar ese trabajo.

Gracias a los créditos que recibió anteriormente de la Fundación pudo aumentar su stock de mercaderías. Su proyecto es construir un salón más amplio para su negocio. El crédito que solicita en esta ocasión será para la compra de un mayor stock de mercaderías como ser: gaseosas, golosinas, panificados, artículos para el hogar, alimentos enlatadas, etc.
texts.en:
Claudina is from the city of Santani. She has 4 children and a well-stocked store where she works with her children.

She began working at the store 4 years ago. Before that, she was a travelling saleswoman, but she had an accident and had to quit her job.

Thanks to the loans she received previously from the :Fundación Paraguaya" she was able to increase her stock of merchandise. Her project is to build a bigger locale for her business.

The loan she is soliciting on this occasion is to buy more stock of merchandise like sodas, candy, baked goods, household articles, canned goods, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sodas, candy, baked goods, household articles, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
La Sra. Elva López, tiene  61 años de edad, es viuda y  tiene 2 hijos, todos mayores de edad.
Doña Elva nos mencionó que para poder empezar su negocio, por los años 1988 aproximadamente, su marido aún en vida, plantaba algodón y con sus ganancias pudo montar dicho negocio.
Gracias a esta actividad logró que sus hijos sean  todos unos profesionales, ambos docentes.
En la actualidad es una de las despensas con mayor movimiento en la zona por la que es una de las más antiguas y con clientela formada.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de un congelador, ya que está empezando la temporada de calor y necesita para que sus bebidas estén bien frescas, porque en nuestro país el calor es bastante fuerte, llegando a alcanzar temperaturas de 38º C muchas veces.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elva López, 61 years old, is a widow and has 2 grown children. Elva tells us that in order to begin her business around 1988, when her husband was still alive, she planted cotton and with her earnings she was able to start her current business. Thanks to this business she was able to ensure that her children would be professionals, and both are teachers today. Today her convenience store is one of the busiest in the neighborhood as it is one of the oldest and has a good customer base. The loan will be used to buy a refrigerator, as the hot season is beginning and she needs to keep her beverages well-chilled, because in our country the heat is rather strong, frequently reaching temperatures of 38º C.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a refrigerator and merchandise (rice, sugar, tea, baked goods, etc.)

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La Sra  Lucia  C. tiene  46  años de edad,  tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad y 2  hijos menores  que están cursando la primaria.
Ella nos cuenta que  hace más de 5  años  que se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad, para empezar con  su negocio ella cobró su liquidación de haberes, en la  Hilandería de Ybycuí, donde trabajaba, antes de montar su negocio. Con la ayuda  económica de su marido que  trabaja  hasta hoy día como empleado de la fabrica, gracias al esfuerzo de  su trabajo y de su pequeña Despensa, se ayudan  mutuamente  para poder solventar  los gastos de la casa, los estudios de sus hijos y de apoco ir mejorando su nivel de vida y lograr el ingreso necesario para llevar una vida mejor. 
El crédito solicitado es para aumentar el stok de sus mercaderías y así brindar  una buena atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucia C. is 46 years old, has 4 grown children and 2 small children who are in primary school. She tells us that she has been selling basic needs items for more than 5 years. To begin her business she sold her assets in the spinning mill in Ybycuí, where she used to work before starting her business. With the economic help of her husband who works even today as a factory employee, thanks to the effort of her work and to her small store, they are able to help each other meet their household expenses, their children’s education expenses, and little by little improve their standard of living and achieve the necessary income to have a better life. The loan is to increase the stock of merchandise and in this way provide good customer service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise (rice, sugar, noodles, tea, etc.)

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
El señor Domingo Antonio V. Ayala es de Jejui, tiene casa propia, casado, con hijos, tiene 52 años de edad.

Tiene una ferretería, y también taller de motocicletas, que ya lleva 6 años de funcionamiento. El mismo esta ubicado en un local propio en donde es ayudado por su hijo, tiene clientela formada y buena ubicación pues se encuentra en una zona céntrica de la ciudad.

También tiene 30 hectáreas de propiedad, en donde tiene animales vacunos y ovinos, además de cultivos diversos. Estos también representan un ingreso muy bueno para la familia.

Domingo quiere aumentar la cantidad de mercaderías, para su negocio, ya que tiene muchos clientes que prefieren comprar en su negocio precisamente por la buena variedad de productos que ofrece en su ferretería.

Entre las mercaderías a adquirir están repuestos en general como cables, focos, pinturas, repuestos para motocicletas, etc.
texts.en:
Mr. Domingo Antonio V. Ayala is from Jejui, has his own home, is married with children, and is 52 years old. He has had a hardware store and also a motorcycle shop for 6 years. He owns his shops’ locale and is helped by his son. He has a customer base and good location in the city’s center. He also has 30 hectors of property where he has cattle and sheep in addition to a variety of crops. This also represents a good income for the camily. Domingo wants to increase the quantity of merchandise in his business, as he has many customers that prefer to buy in his business precisely for the good variety of products that he offers in his hardware stores. Among the merchandise to acquire are general parts such as cables, lights, paint, motorcycle parts, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy general parts such as cables, lights, paint, motorcycle parts, etc.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La  Sra. Sofia P., de 61 años, es soltera, realiza su actividad comercial con la ayuda de su hija, esta vive con su madre y sus dos hijos menores de edad.
	Siempre activó en el comercio, en sus inicios como vendedora ambulante, luego como dependiente de negocios mayoristas, y desde el 2000 por cuenta propia en su local, donde vende productos como:yerba mate, aceite, azucar, embutidos, lácteos.
	A dejado en el olvido los tiempos en que era dependiente, que debía trabajar largas jornadas por un pobre ingreso; Ahora es ella misma y lucha por mejorar en todo momento.  
	El dinero solicitado será destinado a la compra de mercaderías como:  Aceite, azucar, embutidos, lácteos etc
	No cree en los cambios del nuevo gobierno, es posible mejorar la situación de Paraguay si cada uno hace el esfuerzo, y trabaja para lograr el cambio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sofia P. is 61 years old, single and does her commercial activity with her daughter's help. Her daughter lives with her and two children who are minors. She has always been active in commerce. At the beginning, she started as a traveling salesperson, then as an employee of wholesale businesses and since 2000 she has been self-employed with a shop where she sells products like: mate grass, oil, sugar, sausages, and dairy products

She has left behind and forgotten the times when she was an employee, in which she had to work long schedules for a poor income; Now she is herself and fights to improve at every chance. Teh loan that she is asking for will be invested in buying merchandise like: oil, sugar, sausages, dairy products, etc. She doesn't believe in the changes of the new government. It is possible to improve the situation in Paraguay if everyone makes the effort and works towards that change.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buiyng oil, sausages, flour, herbs, and sweets.

texts.es:
La Sra Rosa A., de 58 años, esta casada con Don Victor Ojeda de 56 años, hace más de 30 años, sus dos hijos, son mayores, e independientes; Estos tienen una experiencia de más de 25 años en el comercio de mercaderias de consumo masivo.
La Sra. Rosa viaja desde muy joven a la Argentina y Brasil, para comprar las mercaderias, lo hace ya por pedido de sus clientes, y su esposo se ocupa de la distrtibución.
Es motivador observar como trabajan, ambos se motivan y con mucho fervor inician cada día de mercadeo, de ventas, de relación con sus compradores. 
El dinero solicitado será destinado a la compra de mercaderías como: Gaseosas, jugos, cerveza, aceite, azucar etc. 
Sostienen la onda positiva motivandose mutuamente, asumiendo nuevos desafios que les renueva la adrenalina en cada inicio del día.
texts.en:
Rosa A., 58, and Victor Ojeda, 56, have been married for more than 30 years. Their two sons are grown up and independent. Rosa and Victor have been selling various consumer goods for more than 25 years. Since her youth, Rosa has been traveling to Argentina and Brazil to buy products, which are often specially ordered by her customers, and Victor takes care of the distribution. It is motivating to see them working together, encouraging each other, and their enthusiasm in dealing with their business and customers everyday. The loan that they are requesting will be used to purchase merchandise such as sodas, juice, beer, oil, sugar, etc. Rosa and Victor keep a positive outlook with mutual encouragement, and taking on new challenges that renew their zest for life every day.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing sodas, beer, wine, oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.es:
El señor Osvaldo López es del Barrio Navidad, distrito de Guayaybi, tiene casa propia, y es casado.

Es odontólogo, tiene su consultorio en su casa, cuenta con todos los elementos y herramientas para su trabajo. Su consultorio lo ha equipado con mucho sacrificio gracias a ahorros y créditos que fue adquiriendo, pues el cuenta de que son muy caros.

También realiza servicios a domicilio en otras localidades para cumplir con sus pacientes. Además de eso también tiene una finca en donde tiene cultivos de mandioca y maíz, lo cual representa un buen ingreso para la familia también.

Osvaldo está muy contento con los logros que obtiene de su profesión, dice que desea seguir ayudando a más personas a acceder a este servicio ya que en la ciudad no existen muchos odontólogos y el desea ayudar a niños de escasos recursos a cuidar sus dientes.

Osvaldo desea ampliar su local, y comprar más muebles para su consultorio de este modo dar mayor comodidad a sus pacientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Florencio M. Ortiz is 53 years old and from Joaihu-Guayaybi where he owns his own home. Hs is married to Marina González and they have 3 children. The client is an electricity and electronics technician, repairing televisions, radios, refrigerators, and more. In addition he owns a disc jockey business called FM DISCO, where he is contracted to play for parties such as weddings, birthdays, etc. His wife sells cheese and milk, as she has milking cows and with them she produces additional income for the family. Today they are asking for a loan to acquire more new tools and parts for his electricity and electronics workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials, parts and tools

loans.name: Marina Yolinda

texts.es:
La señora Marina Yolinda O. tiene treintaicinco años,  vive en la calle Nazareno 214 en el distrito de Mache provincia de Otuzco departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Marina  estudió primaria completa, pero no pudo continuar estudiando porque en el distrito que habitaba solamente había escuela primaria, sus padres no la pudieron apoyar económicamente para continuar estudiando en otro lugar.
Se comprometió con el señor Jorge Santos Pozo Zavaleta con el que tiene dos hijos varones y una hija mujer, los tres estudiantes.
Empezó su negocio vendiendo quesillo, tuvo una bodega en el caserío Cruz de Mayo pero tuvo que cerrarla porque fue a vivir a Mache para poder educar a sus hijos, continua con el negocio de quesillo y compra venta de animales menores.
Manuela Ramos me prestó por primera ves 300 soles con lo que compré quesillo, hice queso y los vendí a buen precio, manifiesta, también recuerda que el préstamo lo devolvió en cuatro meses. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1000 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará quesillo para hacer queso y volver a vender.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Mache desde hace más de cuatro años. 
Su gran sueño es ver a sus hijos profesionales y que vivan en el lugar donde ellos sean muy felices.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marina Yolinda O. is 35 years old; she lives on Nazareno Street in Mache, Otuzco in the state of La Libertad, Peru. Marina finished elementary school, but could not continue studying since in the district where she lived, there was only elementary school and her parents could not afford to send her elsewhere to go to high school. She married Jorge Santos Pozo Zavaleta with whom she has two sons and one daughter; all three are students. She started her business selling cheese; she had a small shop in the Cruz de Mayo farmhouse but she had to close it when she went to live in Mache where she could more easily educate her children. She still works selling cheese and buying and selling small animals. She received her first loan from the Manuela Ramos organization of $125 which she used to buy cheese which she sold at a good price. She was able to repay the loan in 4 months. With this $125 loan which she will repay in 4 payments, she will purchase more cheese which she will sell. She has belonged to the Women of Mache village bank for the past 4 years. She dreams of seeing her children become professionals and that they can live where they will be happy.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cheese

loans.name: 6 De Enero Group

texts.es:
Este comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras fué el primero que se benefició con este programa de apoyo, se formó a de la promoción realizada por la Asesora y el gerente de la Oficina.
El comité esta constituido por 16 señoras quienes viven en el mismo barrio. Las señoras tienen diferentes actividades y que a partir de la conformación del comité se ayudan en la compra de sus productos unas de otras.
Ellas solicitan el crédito para la compra de las materias primas en cantidad para conseguir mejores precios.Ellas ya están en el 2º ciclo y tienen un ahorro de mas de 700.000 Gs.(176U$), es un comité muy sólido, y apuntan a crecer en confianza, y desarrollo personal.
texts.en:
The Committee "Mujered Emprendedoras" was the first that benefited from this support program, and was started under a promotion by the Advisor and manager of the Office. The committee consists of 16 women who live in the same neighborhood. The women have different activities and from the start of this committee they have bought each other's products. They are seeking a loan to buy raw materials in bulk in order to get better prices. They are now on their second cycle and have a savings of more than 700.000 Gs (US$176). It is a solid committee and they note that they want to grow in confidence and personal development.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing, fabric, perfume, cosmetic, jewelry, beverages, basic needs items like sugar, flour, noodles, tea, eggs, meat and other items.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
L. señora Juliana Z. D. L. C. tiene cincuentaiseis años, vive en L. avenida Primavera 116 en el distrito D. Mache, provincia D. Otuzco, departamento D. L. Libertad Perú.
Estudió educación primaria completa, pero no pudo continuar estudiando, debido a una grave enfermedad que le atacó a L. retina, una fuerte infección que le hizo perder parte D. L. visión.
Se casó D. treintaicinco años con Federico Sedano C., con quien tienen un hijo D. ocho años que aun está estudiando.
Trabajó desD. los catorce años, así que gozaba D. un buen capital, que lo perdió por las múltiples enfermedades que le atacaron, elL. agradece mucho a ManueL. Ramos, porque gracias a sus créditos a podido recuperar su negocio.
El primer préstamo que obtuvo D. ManueL. Ramos, hace cinco años fue D. 300 soles con ello comenzó a comprar animales menores para prepararlos y venderlos en las ferias del lugar. Fue devuelto en cuatro meses.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 2600 soles, el cual cancelará en 4 cuotas, comprará abarrotes para su bodega y con lo que le queD. comprará animales pequeños para prepararlos y venderlos en comida, que es L. mejor forma D. obtener mayores ganancias, manifiesta.
Pertenece al Comedor Popular Sol D. María y es fiscal del Banco Comunal Progresistas, lo admirable D. esta mujer es que a pesar D. su enfermedad es muy proactiva.
Su sueño es recuperar completamente L. vista para continuar trabajando y sobre todo para trabajar por su distrito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juliana Zavalets D. L. C. is 56 years old, lives at Primavera 116 avenue in Mache district, Otuzco province, L. Libertad state in Peru. She completed primary education, but couldn’t continue studying due to a serious infirmity that attacked her retina. A strong infection maD. her lose part of her vision. She married at 35 years old to Federica Sedano C., with whom she has an 8 year old son who is still in school. She has worked since she was 14 years old, so she has enjoyed earning money, but she lost her earnings because of the multiple illnesses that attacked her. She thanks ManueL. Ramos because thanks to its loans she has been able to recover her business. The firs tloan that she obtained from ManueL. Ramos, 5 years ago, was for 300 soles and with it she began to buy small animals to prepare and sell them in the city’s markets. The loan was repaid in 4 months. With this loan for S/.2600 soles, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy groceries for her store and with any remaining she will buy small animals to prepare and sell as food, which is the best way of generating the greatest profits. She belongs to the communal kitchen Sol D. María and is member of the Communal Bank Progresistas. What is admirable about this woman is that in spite of her illness she is very proactive. Her dream is to completely recover her vision in order to continue working and above all to work for her district.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of groceries and small meat animals.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
LETICIA C. A. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit.  Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families’ incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home.

LA SEÑORA LETICIA ES UNA MUJER GRANDE DE EDAD Y SOLTERA, SE MANTIENE DE SU PENSION Y DE LAS CUATRO CASITAS QUE RENTA, ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE PRESTAMO PARA REPARAR EL TECHO DE SU CASA E IMPERMEABILIZARLO YA QUE EN ESTA TEMPORADA DE LLUVIA Y DE GRANIZO SU TECHO SE HA IDO DAÑANDO POCO A POCO;  LA SEÑORA LETICIA DESEA TENER MAS COMODIDAD EN SU HOGAR Y POR MEDIO DE ESTA REPARACION LO LOGRARA.
texts.en:
LETICIA C. A. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit. Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families' incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home. Leticia is a single, older woman who supports herself through her pension and the four small homes that she rents. She is asking for a loan to repair the roof of her house and make it waterproof as in this season of rain and hail her roof has been getting damaged little by little. Leticia wishes to be more comfortable in her home and by completing this repair she will be.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and waterproof the roof of her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy sugar, rice, flour, oil, soap, toilet paper, condensed milk, eggs

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es:
La señora Pastora T. es de la ciudad de San Estanislao tiene 58 años de edad esta casada con el señor Mario Fretes Ramírez de 61 años de edad.

Tiene una despensa bien surtida en su domicilio particular, con clientela ya formada y un buen ingreso, ya que tiene buenos tratos con los clientes.

Gracias al crédito otorgado por la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva, la cliente Pastora T., ha invertido su crédito en la compra de mercaderías para la venta en su despensa como azúcar, harina, aceite, productos enlatados, entre otros, logrando así un mayor ingreso en sus ventas.

Su proyecto para el futuro es habilitar un mini mercado en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pastora T. is from the city of San Estanislao, is 58 years old, married to 61 year old Mr. Mario Fretes Ramírez. She has a well stocked convenience store in her home, with a client base and good income, as she has good relationships with her customers. Thanks to the loan from the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva, Pastora has invested her loan in the purchase of merchandise to sell in her store such as sugar, flour, oil, canned goods, among others, in this way achieving a greater income in her sales. Her project for the future is to put a mini market in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Products to sell in her store such as sugar, flour, oil, canned goods, and other merchandise

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El señor Santiago González es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Monte Alto, esta casado con la señora Carmen Bonifacia Portillo, tienen casa propia, con 2 hijos, ya mayores de edad que trabajan en forma independiente.

 Tienen un Hospedaje en su domicilio particular, con clientela formada, tiene buenos ingresos, buenas referencias comerciales y personales. La mayoría de los clientes que van a su hospedaje son extranjeros que visitan la ciudad.

El señor Santiago es muy trabajador y muy conocido por la zona de Santani, su negocio tiene una antigüedad de 27 años.

      Quiere construir otro hospedaje en otra zona céntrica de la ciudad, es por ello que está solicitando el crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Santiago González is from the city of San Estanislao, Monte Alto neighborhood, he’s married to Mrs. Carmen Bonifacia Portillo, they have their own home, and two grown children who work and are independent. They have a hostel (provide lodging) in their home, with a steady clientele, they have good income, good commercial and personal references. The majority of their guests are foreigners visiting their city. Santiago is hard working and well known in the Santani area, he has had this business for 27 years. He wants to construct another lodging in another central zone of the city, and that is why he is asking for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of lodging

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana María tiene 42 años, enviudó hace 1 año nada más y vive con dos de sus hijos ya que tuvo cuatro en total. Las otras dos hijas ya son mayores e independientes y se encuentran trabajando en España. Desde allí le envían dinero todos los meses.

Provenía de una familia muy humilde, por tal motivo solo pudo terminar la primaria.

Ana María posee una despensa muy bien surtida que funciona en su casa hace 3 años, aunque se dedica al comercio desde hace mucho tiempo, prácticamente toda la vida.

Recuerda que sus inicios como comerciante fueron muy duros y que con mucho esfuerzo pudo hacerse de capital para montar su propio negocio.

Hoy día cuenta con una clientela muy bien formada y prácticamente no tiene competencia debido a que su despensa es la única del barrio.

En esta oportunidad necesita de un préstamo para surtir mejor su negocio con la compra de mercaderías varias como: arroz, azúcar, harina, fideos, panificados, etc.
texts.en:
Ana María is 42 years old, widowed for 1 year and she lives with two of her four children. The other two daughters are now grown and independent, working in Spain. From there they send money to Ana María every month. She comes from a humble family and could only finish primary school. Ana María has owned a well-stocked convenience store in her home for 3 years, although she has been in sales for much longer, practically her whole life. She remembers her beginnings as a businesswoman were very hard and that with great effort she was able to earn money to start her own business. Today she has a well established customer base and practically no competition as her store is the only one in the neighborhood. Now she needs a loan to better stock her business with the purchase of various merchandise such as: rice, sugar, flour, noodles, baked goods, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, flour, noodles, baked goods, etc.

loans.name: Elda Karina

texts.es:
Elda Karina inicio su negocio de venta de granos básicos y artículos de primera necesidad en el año 1990, su idea fue apoyar en los ingresos económicos a su esposo.  Tiene dos hijos pequeños los cuales todavía no estudian, pero desea darles la mejor educación posible.
Con el dinero que ha ganado y ahorrado en su negocio también puso una venta de tortillas.
El préstamo lo necesita para invertir en mercaderías y poder ampliar su tienda de productos de primera necesidad.  También quiere ampliar su negocio de tortillas.
Hasta ahora ha tenido mucho éxito en sus negocios y espera poder seguir creciendo, considerando que cada día la situación económica del país es mas dura.
Uno de sus sueños es en el futuro construir y mejora su casa.
texts.en:
Elda Karina started her business of selling basic grains and items of basic necessity in 1990. Her idea was to support her husband with the household income. She has two small children who are still in school and wishes to give them the best education possible. With the money that she has earned and saved from her business, she has been able to start another business selling tortillas.

The loan is needed to invest in merchandise and be able to expand her shop of items of basic necessity. She also want to expand her tortilla business as well. Until now, she has been successful at her businesses and she hopes to keep on growing, considering that every day the economic situation of the country gets tougher. One of her dreams is to be able to build and improve her home in the future.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Be able to buy merchandise for her shop and expand her tortilla shop.

loans.name: Salvadora Natividad

texts.es: La microempresaria Salvadora Natividad R. S.  es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos menores de edad, cabe señalar que los servicios básicos, alimentación, vestimenta y educación son pagados con el único ingreso  de su negocio. La microempresaria tiene 19 años  de experiencia en la transformación del oro y la plata en aretes, anillos, pulseras y cadenas. Sus clientes son padres de familia de esta ciudad de Bluefields que la prefieren porque tiene precios accesibles. Este es el segundo crédito que solicita la Sra. R. para comprar: 40   gramos de oro a $ 10.00 dólares el gramo, 10 gramo de plata a $ 7.00 dólares el gramo, 5 unidades de piedra para decorar los anillos a $ 10.00 dólares cada piedra y 1 galón de gasolina a $ 5.00 dólares, con esta inversión podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes
texts.en:
Small businesswoman Salvadora Natividad R. S. is originally from the city of Bluefields. She is 45 years old, single mother of three children, and she shares that the basic services, food, clothing, and education are paid for only with the income from her business. She has 19 years of experience in transforming gold and silver into earrings, rings, bracelets and chains. Her customers are parents in Bluefields who prefer her because she has accessible prices. This is her second loan, and she plans on buying: 40 grams of gold at $10/gram, 10 grams of silver at $7/gram, 5 units of stone to decorate the rings at $10/each stone and 1 gallon of gasoline at $5. With this investment she will be able to meet her customer’s demands.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy gold, silver, stones and gasoline

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
Maria Victoria inicio su negocio de venta de golosinas, galletas, sodas y artículos de consumo diario hace cuatro años.
Ella nos cuenta que gracias a Dios el negocio que tiene en su casa, esta muy cerca de la Escuela de la Aldea de Cruz Blanca, y por eso empezó a vender cuadernos, crayones y hojas de papel.   Sus clientes le empezaron a pedir hilos para la elaboración de güipiles, servilletas, herrajes y otras prendas típicas de vestir. Con el paso del tiempo su negocio ha venido creciendo, hoy en día la venta de cuadernos escolares y hojas de papel, se ha convertido en una pequeña venta de útiles escolares.  También su venta de hilos ha ido creciendo, ya que vende hilos de varias clases y precios.

Gracias a Dios ella dice que en la escuela le están haciendo pedidos de gomas de mascar, galleras y toda variedad de dulces y golosinas.  Por esta demanda de sus clientes ella necesita más capital, y quiere prepararse ya que pronto será la época navideña, y es una buena época para vender otra clase de productos de esa temporada.
Ella desea aumentar sus ventas y negocios.

loans.use: Compra de productos para venta en su tienda.  Dulces, golosinas y utiles escolares.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
Maria Victoria inicio su negocio de venta de golosinas, galletas, sodas y artículos de consumo diario hace cuatro años.
Ella nos cuenta que gracias a Dios el negocio que tiene en su casa, esta muy cerca de la Escuela de la Aldea de Cruz Blanca, en San Juan Sacatepequez, y por eso empezó a vender cuadernos, crayones y hojas de papel, para los niños de la escuela.   Ademas otros clientes le empezaron a pedir hilos para la elaboración de güipiles, servilletas y otras prendas típicas de vestir para mujeres. Con el paso del tiempo su negocio ha venido creciendo, hoy en día con la venta de cuadernos y hojas de papel, se ha convertido su negocio en una pequeña venta de útiles escolares.  También su venta de hilos ha ido creciendo, ya que vende hilos de varias clases y precios.

Gracias a Dios ella dice que en la escuela le están haciendo pedidos de gomas de mascar, galleras y toda variedad de dulces y golosinas.  Por esta demanda de sus clientes ella necesita más capital, y quiere prepararse ya que pronto será la época navideña, y es una buena época para vender otra clase de productos de esa temporada.
Ella desea aumentar sus ventas y negocios.
texts.en:
Maria Victoria started her business selling candy, cookies, drinks and groceries in general 4 years ago. She tells us that thank God her home business is very near by the School of the Cruz Blanca, in San Juan Sacatepequez, and therefore she started selling books, crayons and paper to the kids in the school. Also, other clients started asking her for threads to create güipiles, napkins and other traditional clothes. So today she also sells school supplies and threads of different classes as her business has grown with time. Thank God she says the school is also requesting chewing gum and all kind of candies. Because of her client’s high demand, she needs more capital and wants to be ready for Christmas season, and sell Christmas products. She wants to increase her sales and business.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To Buy products for her grocery store. Candy and school supplies.

loans.name: Sanan

texts.en: Sanan was born in 1962 and lives in Baku city. He is married and has two children. Sanan started a cafe business ten years ago. Now, he needs a loan of $1200 to improve his cafe to provide his clients with the best service.

loans.use: To improve his cafe

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en: Ramiz was born in 1955 and lives in Baku city. He is married and has two children. Ramiz has been in a taxi business for 15 years. Now, he needs a loan of $825 to buy spare parts for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Gardashkhan

texts.en: Gardashkhan has been in a water sales business for 15 years. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Kalbadjar region in Azerbaijan and has settled in Baku city. Gardashkhan is married and has two children. He needs a loan of $1200 to buy spare parts for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Nailya

texts.en: Nailya was born in 1956 and is a widow with two children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Fuzuli town and has settled in Baku city. Nailya has been in a consulting business for four years and now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy a computer for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Muqaddas

texts.en: Muqaddas Baji is the wife of M. and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi food. She has been living in this city for the last 11 years. She is the mother of four children: two daughters and two sons. Her elder son provides a cable network in the community and out of the community. He has been in this business for the last seven years. Muqaddas Baji's husband drives a donkey cart for hauling. Muqaddas Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy wires for her son's cable network business.

loans.use: To buy wires for cable network business

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia Baji is the wife of M. H. and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi food. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 3 years. She is the mother of six children: two daughters and four sons. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood.

Razia Baji's husband is a tailor by profession. He stitches babies' dresses (pants, shirts) particularly. He has been in this profession for the last 9 years. Razia Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy a sewing machine for her husband.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis Baji is the wife of A. M. and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi food. She has been living in this city for the last 7 years. She lives with her family in a two-room brick house. She is the mother of seven children: three daughters and four sons. Her first two sons and her daughters are enrolled in a local school in her community.

Nargis Baji's husband drives a donkey cart for hauling purpose. Nargis Baji has a business of cosmetics selling with 3 years of experience. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more cosmetics (make-up kits, shampoos) to resell.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to resell

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida Baji is the wife of M. Jamil and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi food. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 30 years. She is the mother of four sons. All of her sons are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood.

Khalida Baji's husband has a spare parts shop. He has been running this shop for the last 20 years. Khalida Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more spare parts for her husband's shop.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts

loans.name: Zamurd

texts.en:
Zamurd Baji is the wife of M. Aslam and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi food. She has been living in this city for the last 30 years. She lives with her family in a two-room brick house. She is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. None of her children goes to school.

Zamurd Baji's husband has a garments business. He buys the garments from a famous big market of Lahore named "Azam Market" and sells them in his own shop. He has been in this profession for the last 20 years. Zamurd Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more garments to expand her husband's garments business.

loans.use: To buy more garments to resell

loans.name: Ameena

texts.en:
Ameena baji is the wife of R. A. and lives in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi food. She has been living in this city for the last 30 year. She lives with her family in a two -room brick house. She is the mother of three daughters. All of her daughters are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood.

Ameena baji's husband has a business of helmet-selling. Her husband chose this work because in Pakistan it's compulsory to wear a helmet when riding a motor bike. He has been in this business for the last 20 years. Ameena baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more helmets for her husband's business.

loans.use: To buy more helmets to re-sell

loans.name: Najat

texts.en:
Najat is married with one child, who is just two months old. She is a clothes seller. She works every day from 8 am to 6 pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Najat is now looking for a loan to buy more clothes for resale in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale to expand her business.

loans.name: Rika

texts.en:
Rika is married with one child, who is 22 years old. Rika is a clothing and juice seller. She works every day from 7 am to 6 pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

Rika is now requesting a loan to increase her current stock for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To increase her current stock to expand her business.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem Baji is the wife of Mr. S. and a mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. She lives in a small city named Chichawatni, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 20 years. Her elder son is in kindergarten. Her husband is a wheat seller and has been in this profession for the last 10 years. Naseem Baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She used that loan for her husband's wheat business. Now she is applying for a loan again for her husband's wheat business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Mukhtaran Baji wants a loan to buy material (cloth, thread) for her decorative embroidery business. Munawar Baji wants a loan to buy edible things (packets of chips) to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more wheat to resell

loans.name: Josephine's Fine Foods Group

texts.en:
Josephine is 27 years old, and she is single. She has been a food seller since July 2008. Every day, she works from 6am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.
